loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa E. is a 39-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Sitio Macasayang, Brgy Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Marissa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for three years now and earns a living by running a buy-and-sell livestock business.		
				
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also functions as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
		
About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase a solar lantern

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde is involved in renting services. She rents chairs and tables to her customers. She hopes to expand her business.  She is 42 years old, married with 3 children. Yetunde’s eldest is 12 years old. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more chairs and tables to rent.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chair and tables

loans.name: Warumi Group

texts.en:
Meet Bahati K. and the Warumi Group. Bahati is 29 years old and married with two children, an 11 year-old son and a 7 year-old daughter. She also supports her 19 year-old sister who is in high school.  Bahati has been running a small shop for two years and it is doing quite well. She has two employees, and the business is open daily from 7 am until midnight.  She earns about $700 in profit.  She has already repaid one loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and used it to purchase drinks, chips, and other inventory items for her shop.  Bahati will use this loan to restock beer, spirits, and soda at her shop, since these sell quickly. As her profits increase, Bahati plans to move her shop from its current rented space into a new location that she owns, and also to build a new home for her family.

Bahati is a member of the Warumi Group, whose 18 members run a variety of businesses including selling eggs, chicken, fuel and food. Members hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. Bahati is in the back of the photo, raising her hand.

loans.use: Restocking alcohol, beer and soda for sale at her general store.

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal BOLIVIA. Se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.

Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. 
Un ejemplo claro es Teodora Celia S. Q. de 43 años, que trabaja con la familia de Pro Mujer hace 5 años se dedica a vender  productos de belleza como cremas, pefumes y otros  a diferentes oficinas, mercados y ofreciendo puerta a puerta. Ella tiene 4 hijos es casada y los ingresos del negocio le permite cubrir necesidades básicas de su familia.
Por otro lado a Teodora Celia le gusta asistir al consultorio para hacerse una revisión general.

En esta oportunidad esta solicitando $us.- 500 el mismo tiene planificado invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos.

Las demás integrantes de este asociación tienen diferentes negocios que se dedican a la producción, servicio y comercio y necesitan el prestamo para invertir en los mismos.
texts.en:
The Bolivia Communal Association meets every two weeks at the Exaltación Community Center. They decided to form a group in order to access the capital needed to improve their businesses. The members of this association have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors. One example is Teodora Celia S. Q.. She is 43 years old and has been working with the Pro Mujer family for five years. Celia sells beauty products such as crèmes, perfumes, and other products at different office buildings, markets, and door to door. She is married and has four children, so the income from her business enables her to cover the basic needs of her family. Teodora Celia also enjoys the benefit of going to the medical clinic in order to receive a general check-up. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a large quantity of products for her business. As mentioned earlier, the other members of this association work in manufacturing, services, and retail, so they need a loan to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie M. is from the barangay of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years of age, married to Camilo M., a motorcycle for hire driver, with an average income of 150 Philippine pesos (PHP) daily. They were blessed with one infant child. Margie operates a sari-sari (general) store and dried fish dealing business. Aside from that, she is earning support from her husband especially in terms of their basic needs. Her main source of income comes from her sari-sari store and dried fish dealing business. Margie has been engaged in this kind of business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Margie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Margie is now requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for her sari-sari store and dried fish dealing business. The remaining amount also will be used for house renovation. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Margie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and savings for her child education in the future.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store and dried fish vending businesses; home renovation

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
Alaisha is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (brothers and sisters).  She owns a stall where she sells fruits and vegetables like onions, tomatoes, and Irish potatoes.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and boxes of tomatoes, onions and pineapples. She has been in this business for four years.  

Besides this food business, she also owns four rooms for renting.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include the transportation of sacks of onions and Irish potatoes from Nakawa to Kisaasi market where she has her stall. She wants to see her business grow and start selling on a wholesale basis only.  

Alaisha joined MCDT because she wanted additional capital for her business.  She rents and resides in a two-room house where the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, boxes of tomatoes. onions and pineapples

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en: Ochirbat P. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hovd province, western of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is retired and his son is unemployed. Ochirbat makes locks and sells them at a local market. He and his wife began their business in 2003 and the couple works hard to provide for their family's quality of life. Ochirbat is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more spare parts for their business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and supplies.

loans.name: Gordwin

texts.en:
Gordwin is a married man and has no children. He has been operating a motorcycle business (a boda boda) for the last six years, passersby being his potential customers. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. In addition he runs a cosmetic shop to also contribut to his of livelihood. 

Gordwin faces the major challenge of transport costs being high in terms of purchasing petrol. His major goal is to be self reliant in future. He decided to work with Yehu to get financial support to boost his business. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel M. sells costume jewelry and boils fresh corn to sell at Takoradi. Mabel has received junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Mabel has been in this business for some time now. She responsibly helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to reinvest back into her costume jewelry business.

loans.use: buy more corn to cook for sale

loans.name: Burul Apsamatova's Group

texts.en:
People always want to experience something new, to discover the world, to uncover secrets.  Humanity is always anxious for success. Even in developing countries where in order to achieve, one should make every effort, people hope for the best. 

Burul A. is 55, a widow and is leader of the group. Now her children are most important in supporting her. Her daughter is a saleswoman in a sausage shop, while her daughter-in-law helps her to run a business. Seventeen years ago Burul began to earn money by sewing small orders for fellow villagers. She has finally seen some personal results from her efforts: she managed to buy a new electric sewing machine with the help of which she will sew national cloth and dressmaking supplies. With a loan Burul wants to buy a multi-logic sewing machine. Burul’s aim is to open sewing workshop.

Gulmira A. is the group treasurer. She is 41, married and has three children. Her husband is a guest worker in Russia. Besides selling towels in the market, she gets some material support from her older children. With a loan she would like to increase her commodity’s circulation and to buy more towels to sell. In the future Gulmira is planning to open her own private shop. 

Daniyar M., 27, is married and has two infants. Six years ago he decided to start a private enterprise in Taras, Kazakhstan, breeding cattle. Now he is working in the wholesale and retail towel trade. His loan purpose is to increase his working capital.

Aiymkan A., 36, is marriedand runs her business by herself because her husband is working in Russia. She makes a profit from sewing items by request. In the past she was a saleswoman of children’s clothes in Bishkek. She has managed to buy an auto and some cattle. The purpose of her loan is to buy more material for sewing. Aiymkan wishes to see her dream of building a new house come true.

About Mol Bulak Finance:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Tunka Group

texts.es:
Las señoras del banco D. emprendimiento Tunka se e encuentran en la zona D. Achumani exactamente la meseta D. Achumani, entraron a su séptimo ciclo , la mesa directiva cumple sus funciones las  organizan y dirigen las recuperaciones, las reuniones se realizan en la meseta D. Achumani. Una mayoría D. las socias  son dueñas D. casa  se conocen ya hace muchos años .todas la integrantes del grupo  cuentas con buenas referencias, son  responsables  y puntuales con sus pagos.
La señora placida es la Presidenta del banco ella costura polleras y enaguas hace un trabajo muy hermoso, por tal motivo tiene muchos clientes por la zona, donD. se realizan fiestas casi cada semana, con el crédito otorgado comprara telas por mayor, para realizar varios pedidos, es trabajadora y muy responsable razón por la cual fue elegida presidenta D. este banco D. emprendimiento. 
Todas las socias del banco tienen como actividad el comercio y servicio, razón por la cual solicitan el crédito ya que invertirán en  incrementar su capital D. trabajo, están muy agradecidas con Emprender por la confianza que les brinda.En la foto aparece el esposo D. una d elas socias.
texts.en:
The women of the Tunka community bank live in the Achumani area on the Achumani plain. This is their seventh loan cycle. The board of directors organizes and oversees the loan payments. They meet on the Achumani plain. Most of the members are housewives who have known each other for many years; all of them come well-recommended and are responsible and punctual in their payments. Placida is the bank's president. She sews lovely skirts and petticoats, and she has many clients in the area, where there are festivals almost every week. With this loan, she will buy cloth to fulfill various orders. She is a hard worker, which is why she was chosen as the group's president. All members of the bank work in trading and service. They are all using the loans to increase their working capital. They are very grateful to microfinance partner Emprender for placing its trust in them. The man in the photo is the husband of one of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Taikoh Ole

texts.en:
Taikoh is married and has three children whom he supports. Taikoh was introduced to KADET through a credit officer; he is serving his first loan and has not joined any other MFI. 

Taikoh has been in the butchery business for six years. His business is located in a busy open air market. As the region's population is large, the business attracts many customers. With this loan, Taikoh will enlarge his butchery, by buying an oven to prepare roast meat and tables and seats for customers to use as they eat. With the extra profits, Taikoh will purchase land. He hopes to stop paying rent and own land where he will build his home and his business premises. Taikoh believes he is hardworking.

loans.use: to enlarge his butchery, by buying an oven, tables and seats

loans.name: Claveles X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  CLAVELES X porque así se llama  la calle principal de donde viven y así mismo, comentan que son parecidas debido a la belleza de la misma. El grupo pertenece al estado de Puebla y está  formado por 11 personas.La Presidenta del grupo es doña Mercedes F. tiene 41 años,  estudio únicamente la primaria, se dedica a la venta de zapatos y cosméticos. Tiene dos hijos, ella  es una mujer que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad y carencias por falta de preparación educativa, el  crédito lo ocupará para realizar pedidos de los productos que vende, las señoras la conocen desde hace tiempo saben que trabaja, es una persona honesta y quiere salir adelante. La Señora  Irma V. es la Tesorera de grupo,  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y lencería desde hace 3 años,  solo estudio la primaria tiene 2 hijos, la señora siempre ha trabajado y le gusta salir adelante por ella y sus hijos, para darles una mejor calidad de vida, las señoras la recomiendan porque nunca han tenido problema  alguno con ella y la conocen desde hace tiempo por que radican en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is called “Claveles X” (Carnations) because that is the name of the main Street where they live.  The members say that they are alike because of their beauty.  The group is in the state of Puebla, and it is comprised of 11 people.  

Mercedes F. is the president of the group.  She is 41 years old, and she only has an elementary school education.  She sells shoes and cosmetics.  She has two children.  She is a woman who has gotten ahead while facing adversity and the lack of education.

She will use the loan to fill orders for the products that she sells.  The women have known her for quite a while.  They know that she works, is an honest person, and she wants to get ahead.

Irma V. is the treasurer of the group.  She has been selling shoes and lingerie for three years.  She only has an elementary school education.  She has two children.  She has always worked. She likes to get ahead for herself and her children in order to give them a better quality of life.  The women recommend her because they have never had a problem with her.  They have known her for quite a while because they are from the same community.

loans.use: To make orders and buy merchandise

loans.name: Gina Aracely

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

Para  la señora Gina es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por sobre todas las cosas la responsabilidad del grupo, ella es la secretaria del Banco. Tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y13 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en el colegio. Su marido trabaja en una empresa.

Tiene un negocio de cibert cabinas, donde ofrece servicios de llamadas telefónicas e internet. Además también vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 21h00 y sus productos los vende en su local ya que sus clientes siempre llegan allí, deja a crédito y sale a cobrar los días domingos.

Este crédito es para incrementar el negocio de ventas de Yanbal así como también poner un negocio de ventas de refrescos en su local. Su sueño es tener un carro para poder trasladarse.
texts.en:
In the town of La California de Portoviejo, capital of Manabí and known for many years as the city of the regal tamarind, the members of the Rio de Oro cooperative bank reunite every fifteen days.

For Gina, this is her third cycle with the cooperative bank, and what she likes the most is the responsible nature of the group, for which she serves as Secretary.  She is 46 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children ages 16 and 13; her children are in school.  Her husband works at a company.

She has a cyber-cafe business, where she offers telephonic and Internet services.  In addition, she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day from 8 am until 11 pm, selling her products from her location since the customers always come there.  She sells on credit, and goes out to collect payments on Sundays.

This loan is to grow her Yanbal sales business, and also to install a business selling beverages at her locale.  Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy Yanbal cosmetics and accessories.  To open a business selling beverages.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de las Mercedes nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Laurelty,  fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Leonor O., presidenta del grupo tiene 46 años, ella esta domiciliada es de Laurelty, es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora y trabaja en el mercado 4 como vendedora de ropas.
Ella posee un puesta en ese mercado frente a las galarias mas concurridas del lugar y de esa forma expone sus mercaderias y ofrece a los clientes que visitan el lugar.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas y juguetes para la epoca navideña ya que quiere estar preparada para esa epoca con todas las mercaderia que el cliente busca para comprar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen de las Mercedes" came into being through the management and support of another group that was working in the same area.

This group is from Laurelty, and their goal is for each member to achieve growth, both on a social and financial basis.  These women are known in the area to be very hardworking women.

Leonor O., 46, is the president of the group.  She is from Laurelty, and is an enterprising and innovative woman who works in the "Mercado 4" market selling clothing.  She has a stall in this market in front of one of the busiest shopping malls in the area, and in this way she exhibits her merchandise and offers her clothing for sale to the customers who visit this area.

She requests this loan to buy clothing and toys for the Christmas season, since she wants to be prepared for this season with all of the merchandise that her customers are looking to buy.

loans.use: to buy clothing and toys

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gestrudes; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de picantería (es como un restaurant pero más tradicional),ella prepara comida y también ven de cerveza y chicha (bebida a base de maíz),la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia prepara diferentes platos de comida que son tradicionales de la ciudad de Cusco como chicharrones, cuy al horno, lechón y entre otros platos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne y verduras.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropa, restaurant, locutorio, transporte y venta de cosméticos.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal bank which is located in Cusco district belonging to Cusco province, Cusco department.

Gertrudis, 56, is single and has three children.  She has a “picantería” (like a restaurant only more traditional).  She prepares food and sells beer and chicha (a beverage made from corn).  She works from 10am until 8pm.  She prepares different dishes that are traditional to the city of Cusco like chicharrones (fried pork), cuy al horno (roasted guinea pig), and lechón (roasted piglet), among others.  She wants to improve the business and is asking for funds to buy ingredients, like meat and vegetables, to cook.

The other group members sell clothes, run restaurants, run public telephone booths and sell cosmetics.

She is grateful to all those people who share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, like meat and vegetables, to cook.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with two children. She is a entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. Nadezhda runs a small clothing sales business. She sells men’s and women’s knitted wear in the central marketplace of her home town. Nadezhda has been working in this business for 5 years. She has invested 40,000 Grivnyas in merchandise. Her net profit amounts to 5,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 11,700 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise. Warm winter clothing always sells better in the cold season. Nadezhda is expecting a usual increase in customer demand and better sales as a result. One of her long-term business plans is to purchase a vehicle for business purposes.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He represents the only income source for his family. He has worked as a gypsum specialist for 14 years and in 2001, he decided to open a small gypsum shop. He obtained a Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with punctual payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products and utensils for his shop so he can work in a more professional way to increase his sales and thus his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products and utensils

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo M. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 34 years old. Leonilo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonilo owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing auto repair and vulcanizing services to local community members. Leonilo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Leonilo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Leonilo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en:
Consesa A. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Consesa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests flowers for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Consesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business.

Consesa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita P. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Merlita owns and operates a specialized retail store, dealing and selling clothing and shoes from NATASHA, AVON & MSE  in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as blouses and t-shirts, to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from Dipolog City. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Lolita owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is 42 years old, married and has five school-aged children. She is from the village of Manila Group within Wao municipality, a part of Lanao del Sur province on the Mindanao islands. Teresita runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she buys and sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and beverages to the local community. Teresita has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and obtain some working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, her second from HSPFI, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como ovejas chivos, chanchos y aves de corral. Guarda los animales en corrales ubicados en un terreno cerca de su casa. Santiago compra los animales en los anexos de la zona para luego engordarlos y venderlos en la ciudad de Olmos o enviarlos a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años en este rubro. Desea ampliar su ganado con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Espera poder incrementar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos. Con sus ingresos,  desea hacer unos arreglos a su casa. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is 32 years old, married, with 4 young children.  He lives in his own home in the Olmos district, a very busy commercial and agricultural area; Olmos is located in the Lambayeque province about an hour and a half from Chiclayo.  Currently, Santiago does not have water and electricity in his home.

He works raising and selling small animals like sheep, pigs, and chickens.  He keeps the animals in pens and coops on some land close to his home.  He buys the animals on the outskirts of the city and then takes the time to fatten them up and sell them in Olmos or send them to Chiclayo for sale.  He has worked in this business for 5 years.  He would like to expand his business by buying more animals and well-balanced animal feed.  In order to do so, he is requesting a $725 loan from Edpyme Alternative.  He hopes to increase his sales to improve his income.  He will use his increased income to fix his home.  He dreams of providing a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and well-balanced feed.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en:
Nyame I. has 10 children to support. She is married to a farmer and supplements his income by selling palm oil in the Mfuom Village, which is near Abura town. She has been in this business for more than eight years. 

Nyame intends to grow her business and improve her income. Her Kiva loan will help her purchase more palm fruit for oil extraction and increase her sales. She plans to apply any additional savings to her children’s tertiary education.

Nyame is pictured standing close to the boiling palm fruit.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for oil extraction and increase her sales.

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.es:
Karina de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive solo en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios  de agua, y luz solamente, ubicada en el asentamiento humano  Víctor Raul Haya de la Torre, que pertenece al departamento Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo .
Karina se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales  (gallinas, pavos, pollos y chanchos), el corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso óptimo en los diferentes mercados del departamento de Lambayeque;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.
El crédito que ha solicitado Karina es de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra de animales, alimentos balanceados y para la ampliación de su corral donde se encuentran sus animales para que se crien más cómodos, con la finalidad de que sus animales engorden y pueda venderlos a un buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo  le ayudara  a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Karina es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
Karina is 26, single, and lives alone in her own house with running water and light, in the neighborhood of Víctor Raul Haya de la Torre, Lambayeque.  This region's main industries include agriculture, cattle herding and tourism.
Karina raises and sells domestic animals  (poultry, turkeys, and pigs).  The corral is in back of her house, and special feed ensures a balanced diet.  Once the animals are fully grown and of optimal weight, she sells them in different markets in Lambayeque; in this way she increases her profits and obtains what she needs for her house.
Karina seeks a credit of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa; with this she will buy more animals, special feed and will enlarge the corral to raise her animals for market and fetch higher prices.  In this way she will repay her credit on time and at the same time improve her standard of living.  Karina is very hard-working and proactive in achieving her goals.

loans.use: To buy domestic animals, special feed and enlarge their corral

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 28 years old. Rowelyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rowelyn  raises livestock, primarily buying and raising pigs for sell. Rowelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Rowelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rowelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Joan Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "JOAN", ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO D. MÉXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES Y ES L. PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN PRESTAMO. L. SEÑORA LAURA ES UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO TIENE 31 AÑOS D. EDAD, ESTUDIO L. PRIMARIA, ES CASADA, TIENA 3 HIJOS D. 10,8,Y 3 AÑOS RESPECTIVAMENTE. ELL. SE DEDICA A L. COMERCIALIZACION D. ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO DESD. HACE 3 AÑOS, SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA ADQUIRIR CATALOGOS D. TEMPORADA Y ALGUNOS PEDIDOS QUE TIENE PENDIENTES. SUS CLIENTES COMENTAN QUE LES AGRADA COMPRAR CON ELL. PORQUE SIEMPRE ENTREGA TODO A TIEMPO, ES MUY AMABLE Y MUY RESPONSABLE. AL MOMENTO D. SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE CON MUCHOS ANIMOS PARA CONTINUAR INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE LE AYUDARA A SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO, TENER MÁS CLIETES. ESPERA TAMBIEN AHORRAR D. LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA PARA BRINDARLES UNA CARRERA PROFESIONAL A SUS HIJOS Y ASÍ LOGREN TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group, known as "Joan", is located in the state of Mexico. The group is maD. up of 10 members and this is their first time requesting a loan. 

One member of the group is Laura, 31 years old. She completed primary school, is married and has 3 children ages 10,8 and 3. For three years she has been selling shoes from catalogs. She is requesting a loan to get seasonal catalogs and place some pending orders. Her customers tell her that they like to buy from her because she always gets things to them on time, and is very friendly and responsible. At this time, she feels very motivated to continue investing in her business since it will help her to continue investing and to have more clients. She also hopes to save some of her earnings to put towards her children's professional careers so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: For the past 10 years, Rakia has been cooking food to sell near a school. She cooks foods like wakye and rice. She serves these foods with tomato sauce, spaghetti, meat and others at Abura. She is married and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy beans, rice, meat and others. She hopes to use reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, meat and other items.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15, 10 años de edad; La socia se dedica  al comercio minorista, la socia tiene un stand en el mercado y ella compra y vende papa helada, también la socia cría animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, los cría en casa y una vez que estos se reproducen y que están actos para la venta ella los ofrece al por mayor a sus diferentes clientes dueños de restaurantes y quintas criollas; La socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Fanny, 38, is a member of the “Sumac Ayllu” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and three children who are 17, 15 and 10 years of age.  She is a retailer.  She has a stand in the market.  She’s a frozen potato merchant.  She also raises small farm animals like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs at home and when they reproduce and they are ready for sale she sells them at wholesale to various restaurant owners and Creole country houses.  She wants the loan to buy small farm animals, like chickens and guinea pigs, at wholesale.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and at the same time commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals, like chickens and guinea pigs, at wholesale.

loans.name: 17 Ngô Quyền Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lan has a business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain her business. Lan is 37 years old and married with two children. Lan lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Lan has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is lack of capital. In 2009, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids. She wants her children to do well in school and for her business to do well. Mrs. Lan is the leader of a six member group, the 17 Ngô Quyền Solidarity Group.

loans.use: to purchase materials for tailoring clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Sabougnouman  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe Sabougnouman 2  sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 38 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Moussokorobougou dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali: Ségou. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le niébé.
Madame Kadiatou (2ème debout à gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de complexe céréales, un sac d’urée, 25 kg d’arachide et se faire aider dans les activités de labour et de désherbage par la main d’œuvre masculine. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 2,5 hectares, elle espère produire 20 sacs d’arachide, 10 sacs de mil, 5 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production du mil et de niébé sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis que le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Sabougnouman 2 group are married women living predominantly in traditional extended households, and are on average 38 years old with 2 children. They all live in the town of Moussokorobougou in the rural district of Pelengana in the 4th administrative region of Mali: Ségou. They know each other through familial, marriage, and neighbourhood connections. With the goal of increasing their farming land, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first farming loan cycle. The group members are going to grow groundnuts, millet, and black-eyed peas.
Ms. Kadiatou (standing second from the left) intends to use her loan to buy 1 bag of complex cereals, 1 bag of urea, and 25 kg of groudnuts, and also to recruit male manual labour to help her with physical tasks and weeding. She gets her supplies of agricultural inputs at the Ségou market fair and hires manual labour from a group of young people in town. From her 2.5 hectares of land, she hopes to produce 20 sacks of groundnuts, 10 sacks of millet, 5 sacks of black-eyed peas, and greens. In addition to the greens from the black-eyed peas, a portion of the millet and black-eyed peas will be sold to manage the minor daily household expenses, while the rest will be consumed by the family itself.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, groundnut seeds, and male manual labour for physical activities and weeding.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanías.
La señora tiene una tienda de bordados, tejidos y teñidos, también se dedica a la crianza de ganados como ovinos, vacunos y porcinos.
Este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1900.00 nuevo soles, lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas, siete cajas de galletas y siete jabas de gaseosas para venderlos en las ferias, piensa aprovechar y así generar otros ingresos. También piensa invertir en la compra de lanas para su artesanía.
Su esposo trabaja en la venta de zapatos. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y mejorar los ganados para conseguir más ganancia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli," which is located in the Juli district, in the province of Chucuito and the department of Puno. She is 31 years old. She lives with her partner and has 2 children. She went to primary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she invested the money in her business, which is selling handicrafts.

She has a shop where she sells embroidery, weavings, and dyed items. She also raises animals such as sheep, cattle, and pigs.

She will invest this new loan of 1900 PEN in the purchase of candy, seven boxes of crackers, and seven crates of soft drinks to sell at the fairs. She is thinking of making good use of these opportunities and thus having another source of income. She is also thinking of buying more wool for her handicrafts.

Her husband sells shoes. Her dream is to improve her house and improve their livestock to obtain more earnings.

What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of the members.

loans.use: to buy candy, seven boxes of crackers, and seven crates of soft drinks to sell, and to buy wool in various colors for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Edimar

texts.en:
Edimar is 29 years old and has been a tricycle operator for almost three years. He is married and blessed with two children. His wife is currently working abroad as an OFW (overseas foreign worker), particularly in Singapore, just to improve their living conditions. Aside from the transportation business, he also works in the field every harvesting season for further improvement of their living standards. He does not just rely on the remittances from his wife.

He is requesting P5,000 to buy paints and steel parts, and for maintenance of his motor. He insists on providing good service to gain more customers for higher profits that will allow him to save for his children. He hopes to finish his children's education through his hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy paints and steel parts, and to maintain his motor

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es:
Carlos, es un agricultor, muy trabajador y esforzado por su familia, vive con su esposa, aun no tienen hijos, ambos trabajan y se colaboran para poder llevar las obligaciones del hogar, Carlos inicio muy joven con su padre.
Actualmente comprara abono para el cultivo, esta compra le permitirá tener el cuidado para el cultivo, fortaleciéndolo para que la producción sean mejor. El propósito de Carlos es que su trabajo cada día mejore, que puede establecer su vida con una condición económica más estable.
texts.en:
Carlos is a farmer who works very hard for his family.  He lives with his wife; they don't have any children yet.  They both have jobs and they work together to take care of their obligations at home.  Carlos began this work very young with his father.

Currently, he will buy fertilizer for his crop.  This purchase will allow him to take care of his crop, strengthening it so it will have a better yield.

Carlos' goal is for his business to improve every day so he will be able to establish his life with more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use on his crop

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable tiene 20 años de edad y tiene un niño pequeño, ella hace 2 años decidió emprender un negocio para ayudar a su esposo ya que con lo que gana el no les alcanza ya que es jornalero y esa actividad es muy mal pagada en su país. Maricela tiene una tienda donde vende un poco de abarrotes y dulces y esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que casi no tiene surtido y a ella le preocupa por que sus clientes casi no le van a comprar por no tener los productos que le piden. Dice que su tienda se le fue para abajo y ya no pudo surtirla como al principio por que su niño se le enfermo y tubo que agarrar dinero de la venta para poder llevarlo al medico y desgraciadamente ya no siguió invirtiendo y eso casi la lleva a la quiebra. Es por eso que Mari como le dicen de cariño quiere otra vez surtir su negocio y sacarlo adelante por que de ahí se ayudan para los gastos de su casa. Ella esta agradeciendo este crédito por que así le dan la oportunidad de poder tener una fuente de empleo.
texts.en:
Maricela is a very hardworking and responsible woman.  She is 20 years old and has a small child.  Two years ago she decided to start a business to help her husband because what he earns isn't enough for them, since he's a day laborer and that work is very poorly paid in their country.

Maricela has a store where she sells a little bit of provisions and sweets.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business since she has hardly any stock right now and she's worried that her customers won't buy anything from her because she doesn't have the products they request.

She says that her store went downhill on her and she couldn't stock it anymore like she could in the beginning because her child got sick and she had to take money from sales to be able to take him to the doctor.  Unfortunately, she stopped investing in the store and this almost bankrupted her.

That's why Mari, as she is called affectionately, wants to supply her business again and get ahead with it, so that they will help each other with the household expenses.

She is grateful for this loan because it gives her the opportunity to be able to have a source of work.

loans.use: to supply her store.

loans.name: Tackou Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité tackou liguéye a été créé le 16/06/2009.IL est composé de 20 femmes issues de la même zone.Elles ont pour activité principale  le commerce.

Madame oumou à l'extreme droite sur la photo en position assise,est la responsable du groupement.Elle est âgée de 42 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 06 enfants,en outre elle assure la garde deux autres enfants. 

Son activité consiste à la vente  des haricots  et des fruits.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience par rapport à ce type d'activité.

Son pret lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante de légumes et fruits pour faire face à la demande de sa clientéle.

Son objectif est de pouvoir faire de l'élevage bovine,assurer la scolarité et les frais médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Solidarity group "Tackou Liguéye" was established on June 16, 2009. It is made up of 20 women from the same area. Their main business is buying and selling.

Mrs. Oumou, sitting on the right in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 42 years old, married, and the mother of six children. In addition, she has custody of two other children.

Her business consists in selling beans and fruits, a field in which she has a good experience. Her loan will enable her to get supplies of vegetables and fruits in sufficient quantities to meet customer demand.

Her goal is to be able to raise cattle, and to be able to pay for her children's healthcare and school expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 39 years old, married with 6 children, aged 1 to 12 years old. He is the sole income earner in the family. His family's goal is to educate his children to the university level. Richard lives in his own house in Hoima, in Western Uganda. He has a butchery business, but before that he was a brick layer. Through brick laying, he saved the money that enabled him to start butchery business. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations of goats and cows, which are always on the rise, which in turn affect his cost projections. He is requesting a loan to buy goats and cows to sell at his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows to sell at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is married with two children.  Johna is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Johna is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for six years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase feed for the pigs. 

Johna has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Johna hopes to save money for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 13, 6 and 3. Cristina's husband is an NGO employee.

Cristina has a tricycle transportation business. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She does her best to support her family.

Cristina requested a loan to repair her tricycle and purchase new tires. Cristina hopes to be successful with her business.

loans.use: to repair her tricycle and purchase new tires

loans.name: José Baltazar

texts.es: José Baltazar  de 37 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su querida hija de 14 años la cual se encuentra estudiando. José se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa deportiva.  Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia.  Para José su hija lo es todo y es por ella que día a día se levanta muy temprano para trabajar y tener listo los pedidos los cuales son muy frecuentes y necesitan ser atendidos con rapidez. Es muy conocido en la zona ya que es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy delicado en su trabajo. Siempre le gusta mantener satisfechos a los clientes. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos, etc. de tal manera que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar su nivel de ventas y de ingresos. Además confía en Dios que los resultados serán favorables y logrará el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: José Baltazar, age 37, lives in his family home with his beloved 14 year old daughter, who is studying. José makes and sells sportswear. He has been in this business for many years and thus has a great deal of experience. For José, his daughter means everything to him, so it is for her that he gets up early each morning and goes out to work. He keeps a list of his orders which are most frequent, and those that need filled most urgently. He is well known locally as a hard-working, responsible man who is dedicated to his work. He always likes to keep his customers happy. He has taken the decision to seek a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in his business by buying fabric, thread, elastic, etc. In this way he will be able to expand, increase his sales and his income. He trusts in God that the investment will result in an improvement in quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
This is Haide, 35, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Glenn, a businessman. She is the mother of three children; all of them are still studying in elementary school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college, which is a dream for most Filipino parents like Haide as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Haide operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 215 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Haide dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Purusila

texts.en:
Purusila is 30 years old, married, with four children. Three of them are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Purusila is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is a supportive father of four and the owner of a great little store that carries just about everything: fruits and vegetables, household items, cleaning supplies, personal care products, cosmetics, paper supplies - basically everything one might need in his Iraqi town's neighborhood.   

In the past, Mahmud applied for, received and successfully repaid two loans from Relief International-Iraq. With the previous loans, he was able to purchase a freezer and a refrigerator, enabling him to carry fresh and frozen food items. 

Mahmud now took a loan of $1,400 USD from RI-Iraq to keep up the status of his store and keep providing more to his customers. The loan will enable him to carry more items and ensure a steady income for him and his family.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Milagro Isabel

texts.es:
Milagro, solicita un nuevo crédito con la intención de continuar en su negocio de hortalizas el cual cosecha: ejotes, pipián, chiles y tomates, para que este año sean mejores cosechas necesita comprar los insumos agrícolas para prevenirlo de las plagas como: herbicidas y abono; darles cada día mantenimiento.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque mejoro económicamente con su familia y los ingresos fueron mejores que los años anteriores.
texts.en:
Milagro is requesting a new loan to carry on her vegetable production activity, harvesting string beans, pipiánes (pipián is a variety of squash known as ‘cushaw’ in the United States), chili peppers and tomatoes. In order to gain better harvests this year she needs to protect them from blight by buying farm supplies such as weed-killers and manure that need to be provided daily to the crops.
Her previous loans have helped her because her family’s economic conditions have improved and her income has been better than in the past.

loans.use: To buy weed-killers and manure.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 27 years old and lives in San Vicente, Bajo,Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child. 

Joan has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this work. She has a requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. 

Joan has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Bougoura, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   TENEBA , 1ere assise de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 47, on average 4 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Bougoura, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Teneba, sitting on the far right of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 200 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Batholomeo

texts.en:
Batholomeo is a businessman, who owns a grocery store. He has been in business for four years, and he describes his business environment as "busy" and his customers as "very loyal." He is very hard-working. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business properly, and how to save.

He hopes to employ people in his business. Batholomeo needs a loan of 63,585 KES to buy watermelons, pawpaws, avocados, pineapples and bananas, for resale in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, pawpaws, avocados, pineapples and bananas, for resale in his grocery store.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia  lives in Bohol, Philippines together with her husband. All her children and grown and they work hard together to provide for themselves.  She is in the business of hog raising and poultry business for three  years now. 
Florencia  gives her best to earn a living in order to buy food, save and pay for household expenses. Her business provides her the income that she needs.
Florencia  wants to expand her business to generate more income but she needs additional money to make it. She is applied  for a loan at CEVI to buy feed and chicken. With the loan, Florencia  will be able to make her business sustainable and productive.
Florencia  wants to earn more so  she can take care of herself and her husband when they are older.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of poultry breed.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with one son. After school he worked as an engineer. This experience helped him start his own business. Vladimir runs a small workshop manufacturing iron railings, grates, fences, etc. He has been in this business since 1996. Vladimir was one of the first entrepreneurs working in this sphere of business in the region. His turnover capital currently amounts to $4,000. Vladimir is very orderly, punctual and determined. He has a team of three employees working for him. Top rate manufactured products and flexibility in working with clients have ensured the success of Vladimir’s enterprise. Eight loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have also contributed to expansion of his business. Vladimir would like to get a loan of $1,000 to purchase metal roll used in manufacturing ornamental ironwork. The loan will help him increase his sales and gain additional profit. Vladimir is planning to invest generated funds in a second workshop manufacturing iron gates, railings, frames, fire grates and pokers. Age-old craft coupled with contemporary design will make this ironwork very unique and suitable to any customer’s taste, environment and budget requirements. It should also be mentioned that Vladimir has been a loyal donor to the Ukrainian Association for the Visually Handicapped for several years. Funds generated by the business will allow him to provide more financial assistance to partially sighted and blind people ensuring that impaired vision does not result in an impaired life.

Володимир – одружений, в нього є син. Після університету, він працював інженером. Отриманий досвід допоміг йому почати власну справу. Володимир – власник невеличкої майстерні, він займається виробництвом металевих огорож, поруччя, гратів тощо ще з 1996 року. Володимир почав працювати в цій сфері бізнесу одним з перших серед інших підприємців. Його робочий капітал складає 4000 доларів. Володимир – дуже зібраний, пунктуальний та наполегливий. Він працює разом з трьома іншими чоловіками. Високоякісні вироби та гнучкість в роботі з клієнтами забезпечують успіх в роботі. Вісім позик, які Володимир отримав від „Надії України”, також сприяли зростанню його бізнесу. Володимир хотів би отримати позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб купити металопрокат, який використовується для виготовлення декоративних металевих виробів. Позика допоможе йому збільшити обсяг продажів та заробити додатковий прибуток. Володимир планує вкласти зароблені кошти в роботу другої майстерні з вироблення металевих воріт, поруччя, рамок, камінних решіток тощо. Стародавні технології у поєднанні з сучасним дизайном підкреслять неповторність кожного деталі. Широкий вибір виробів на будь-який смак стане по кишені кожному та прикрасить будь-яку оселю. Варто також додати, що Володимир – постійний спонсор Товариства Сліпих України. Тому він планує передати частину коштів, які отримає від своєї діяльності, на допомогу людям, які частково або повністю втратили зір. Ця фінансова підтримка допоможе багатьом з ним відчути на собі, що послаблений зір – це не перешкода для повноцінного життя.

loans.use: To purchase metal roll to produce railings

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata is an enterprising young woman.  She is 22-years old and runs a small shop in her Samoan village.  She maintains a variety of products inside her shop and prides herself on her ability to meet the varied needs of her customers.  She is passionate about being able to provide the best quality at the lowest prices in town.  Leata readily admits to being very happy with her business enterprise and proud of the fact that she can contribute a meaningful amount to her family’s income.  

Leata is applying for a loan to both purchase additional merchandise/inventory for re-sale in her store as well as purchase some paint and other materials to keep her store in good condition.

loans.use: Buy merchandise/inventory and store renovation materials

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona A. started her small business in 1995, when she purchased one cow. She is 52, married, and has four children. She applied for a $1000 loan to enlarge her business by purchasing one milk cow. She will begin to sell the milk to the local people.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos F. is 25 years old. He is single and doesn't have any kids. He lives in San Estanislao, a town that is about 5 kilometers away from the city of Santani. He owns a 15 hectare field where he raises cows for milk production and sales.

He worked with his father since he was really young. His father also raises farm animals. Three years ago he became independent and started with two cows that were given to him by his father. Nowadays he has eight Dutch cows.

He manages his own inn. His cows produce 90 liters of milk daily. He rises very early in the morning in order to milk the cows. He then travels to the city on his motorcycle to sell the milk. Carlos is also a physical education teacher at a local school.

Carlos is young and is very entrepreneurial. He wishes to continue progressing. Today, he is requesting a $1000 to invest in the construction of a better cow shed since the one he currently has is very precarious. He wants to construct a better and bigger cow shed since he has plans to continue expanding his business and purchase more cows in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos F. tiene 25 años, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en San Estanislao un pueblo que queda a 5 km de la ciudad de Santaní. Tiene un campo de 15 hectáreas donde cría vacas para la producción y venta de leche.

Trabajo al lado de su padre desde muy joven, su papá también se dedica a la cría de animales de granja. Hace tres años se independizo y comenzó con dos vacas que le dio su padre y hoy día ya cuenta con ocho vacas holandesas.

El es administra su propio tambo, sus vacas producen 90 litros de leche diarios, el se levanta bien temprano por las mañanas para ordeñar las vacas y luego va a la ciudad en su motocicleta a venderlas. Además de esta actividad, Carlos es profesor de educación física en un colegio de la zona.

Joven y emprendedor, Carlos desea seguir progresando. Hoy solicita un crédito de $ 1000 para invertirlos en la construcción de un mejor galpón, pues donde ahora tiene a sus vacas es muy precaria y desea construir uno mejor y más grande ya que tiene pensado seguir ampliando el negocio y adquirir más adelante más vacas.

loans.use: construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Joli

texts.id:
Although Ni Wayan Joli is a teacher’s wife, she doesn’t want to depend solely on her husband’s salary. Now she has a pig farming business. With initial capital of Rp. 800,000 (about $87), she bought 1 female pig, and she spends Rp. 10,000 (about $1) per day for the pig’s food. From this pig farming, she gains Rp. 400,000 (about $43.5) profit per 6 month from selling 4 piglets. This profit is used for her daily expenses. The loan from Dinari will be used for the pig’s food. She feeds the pigs twice a day every day in the morning and in the evening. Her house is built by hand on the ground with a quite permanent structure. She hopes after she gets the loan from Dinari, her business will gain more profit so her family will have better quality of life.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang guru, Ni Wayan Joli tidak mau hanya mengandalkan gaji dari suaminya saja. Terbukti saat ini Wayan Joli mempunyai usaha beternak babi. Dengan modal awal Rp. 800.000,- Wayan Joli dapat membeli 1 ekor induk babi, dan setiap hari Wayan Joli mengeluarkan biaya pakan Rp.10.000,- untuk babinya. Dari hasil beternak babi ini Wayan Joli setiap 6 bulan sekali memperoleh keuntungan Rp.400.000,- dari penjualan 4 ekor anak babinya. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari –hari. Pinjaman dari Dinari dipergunakan untuk biaya pakan ternaknya. Setiap hari Wayan Joli memberi makan ternaknya 2 kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dan bangunannya cukup permanen. Wayan Joli berharap dengan mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari usahanya lebih meningkat dan kehidupan keluarganya juga lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To purchase pig's food

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia E. is 38 years old; she is married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells phone accessories, recharge cards and also makes phone calls for people and supplies ice cream. She has been in this business for 4 years. She is in need of a loan of $400 to buy more phone accessories & recharge cards for sale. She is grateful and promises to repay it in 8 months

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories & recharge cards for sale

loans.name: Oliver's Group

texts.en:
Oliver N. wants a loan to construct a bigger stall for her charcoal business as well as to increase the number of charcoal sacks she purchases for sale (increase inventory).

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of charcoal

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Solome M.. She is widowed with three children, aged 13, 15, and 19. In 1999 Solome established a business selling rice and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
