SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support; hence, poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Khumarbi

texts.en:
A. Khumarbi is 49 years old and raising two children alone. 

Khumarbi has been selling towels, tablecloths and women's shawls in the local market for 10 years.  She usually travels to Bishkek, located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan, to purchase these goods. Since the business is the main source of income for her family, Khumarbi works hard to generate income. For the upcoming Women’s Day, she is planning to purchase additional new goods to sell.  For this purpose she is requesting a loan of $600.00 for the term of 6 months. Having a positive credit history, Khumarbi promises to repay the loan on time and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as towels, tablecloths and women's shawls in order to increase the range of products for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the mother of two children and four grandchildren.  She has been operating a small undergarments stand in a crowded alley of central Kumasi for nearly sixteen years.  She is requesting a loan to help increase her inventory of products and to buy more packaged products.  It is her hope that she can increase her sales with better quality inventory and allow her to save more for family expenses.    

Mary is a member of the trust group Pillar of God.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a form of social collateral to help ensure that each member repays their share.

Mary is pictured holding some of her products.  Standing to her right is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of women's lingerie

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a married woman, and she has six children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling kenkey (a meal prepared from milled maize) and fried fish for the past eight years.

She is seeking a loan to buy more bags of maize, cartons of fish, firewood, gallons of vegetable oil, and vegetables to expand her business and to avoid increasing prices with respect to the aforementioned products. Further, she hopes that this loan will allow her to start to save money, which would in turn be applied to her children's school fees.

She is a member of the group called "Gyina Pintin" (meaning, "Stand Firm"). Members agree in principle to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional products (e.g., maize, fish, firewood, vegetable oil, vegetables, etc.) in bulk to expand her business and to avoid potential price hikes on such products

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat N. lives in the Fayzabad region. He graduated from the Agricultural institute. He has received a diploma in agronomy. He works raising cattle. He has a farm where he raises animals. He has been doing this work for about 6 years. His business is profitable, and therefore he has decided to purchase more cattle. To do this, he must receive a loan for 750 US dollars. He will be able to pay off his debt in 12 months. Karomat is married and has 6 children. He has a very large family, but they live cheerfully and amicably, despite all their difficulties.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Нуров Каромат житель района Файзабад. Закончил Сельскохозяйственный институт. Получил высшее образование по профессии агроном. Занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит животных. Занимается этим видом деятельности около 6 лет. Его бизнес приносит доход , поэтому он решил увеличить поголовье скота путем покупки . Но для этого он сначала должен получить кредит в размере 750 долларов США. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Каромат женат и имеет 6 детей. У него очень большая семья , но живут они весело и дружно , не смотря на все трудности .

loans.use: Purchasing steers

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Ms. Martina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal bank in the Puno department of the Yunguyo district and province. She decided to become a member in order to improve her grocery store and sell products wholesale. Her store is located at 961 Jr. Huascar St.

With the first loans she received, Ms. Martina bought a store counter and a tricycle for her store.

She is now seeking a loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in four months. She will use the loan to buy ten sacks of soy, sold as livestock feed, since this brings in the most money. That's why she also plans to use future loans to purchase other products to fatten up livestock, such as cottonseed meal, cornmeal, fishmeal and chicken feed, etc., to generate more income.

She has gotten to where she is today thanks to the support of her son and as a result of the loan she received from Manuela Ramos.

Ms. Martina is 49 and has been separated from her husband for 12 years. She has a son and two daughters and studied through second grade. Her biggest dream is to educate her children so they can become professionals and to carry additional merchandise in her store, such as feed for large and small animals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Martina pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno decidió pertenecer a dicho banco con el objetivo de mejorar su tienda de abarrotes y realizar ventas por mayor, la misma que esta ubicada en Jr. Huascar Nº 961.

Con el primeros préstamos adquirió un mostrador y un triciclo para su tienda de abarrotes

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 10 sacos de soya para engorde de ganado, ya que de esto se obtiene mayor ganancia, por ello con los próximos créditos tiene previsto invertir en los productos de engorde como pasta de algodón, harina de maíz, harina de pescado, gallinazo y otros para generar más ingresos.

Todo esto ha logrado gracias al apoyo de su hijo y del préstamo de Manuela Ramos.

Tiene 49 años de edad, separada hace 12 años de su esposo, madre de 2 hijas y 01 hijo y logró estudiar hasta segundo de primaria. Su sueño más grande es tener sus hijas profesionales y ampliar mercaderías de engorde de ganados mayores y menores.

loans.use: Purchase of soy flour for young animals.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 29-year-old single man. He lives in Nyalenda slums in Kisumu, Kenya. He is one of the first people trained by KMET in home-based care for people living with HIV/AIDS. He has also received three microfinance loans from KMET. Henry has several housing structures for rental in Nyalenda slums and is able to generate US $100 in rent every month. He has applied for US $700 to build more structures.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Build more structures for rental

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya D. is 52 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 5 now independent children. Robiya owns a successful clothing and shoe sales business located at the Barakat market in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She has been selling in the market for about 15 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Robiya tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around US$ 200.

Robiya has requested a loan of 1000 Somoni (US$ 300) with a term of 4 months to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time of the year for many market vendors as college students, schoolboys and schoolgirls are now preparing for the 1st of September so her clothing is now in great demand. By purchasing additional inventory, Robiya will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverence, hard work, and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: This is the second loan Mrs. Lang S. has taken out to improve her business. She is a farmer in Prasath Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation field, she now faces an obstacle because her field is too far from irrigation and she does not have any way to water her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump that she can use to water her field. Her husband, Mr. Koeb Minsuor, is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Mrs. Lang S. is 38 years old and the mother of ten children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, seven are attending the local school, and the youngest one is a newly born baby. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to generate water to water her field.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es:
La señora Piedad, socia del BC “LAS BRISAS DE LA MOLINA II”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de  golosinas y frutas que están en temporada como aguajes, plátanos, etc., de manera ambulatoria en los lugares donde se realizan eventos y hay mayor concentración de personas como en las afueras de los colegios y recreos turísticos.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará galletas de distintas variedades en cajas, chocolates en cajas, chupetines y chicles en bolsas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, caramelos de diferentes marcas y sabores, para poder tener en stock y luego sacarlos a vender. 

Piedad tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con 04 de sus hijos quienes aún son pequeños y dependen de ella, su esposo también se dedica al negocio. Es una mujer que le gusta el negocio, desde pequeña se dedica a esta actividad y quiere más adelante  poner un negocio de venta de frutas, plátanos y verduras en su casa porque ahora no puede salir dado a que tiene su bebé y es muy difícil para ella estar fuera de casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Piedad, member of the las Brisas de la Molina II (Breezes of the Mill) village bank, lives in the La Banda de Shilcayo district of the province of San Martin in Peru. She sells snacks and seasonal fruit like aguaje, plantains, etc. while walking around in different events and festivities where this is generally a large group of people like outside schools and in touristic places. With this $275 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase different varieties of cookies in boxes, chocolates in boxes, and different brands and sizes of lollipops and gum in bags, and different flavors and brands of caramels so she will have a larger stock to sell from. Piedad is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four of her children who are small and dependent on her. Her husband also works in the same business. She loves to work hard and has worked in this type of sales she was little. In the future, she would like to put up a fruit and vegetable stand in her home since it is more difficult for her to leave the house due to the need to care for her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cookies, chocolates, lollipops, etc.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro Chalí tiene 29 años de edad casado,  varios años atrás se dedicaba de jornalero, el trabajaba para otras personas en el campo y le pagaban por día de trabajo lo que no era suficiente para mantener a su familia.  Por esa razón el decidió trabajar en un Banco de Confianza con un crédito el cual lo invirtió en la crianza de pollos, su trabajo fue de éxito, por lo que sus ganancias las utilizo para sembrar papa y fresa en un terreno de su propiedad que tenia sin utilizarlo.  Cuenta que con la ayuda de Dios logro una buena cosecha de fresas y también de papa.  El préstamo que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la siembra de tomate, por lo que necesita bastante capital para la compra de pilones de tomate, abono, y fungicidas.
Actualmente Mauro Tiene 4 hijos pequeños que le ayudan en su tiempo libre, y también quiere aprovechar sus recursos desde ahora para poder darles la educación adecuada a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y ellos puedan apoyarlo cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Mauro C. is 29 years old and married. A few years ago, he became a day laborer - working for others in their fields and being paid by the day. Unfortunately, this was not enough to support his family, so he turned to the Banco de Confianza for a loan. He invested that loan into raising chickens and did well for himself, using his profits to plant potatoes and strawberries in an unused portion of his property. With God's grace, he was able to harvest a healthy amount of both potatoes and strawberries. With this next loan, he will plant tomatoes, for which he will need to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Mauro's 4 little children help him in their spare time, and he hopes to be able to give them an education with the earnings from his garden. He would like to see them become professionals and he hopes they will be able to help support him when they are older.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 46 years old and a mother of three. She recently started her own business: she sells sugar cane juice on the street to the people in her community. Sugar cane juice has a refreshing, sweet-and-sour taste, and is a popular soft drink in South and Southeast Asia. In Cambodia, many sugar cane juice stands can be seen along the main roads. Sen S. has been involved in this business since 2006, and she typically makes around US$6 per day. One of her children, employed by a private company, earns US$7 per day, while the other two are still students. In a typical month, S.'s family spends US$50 on food, US$10 on utilities, and US$10 on their children's tuition. After hearing about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors, Mrs. Sen S. decided to apply for a loan to be able to buy a new sugar cane cart and an additional volume of sugar cane. She believes that the purchase will improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar cane and a new sugar cane juice cart

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Alianza ("Alliance") Village Bank. She is 42 years old and is separated with one son. Gladys has several businesses: she has a pig farm, she buys and sells grains, and she also grinds some of the grain into flour to sell. She buys the grains from farmers or intermediaries, and resells them (whole or ground) in local markets. She sells some of the flour to market vendors, who use it to make wawa, a traditional kind of bread. Gladys also sells suckling pigs for 16 soles per kilo on special occasions like Christmas and New Year's.

Gladys is requesting a loan of 1,400 soles (USD$450) to buy grains and two to three pigs.

loans.use: To buy grains and pigs

loans.name: Niètaga (Le Succès) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Niètaga est un regroupement de sept femmes du  premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui sont  des voisines de longue date. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants chacune qui vivent généralement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles mènent différentes activités (la vente de bois de chauffe, les boissons locales et  glaces, la restauration, les légumes et fruits, du sel etc.).
Dans l’objectif d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont intégré le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour ce troisième prêt qu’elles comptent utiliser  pour acheter, la contenance d‘un camion en bois de chauffe, des sacs de sucre, de riz pour la restauration et du sel.
Les produits des femmes du groupe Niètaga sont très sollicités dans la ville de Koutiala et elles ont de l’expérience dans leur secteur d’activité. Elles s’approvisionnent dans des localités et  marchés différents et ont une clientèle diverses et variées.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000 CFA. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer dans la prise en charge des dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Niètaga is composed of seven women of the first district of the city of Koutiala who have been neighbors for a long time. They average 37 years of age and are married mothers of at least five children each. They generally live in extended traditional families and do different work (selling firewood, local beverages, ice, meals, fruit and vegetables, salt, etc.)

With the goal of expanding their businesses, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program this year. Their loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 100,000 francs for this third loan, which they plan to use to buy: a truck-load of firewood, sacks of sugar and of rice for making meals, and some salt. What the women offer is in great demand in Koutiala. Experienced in their sectors of commerce, they get their supplies in different towns and marketplaces and have diverse and varied customers.

With this new loan, they intend to realize an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs that will be used to repay the loan interest and to help cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different items for small-scale commerce

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn M. grows rice to earn a living. She is 37 years old and she has 5 children. She dreams of sending all her children to college. She and her husband were not able to go to college. She thinks that education is important; it will help her children get a better job. She wants her children to graduate soon and find better jobs to support their future.

When Jenelyn is not busy on her farm, she arranges flowers. She prepares flower arrangements for weddings and special occassions in her village. This is another source of income for the family; Jenelyn uses the income to support the family's needs.

Jenelyn is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Specifically, she will use the loan to buy 2 bags of fertilizers, urea and triple 14. She will also try to develop other income-generating projects to augment their limited income.

CEVI provides its clients with more than just credit. It also gives its clients training on managing a business and insurance coverage to help protect its members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg D. is a widow with a 13-year-old daughter. Her husband passed away several years ago. Now she lives and shares a small plot of land with her late husband's father and two brothers-in-law, in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia). In 2007, with her brother, she created a small bakery. They launched their business in a small space rented from a local service center. They have two employees. They have a yearly examination from the District Office for Standards and Safety Control and they have successfully passed the examinations thus far.  They started the business by purchasing some necessary equipment with their own capital of 500,000 tugrig (Mongolian currency; $1=1,600 tugrig). Today, their capital has increased to 1,200,000 tugrig. She requests a loan to buy additional equipment and necessary ingredients. She says, "So far, I employ only two locals. In the future, as business expands, I hope to hire more local employees who are going through similar tough times."

loans.use: To buy equipment and ingredients.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie M. lives near the Sulu Sea in the municipality of Pandan, at the northern end of Antique Province.  Small fishing boats dot the beach near her house, and much of the economic activity in her neighborhood revolves around the sea.  Marjorie has two daughters and two sons, ranging in age from seven to 14 years old; the youngest is in kindergarten and the oldest is in the sixth grade.  Her husband, Narciso, is a farmer and fisherman.Marjorie has been selling fish, salt, and rice for ten years.  She sells from her house, and walks from place to place selling her goods from a basket.  She plans to use the money from this loan as working capital to buy items to resell.She hopes God will grant her the good health to continue working, so she can grow her business and perhaps establish a fixed location outside her house to sell from in the future.  She wants to be able to earn enough to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fish, rice, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has owned a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She belongs to Mshikamano  group loan (Group code 2016).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga (which are colorful, printed cotton garments), DVDs and other items. She wants to increase her current stock to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business and save money for future use.  

Asha is forty-five years old, married, and has five children, ages twenty-five, twenty-two, twenty-one, twenty and eighteen.

loans.use: To buy more Khanga, DVD, and other items to increase her current stock.

loans.name: Trok

texts.en: Trok S. is 29 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, Trok S. typically makes US $2 per day. This couple has two young children. Mrs. Trok would like to take out a loan to purchase hand tractor to help plow the land.

loans.use: To purchase hand tractor.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya B. lives in a family with her husband, one son and one daughter in the town of Patan. Her husband, Mr. Sanu B., works in a steel factory. Both her son and daughter are studying in BBS level.
Mrs. B. is a farmer and she grows green vegetables on her land. Most of the farmers in Nepal are dependent on seasonal farming due to lack of modern tools and equipment. Mrs. B. sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening every day. All her family members help her with the farm work.
Now Mrs. Maiya B. is requesting a 10,000 NPR loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kamalaneh Group

texts.en:
These ladies--Mary M. K., Kadiatu S. and Patricia E. S.--are local entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo. They've named their group Kamaleneh. They have been in business for several years now but their businesses have been growing at a very slow pace. With the arrival of SMT (Salone Microfinance Trust) in Waterloo a few months ago, they have applied for a loan of Le 500,000 each, in order to boost their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to increase their inventory, make more profit, assist their school-going children, and meet most of their daily financial challenges.

Mary M. K. (right) is the leader of this group. Mary is 39 years of age. She was born in Lunar, northern Sierra Leone, but now resides in Waterloo, 20 miles from Freetown. Her husband is a businessman and they have three children together. One of their children is in college, another is in secondary school and the last is in primary school.

Mary sells gari (fast food made by grinding cassava), palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and wheat. She has been a businesswoman for over ten years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy goods in large quantity, make more profit and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in food market business

loans.name: Lady Lux

texts.es: Lady Lux A. Beltrán tiene la edad 29 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene l hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta cosméticos. Doña Lady tiene 4 años en su negocio, el cual vende una manera ambulante debido a la situación económica que ella presentaba con su familia, es por eso que por iniciativa propia, ya que por las tardes salía a vender sus productos, y tenia que salir desde muy temprano para ofrecerlo a sus mejores clientes a pesar de sus problemas de salud que ha presentado ya que tiene problemas respiratorios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, sombras, perfumes entre otras cosas. El sueño de Lady tiene el sueño de establecer un lugar en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y además seguir luchando para que su hijo logre terminar su estudios.
texts.en:
Lady Lux A. Beltrán is a married, 29 year old woman. She is raising one child. She sells cosmetics. Lady has been in this business for four years. Due to her family’s economic situation, she is a street vendor. She works on her own initiative, and she leaves very early in order to offer her products to her best customers. She does this in spite of her health problems; she has respiratory problems. The loan is for working capital to buy lipstick, nail polish, shadow, and perfume among other things. Lady’s dream is to set up a place where she can sell her products and to keep fighting so that her son can finish his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shirley Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Marlen Damaris C. Durán, Flor de Lis Gutiérrez R. y María Ignacia C..

Doña Marlen Damaris es una mujer soltera , madre de dos hijos a los que mantiene sola, se dedica vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene dos hijos pequeños que va a la escuela.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Doña Flor de Lis Gutiérrez  es la coordinadora del grupo, es persona muy responsable se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, ella es madre de cinco hijos, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja en Managua en reparación de electrodomésticos .
Ella es conocida por la actividad que realiza, desea poder dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.

Doña María Ignacia C. se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y frutas en un puesto ubicado en una empresa donde hay muchos empleados, como lo es las zonas francas. Ella compra las frutas en el mercado a buen precio y las vende peladas en platos, ya preparadas. Ella es soltera, sin hijos, vive con su mamá a quien le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.



.
texts.en:
Photo (from left to right): Marlen Damaris C. Durán, Flor de Lis Gutiérrez R., and María Ignacia C.. Doña Marlen Damaris is a single mother of two children; she is their sole support. She sells fruit, buying it at wholesale prices and then selling it throughout the day for a profit. She has two small children who attend school. Ever since she was a young woman she has had her business and is planning to expand it so that one day she can improve her house. A responsible person, Doña Flor de Lis Gutiérrez is the coordinator of the group. She earns her living by selling clothing and cosmetics. She has five children and shares the household expenses with her husband who works in Managua repairing household appliances. Flor is well-known in her field. She wants to be able to provide a better standard of living for her children. Doña María Ignacia C. sells soft drinks and fruit from a stall located in a business where there are many employees such as the duty-free zones. She buys fruit from the market at low prices and sells it peeled and on plates so that it is ready to eat. María is single and has no children. She lives with her mother with whom she shares the costs of running the household. .

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and perishables

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
"To expand my business and be able to support the needs of my children is my desire", says Wilma. Wilma considers her children as her inspiration in life to work diligently. She is engaged in the buy and sell business for already five years. She is buying junk materials like cans, bottles, plastics, et cetera and sells them at a higher price in a junk shop. According to her, she never felt ashamed of her business for it is a decent job and her family's source of income.

At present, she would like to seek for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 4,000. She wants to expand her business and hopefully engage in another business selling generic medicines for additional income to further support the education of her children.

Wilma is 38 years old and married to Bonifacio, a farmer.

loans.use: Expand her retail business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is a very caring mother to her four children.  She is married to Rey, a laborer in Tumauini. Concepcion is working hard to help her husband in generating income for their needs. She ran various businesses since she got married.  At the moment, she is engaged in selling noodles and vegetables in in their village. The business somehow brings her happiness for she contributes income for her family. To further improve the business, Concepcion wanted to request a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima H. dedicates herself to the production and sale of potatoes, carrots and seasonal vegetables. Thanks to her work, she can offer her children and her family daily nutrition but, more than that, she feels active and useful supporting her family and helping her husband. Although this activity takes time and care, she does it with a lot of optimism, knowing that – thanks to this work – she can continue growing, not only economically, but also as a person.

Rahima has many desires in order to improve her plantation: for this, she hopes to acquire more land and different plants to better the variety of her delicious products. In so doing, she will increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase more land

loans.name: Josphat Nyagau

texts.en:
Josphat Nyangau is a gentleman who is single. He has been running a boutique business for one year dealing in clothes and hair products. His business is situated in a slum area within East of Nairobi and it is very highly populated area. This is where his main clients are situated.

Jospaht was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he does not have a previous credit history. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to add more stock including clothes and hair products. With the extra profits he plans to expand to selling of shoes and bags.

Jospaht describes himself as focused and hardworking and thus he believes that he will be able to achieve his hopes and dreams which are to own a wholesale boutique.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Adding stock of clothes and hair products.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov K. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her young child in the TaK. province. Since 2007, she has been selling rice to earn a living and is able to make about $10 USD in revenue, while her husband is a seller. He sells mosquito nets, pillows, mats, and other housing materials. This business allows him to make a significant $13 USD each day. To earn more money, Pov K. decided to borrow a loan of $1,000 USD from Kiva via CREDIT MIF. Her husband needs to purchase more mosquito nets, pillows, and mats to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase mosquito nets, pillows, and mats to sell

loans.name: Telma Veronica

texts.es: Doña Telma Veronica T. A. es una persona responsable que se dedica a la venta de ropa para bebes y que siempre mira mas alla, es una mujer con muchos sueños y uno de ellos es contar con un negocio mas grande y vender ropa surtida para grandes y pequeños y de esa manera apoya a su familia especialmente a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos.es originaria del paraje chuipachec final de la zona 1, Totonicapan, Guatemala quien se identifica con su cedyla de vecindad H-8 y de registro numero 91,102 de 24 años de edad. casada.
texts.en:
Doña Telma Veronica T. A. is a responsible person who sells baby clothes. She is someone who always looks ahead. One of her many dreams is to have a bigger business in which she sells an assortment of clothing in all sizes so that she can help with the family expenses. Telma is originally from the village of Chuipachec in District #1 of Totonicapan, Guatemala. She is 24 years old and married.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital to acquire more clothing

loans.name: Yiyo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yiyo está conformado por Olga María L. S., Iweth Marveli L. S. y Maritza Marbeli O. L..  Este grupo tiene tres ciclos de estar con Adim con los cuales han levantado su negocio. 

La señora Olga L. S. de 42 años inicio vendiendo helados y hoy en día ha diversificado su negocio comercializando ropa, zapatos, helados y leña. Ella dese a aprovecha esta fiestas navideñas e invertir más en  ropa y zapatos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Iweth Marveli L. S. tiene una pequeña venta donde comercializa granos básicos, café, jabones, tomates, cebolla, chiltoma, huevo y sopas instantáneas. Mientras Maritza Marbeli O. L. de 20 años, esta joven madre de un niño de 2 años y en espera de su segundo hijo desde muy tempranas horas se prepara para salir a vender pan.
texts.en:
The Yiyo group is comprised of Olga María L. S., Iweth Marveli L. S. y Maritza Marbeli O. L.. This group has gotten loans from Adim (Kiva’s field partner) three times and it has helped them to pick up their respective businesses.

Mrs. Olga L. S. is 42 years old and began selling ice cream, today she has diversified her business by selling clothing, shoes, ice cream and firewood. She wishes to take advantage of the Christmas festivities and sell more clothing and shoes.

The other members of the group: Iweth Marveli L. S. has a small store where she sells basic household goods like coffee, soap, tomatoes, onions, chiltoma (sweet pepper), eggs and instantaneous soup. While Maritza Marbeli O. L., who is 20 years old is a young mother of a 2 year old boy and is awaiting her second son and she goes out to sell bread very early in the morning.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers in the market. She is a focused, hard worker. She hopes to be a garri distributor in the future. She is 44 years old and married, with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more garri to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia R. is currently in the business of selling maize and millet flour in the market and is requesting a loan to stock rice and more bags of maize to sell.  Cicilia is 48 years old and is Divorced.   She has 4 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: stock rice and more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn has been a rice farmer since 2000. She tills a 2-hectare piece of land in South Cotabato. She has been married to Jimmy and has two children. The eldest child is 18 years old. With rice farming, she has been able to provide the basic needs of her family.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan for her farm. She requested 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and farm supplies. She is thankful that CEVI only charges a low interest rate.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Haydde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora HAYDEE, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 68 años de edad es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos la menor de sus hijas tiene 38 años de edad, ella alterna sus labores en el hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño stand de venta de verduras y productos remojados en el mercado de Tupac Amarú, en el área de verduras, la socia trabaja arduamente lo cual le permite ayudar a sus nietos con lo que ella gana, ella tiene este stand desde hace 4 años y ya es su negocio formal, ella solicita el préstamo para seguir apoyando a su familia e todo los pendientes que se puedan de este modo ella invertirá el dinero en la adquisición de un más productos para su venta.

La socia  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Miss Haydee, she belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas' communal bank. The partner was born in the city of Cusco. Our partner is 68 years old and is married with 4 children. Her youngest daughter is 38 years old. She alternates her chores at home with commerce; our partner has a small produce stand in the in the vegetable area of the Tupac Amaru market. The partner works arduously which allows her to help her grandchildren with what she earns. She has had this stand for 4 years and now it is her formal business. She is requesting the loan to keep supporting her family; she will invest the money in the purchase of more produce to sell. The partner is grateful and expresses her satisfaction to be able to keep her own business growing and is committed to fulfill the payment of the debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for her produce stand

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma A. is a 42-year-old married mother of three. Her youngest is a 5-year-old and her oldest is a high school student. She and her husband work together buying and selling cell phones in their village and at the market. This couple has been in this business for more than three years now. Her husband also works as a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver for extra income to support and sustain the family. Emma also runs a variety store for supplementary profits, and she is a housing loan agent from time to time, because her husband's income is not enough to provide for all the needs of her three children. 

Emma joined ASHI in 2006, aiming to get out of the spiral of poverty and consistently acquire working capital for her business. She will use this loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to buy a supply of cell phones for resale. She says ASHI-Kiva partners have good hearts for the poor, like her family, and really help them reach their dreams. That is why this couple has grown to love this institution very much.

Emma hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall at the marketplace, instead of selling cell phone products from her house. She wants to be able to make enough money to pay for her children's education. She dreams of the best life for her family, who live together.

loans.use: To buy a supply of cell phones for resale

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn Z. is from the village of Banquero. She is 28 years old. Amilyn is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Amilyn owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amilyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich O. is a humble farmer living in a village located the province of Kompong Tom. She has two teenaged children who attend the local public school. She and her husband grow and sell vegetables. She is requesting a loan of  $500  to buy a pumping machine because her farm is not located near a watering system, and she has problems irrigating her crops. A pumping system will improve her yield and help her increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine to water crops

loans.name: Adereni

texts.en: Adereni sells medicines and groceries to make a living. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to own a big pharmacy stall in the future. She is 45 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a policeman and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicines to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Shirheerev

texts.en:
Shirheerev is 36 years old and lives with her wife and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for three years. 
Shirheerev operates a carpentry business in his town. He produces a variety of wooden furniture including beds, beams, and doors for a ger, the traditional Mongolian tent. He has been operating his business since 2007, and has steadily expanded his business. His monthly sales revenue is 300,000 – 500,000 tugrugs (~210  –  350 USD), and his monthly profit is 100,000 – 200,000 tugrugs (~ 70 – 140 USD ). Shirheerev is a very hard working person. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~  211 USD) loan to purchase a variety of wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for carpentry.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, married, and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 24-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and three siblings. In her household, one parent and two siblings also work. She runs a clothing store that sells mainly special Islamic dresses and tops for women. This loan is her first with Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. She plans to use her loan to increase her store’s inventory.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Mrs. Sani Tamanag lives in Khokhana-Dobato, Lalitpur. She has four members, including herself, in her family. She is a farmer in Khokhana-Dobato and she grows different types of vegetables. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming.

Mrs. T. sells her vegetables in the local vegetable market in the mornings and evenings. Now she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work. She has a son and a daughter. Her son is studying in university and her daughter is studying in grade 11.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sheryl Denys

texts.es:
La señora Sheryl forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres del Futuro desde hace 6 ciclos, los créditos que ha podido recibir los ha invertido muy bien y sus negocios se han incrementado de una manera exitosa.

Nuestra socia esta casada tiene dos hijos, a sus 29 años es maestra artesanal en una pequeña  parroquia de la ciudad de Portoviejo, labor que desempeña  por  las noche,  viaja todos los días para cumplir con su labor, este trabajo lo viene realizando hace algunos años; tiene tiempo para estudiar esta realizando una maestría en gerencia comercial, pero sin descuidar su hogar  y sus niños que están pequeños.

La señora Sheryl es una mujer que le gusta el comercio, desde que se caso hace 6 años mantienen con el esposo la venta de camarones, se iniciaron con este negocio por que el  trabajaba en una camaronera en un puerto pesquero en la provincia de Manabi,luego que decidió salir ahorró dinero y empezó con su propio negocio, el trabajo lo realizan de la siguiente manera,el tiene que viajara a compra por cajas el camarón y lo distribuye por libra a sus amigos y familiares quienes son sus mas fieles compradores, aparte de este negocio la señora Sheryl tiene la venta de ropa, negocio que lo empezó hace 2 años aproximadamente, se le hace fácil porque ya tiene sus clientes fijos, con este negocio puede aportar económicamente es su hogar, a pesar que es madre, esposa y profesora se da tiempo para todo.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Sheryl podrá invertir en comprarse un congelador para guarda los camarones, el sueño de ella es poder extenderse con su negocio a los demás cantones, pero requiere de mayor inversión, el congelador lo piensan comprar de contado. Entre los proyectos esta lograr obtener su taller de costura junto a su mama quien siempre la ha motivado, la señora Sheryl esta muy segura de poder hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Sheryl has been part of the “Women of the Future” cooperative bank for six cycles. She has invested her loans very well, and her businesses have been growing successfully. Our member is married, has two children and, at 29 years of age, is a crafts teacher in a small village within the city of Portoviejo. She does her work at night, traveling each day to undertake her labor, which she has been carrying for several years. She has time to study, and is completing a degree in business management while still tending to her home and small children. Sheryl very much likes commerce and, since getting married 6 years ago, runs a business with her husband selling prawns. They started in the business because he worked at a prawn enterprise at a fishing port in the Manabi province. They started to save money when he decided to leave this job to start their own business. He now travels to purchase prawns by the case, which they sell by the pound to family and friends who are loyal buyers. Separate from this business, Sheryl also sells clothing, an enterprise she started approximately 2 years ago. This work is easy, because she already has a steady customer base. With this business, she also helps to support the family financially. Despite the fact that she is a mother, wife and teacher, she somehow manages to find time to handle everything. With this new loan, Sheryl would be able to invest in buying herself a freezer to store her prawns. Her dream is to extend the business into other towns, but this requires a greater investment. They are thinking about paying for the freezer in cash. Another project planned is to have a sewing workshop alongside her mother, who has always motivated her. Sheryl is very sure that she will be able to make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Virlie

texts.en:
Virlie B. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Virlie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virlie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling Zizmore personal products in the local community. Virlie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virlie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Virlie's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married. She owns a small business selling children’s clothing in a local mall in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. The favorable location of Angela’s shop adds to her good sales rates. Angela has been in the business for 8 years. Presently, she has about 65,000 UAH in merchandise. Her income amounts to 6,000 UAH. 

Some of the major characteristics of Angela’s business are stability and consistency. This is partly due to the financial assistance she received in previous years. Angela is very optimistic and cheerful which has helped her fulfill her business goals in the past. She was able to start a second sales location last year. She hopes to develop her business further. Angela is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH to purchase more inventory and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda T. is from the village of Bagong Sikat, Alicia, Isabela. She is 50 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Imelda owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells a raised animal.

In 2006, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilian A. tiene 28 años. Esta casada con el Sr. Fidenciano Chamorro tienen un hijo menor de edad. 
Tienen su casa propia en la ciudad de Capiata.
La Sra. Lilian tiene un local de Mini Cargas para celulares en donde también venden termos y guampas forradas trabajadas  en la ciudad de San Lorenzo hace 5 años. El Sr. le ayuda en la venta.
 La Sra. Lilian necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderìas en cantidad a menor precio.
 En el futuro desean habrir una sucursal en la ciudad de Luque donde también hay mucho movimiento.
texts.en:
Lilian A. is 28 years old. She is married to Fidenciano Chamorro, and they have a minor child. They have their own house in the city of Capiata. Lilian has a site where she sells electronic loads for mobile phones. She also sells thermos bottles and sheathed tea cups. She has worked in the city of San Lorenzo for five years. Her husband helps with the sales. Lilian needs this loan to get merchandise in large quantities for a lower price. In the future she wishes to open a branch in the city of Luque, where there is also a lot of activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thermos bottles, tea cups, and fabric, etc.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 56 years old, and married with three children who are 7, 9 and 17 years old.  Francois is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes.  This is his 16th successful year and the hours of his business are from 8 am until 6 pm every day.

Francois needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Francois will expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of Irish potatoes.  With this additional quantity of Irish potatoes, Francois can satisfy the demands of his customers. Thus his sales, as well as his profits, will also increase.  If successful, he will keep expanding his business until he becomes financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica B. is married to a trader and takes care of two children. She sells rice and tomato sauce in Elmina. She has been educated up to the senior high school level. Veronica uses her income to help her husband pay for their accommodation. Veronica will use this loan to purchase a bag of rice and other ingredients to cook for sale. Veronica plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase a bag of rice and other ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: El Sr. Narciso Vive en la localidad de los Limos distante a 10 km de la comunidad de Santa Rita, perteneciente al municipio de el Torno, tiene una parcela de 10 hectáreas donde se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, su esposa con la cual tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando y los demás son pequeño, ella se dedica al mantenimientos de los animales y al cuidado de sus hijos, mientras que el se dedica a la agricultura por lo que el destino del crédito es para la siembra de arroz y sorgo que es el producto que le da mayor ingresos durante el año su esposa le ayuda a comercializarlo en el mercado de el Torno, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Narciso lives in Los Limos, located 10km from the Santa Rita community in the town of Torno. He has a 10-hectare lot of land where he plants and raises cattle. He has five children with his wife. Two of them go to school and the others are still too young to go. His wife raises the animals and takes care of the children while he works in agriculture. The loan will be used to sow rice and sorghum which are the products that bring the most revenue during the year. His wife helps him sell his produce at Torno's market. He is very thankful to the institution for the support he has been granted.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sowing of rice and sorghum

loans.name: Hikmatoy

texts.en: Hikmatoy devotes herself to the production of vegetables on her land. For this reason, she has remained as long as possible on her land, dedicating herself to the care and fertilization of her fields. With all this effort, it has been possible to obtain good harvests and sell the products, and to offer her two children an education and personal development appropriate for their age. This hard work also makes her think of opening a grocery store in her house, thus providing a larger share of income for the family’s kitty. However, this will require a larger investment, so Hikmatoy is asking for your help in obtaining a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Reyna Sulema

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer comerciante, dedicada a la  venta de ropa nueva, con varios años de experiencia en el trabajo. Con ayuda de su esposo inicio vendiendo hielo, helados y frescos naturales. 
Hoy en día ha invertido en ropa con financiamiento que La institución ha dado, así como ha mejorado su vivienda, siendo Afodenic una puerta para lograr sus anhelos atreves de sus préstamos.
Con el crédito anterior logro poner piso a su casa, lo que está contenta, con este nuevo financiamiento hará un muro colateral en su solar para reguardar su vivienda. Comprara materiales como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros para comenzar la construcción.
texts.en:
Reyna is a businesswoman with several years of experience selling new clothing.  With the help of her husband, she began selling ice, ice cream, and natural drinks.

Today, she has been investing in clothes with funding that the institution has given her that has improved her home.  Afodenic is a pathway to achieve her aspirations through their loans.

With the previous loan she was able to put down a floor in her house, which she is happy with.  This new funding will be used to construct a side wall on her land to guard her home.  She will buy materials such as: stone, sand, cement, iron etc. to begin construction.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as stone, sand, and iron to construct a wall to provide better security for her family.

loans.name: Norbhal Roberto

texts.es: El joven Norbhal tiene la actividad económica de brindar el servicio de fotografía y fotocopiadoras  ubicado en su humilde vivienda. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica brindar este servicio. A pesar de la corta edad que tiene ha salido adelante, ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su familia. La única manera que podía lograrlo era dedicándose a lo que más le gusta y así salir adelante debido a sus escasos recursos. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de materiales como cámara digital de último modelo para brindar un mejor servicio. Su mayor sueño es acondicionar su negocio para que obtener más clientes.
texts.en: Norbhal is a young man whose business is photography and photocopies.  His business is located in his humble residence.  He began his business ten years ago.  Despite his youthfulness, he has managed to progress.  He is already responsible for his family's expenses.  The only way he can pay expenses is by working at what he enjoys; in this way, he can survive despite very limited resources.  He requests this loan to purchase the latest model digital camera and thereby provide better service for his customers.  His biggest dream is to install air conditioning at his business, which will help him attract more customers.

loans.use: purchase of digital camera

loans.name: Bequer

texts.es: Bequer, de 19 años vive independientemente en una casa alquila en la ciudad de Lima (capital del país). Pero cada mes visita a su mamá en la comunidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Hace tan solo 4 años que trabaja en una empresa de textiles, ahí aprendió todo lo necesario para poder defenderse en la vida, y a su corta edad tienen muchos proyectos y objetivos. En este corto tiempo aprendió todo lo necesario para el mantenimiento de maquinarias pesadas, esto le ayudo a ganar un poco más de dinero, ya que en sus tiempos libres ofrece este servicio a diferentes fábricas de la capital. Ahora Bequer, desea abrir su propia fabrica de ropa, ya tienen todo lo necesario para comenzar con su proyecto y, con las ganancias y el tiempo irá implementando más su taller. También piensa estudiar diseño textil, con el cual podrá innovar en sus diseños. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se siente feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, que es uno de los más reconocidos en su localidad. Con el crédito que obtendrá le ayudará en la compra de una máquina industrial de coser simple, con ello podrá hacer carteras rectas y blusas. La suma que invertirá oscila entre los 800 dólares aproximadamente.
texts.en: Bequer, 19, lives on his own in a rented house in the city of Lima (the capital of the country).  Each month he visits his mother in the community of San Pedro de Cajas.  He has been working in a textile company for only 4 years, where he learned everything he needs in order to get by in life--even at his young age, he has many projects and goals.  In this short time he learned everything necessary about maintaining heavy equipment, which helped him to earn a little more money since he was able to offer this service to different factories in the capital during his free time.  Now Bequer wants to open his own clothing factory--he already has everything necessary to start his project, and with time and earnings he will continue to set up his workshop.  He also plans to study textile design, with which he will be able to innovate his own designs.  This is his first loan through MFP, and he is happy to belong to his communal bank, which is one of the most well-known in his area.  This loan will help him to purchase one standard industrial sewing machine that he will use to make bags and blouses.  The amount he will invest will be about $800.

loans.use: Purchase an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en: Wafa is a single woman from Rafah City in Gaza Strip. Wafa rented a store eight years ago and started her own grocery business that she runs with the help of her brother who appears in the picture here. Wafa is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture online. Wafa wanted to increase the variety of goods she sells in the store. Therefore,  she came to FATEN and took a loan for this purpose. Wafa wishes to have a big supermarket in the near future using savings from the store's profits and the help of FATEN loans.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods

loans.name: Naeim

texts.ar:
نعيم في عمر 41 سن متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب عائلته ويعمل في بيع الحلوايات له في عمله نحو 20 سنة  يحب عائلته ويسعى
دائما الى تأمين العيش الكريم يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع للمحل مواد اولية لصنع الحلوايات
عائلته كل اهتمامه طموح يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وتحسين وضعه المادي فهو يحلم بفتح اكثر من محل له وتوسيع العمل
وتحسين نوعية العمل
texts.en: Naeim is a 41-year-old husband and father of four who wants nothing more than to secure a dignified life for his family. Having worked as a seller of confectionaries for the past twenty years, Naeim is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase ingredients to manufacture more candies. Naeim is very driven and dreams of improving the quality of his products and of expanding his business by opening more branches in the future.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to manufacture candies.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza C., 63 years old, is married and has three children. She is from the village of Ricoro, a part of Gingoog City in the northern Mindanao islands. Feliza owns a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, detergents and toothpaste to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Feliza joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Feliza is requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snacks and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as snacks and canned goods

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph D. is from the village of Kinangay Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old. Joseph is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Joseph raises livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Joseph joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Joseph is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Joseph from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with two small children. He has several greenhouses where he grows vegetables for sale. Sergei has been in this business for 11 years. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, cabbage, etc. Making sure that they mature early in spring provides a good income to Sergei’s family.

Sergei is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnas to purchase farming supplies for this season, like seeds and fertilizers. He also needs to purchase some film to repair his greenhouses and to buy wood for heating. Sergei enjoys his business and would like to develop it further by building new greenhouses next year.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 42 years old and is married with seven children between five and 17 years old. Odette’s husband is a teacher. Odette owns a business selling various styles of clothes. Her business is well organised and she employs two people. Odette opens from 7am until 6pm every day and has been running the business for four years.

Odette has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by purchasing various styles of clothes to attract more customers. The increased business will help her to earn more profits, which will allow her to buy a house.

loans.use: To purchase extra clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred G., from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon, is 25 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, candies, detergents and instant noodles in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mildred joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her second loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods. Mildred plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine, age 30, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geraldine has a manicure / pedicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Geraldine requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy new tools for her manicure / pedicure business. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her manicure/pedicure business,

loans.name: Asenia

texts.en:
Asenia C. is from the village of Kalagutay, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Asenia is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Asenia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling  canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Asenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Asenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Asenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Asenia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and breads. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Asenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and breads.

loans.name: Matilde De Los Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Matilde, tiene 62 años de edad y hace varios años su esposo falleció quedando ella viuda, pero de esa relación tuvo seis hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya todos mayores de edad, con ella vive una de ellos que es discapacitado.

Tiene un local en su casa donde vende carne asada, cueritos, chinchulines (tripa de cerdo asada), bocadillos, sodas, jugos naturales, etc. Sus bocadillos son muy apetecidos por los turistas y personas del lugar. Trabaja de jueves a domingo por las tardes desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00. Además en las  noches también vende meriendas, su especialidad es el arroz con menestra y carne asada, nos cuenta que recién empezó con este negocio y que le está yendo muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar productos para preparar los alimentos como carne de res, arroz, carne de cerdo, papas, yuca, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace sietes ciclos y le gusta el Banco porque gracias a los créditos ha podido sacar  adelante  a sus hijos y en especial ayudar a su hijo discapacitado.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The Colon community bank meets every fifteen days in the Colon parrish of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita, known as the city of the valley because it is surrounded by many hills.

In this area, we meet Matilde, who is 62 years old.  Her husband died a few years ago, leaving her a widow.  She has six children, who are all adults.  One of her children who is disabled lives with her.

She has a store in her home where she sells roast beef, pork skins, chinchulines (roast pork belly), sandwiches, sodas, natural juices, and other items.  Her sandwiches are very sought after by tourists and locals.  She works from Thursday to Sunday in the afternoons from 3:00pm until 7:00pm.  She also sells snacks at night.  Her specialty is rice with mixed vegetables and beef.  She just started this business, and it is doing very well.

With this loan, she will purchase products to prepare her food, like beef, rice, pork, potatoes, yuca, and other items.  She has been part of her community bank for seven cycles and she likes the bank because the loans have allowed her to improve the lives of her children, and especially help her disabled son.  

Her dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase beef, rice, pork, potatoes, yuca, and other items.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 33 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж работает в колхозе. Сама Зебинисо занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Zebiniso lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works on a collective farm. Zebiniso is a farmer. She rents a plot of land where she grows wheat for sale. She has been doing this for eight years.  She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro
