texts.es:
Milagro, vive con su esposo y una hija de 16 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tostadas, este negocio fue fundado junto a su esposo hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días de 3:00pm a 7:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de quesillo, chicharrón, plátanos, aceite y condimentos,  estos materiales le servirán para preparar las pupusas y las enchiladas, con esta ayuda tendrá los materiales necesarios para comercializar los productos a los clientes.
Su objetivo es apoyar a su hija en sus estudios, para que pueda ingresar a la universidad y poder tener un futuro distinto con mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Milagro lives with her husband and 16-year-old daughter. She sells pupusas and tostadas. Milagro and her husband started this business 10 years ago. She works every day from 3pm to 7pm.

Milagro is requesting a loan to buy cheese, pork, plantains, oil, and condiments. These supplies will be used for preparing pupusas and enchiladas. By having these necessary supplies on hand, she will be able to sell her products to her customers.

Her goal is to support her daughter with her studies so that she can enroll in the university and have a bright future with better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, pork, plantains, oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Kwadjowa Christine

texts.fr: Christine est dans la restauration depuis 2007. Ce prêt l’aidera à acheter des produits alimentaires (haricot, riz, huile, tomate) servant à préparer  du « AYIMOLOU » riz mélangé avec du haricot. Son conjoint est maçon carreleur et ils ont 01 enfant en charge.
texts.en: Christine has been in the restaurant business since 2007.  This loan will help her buy the food products (beans, rice, oil, tomatoes) used to prepare “AYIMOLOU” a dish of rice mixed with beans. Her husband is a bricklayer and tile setter.  They have one child to support.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 62 años D. edad. Actualmente, Maruja vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació junto con sus seis hijos.  Maruja tiene una pequeña oficina donD. se realiza fotocopias, e impresiones y otras cosas más.  Ella tiene empleados quienes se encargan D. la tienda, ellos trabajan realizados los servicios D. tipeos en computadora, fotocopias, etc. Ya son 9 años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Maruja requiere el préstamo para comprar insumnos como tinta, papel, CD y otras cosas más. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Juntas y Unidas” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Maruja, 62,  was born in the city of Cusco (Perú) and lives in the same city with her six children.  She has a small office where she provides photocopy, printing and other services.  She has employees who manage the store and handle computer input and photocopy services, etc.

She has been in business for nine years and it is going well thanks to her hard work.  Maruja is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as ink, paper, CD's and other items.

She is a responsible, hard-working person for which her colleagues invited her to participate in the communal bank "Juntas y Unidas" which belongs to the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Rakhass Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Le groupe est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diénaba qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de sel. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en: The RAKHASS solidarity group was created on February 21, 2001.  The group is composed of twelve women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their principal activities are small businesses.  Mrs. Diénaba, raising her hand at the right of the photo, is the leader of the group.  She is 48 years old, married and the mother of two children. She stays busy selling salt.  She has considerable experience in this business, having operated it for several years. This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to further develop her business.  The profits will enable her to improve the family’s living conditions (education etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy salt.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Patience has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door for the past 2 years, working 7 days every week. Patience has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes. The main business challenges for Patience include the ever-increasing prices of clothes and the rainy season. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start importing clothes herself and to get a permanent business premises.

Patience lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medications.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a hardworking and visionary 49-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been retailing in a grocery shop to make a living for her family. She wants in the next five years to have expanded and stabilized her business so that she becomes financially stable and able to provide a decent life for her family. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, kale, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy beans, kale, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel es una joven de 24 años, vive con su madre en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de lavandería, su madre le enseñó este oficio y de esa manera lavaban docenas de ropa, pero con el tiempo  debilitaban su salud. Desde entonces decidió comprarse una maquina lavadora  en la que actualmente sigue funcionando y que gracias  a este implementó ofrece  este servicio de lavado y puede ahorrar tiempo, energías y abastecerse más para seguir ofreciendo su servicio con calidad. Tiene bastante demanda de su servicio de lavado por lo que le es muy necesario tener otra maquina lavadora. Considera que los créditos de las que ha sido participe de manera grupal con MFP fue una de las mejores decisiones que ha tomado para mejorar su actividad económica y es por esta razón que continuará  trabajando por décima vez con los préstamos porque  considera que son muy necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio. El dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina lavadora de mayor capacidad.
texts.en: Raquel is a young 24-year-old woman. She lives with her mother in their own home. For four years she has provided a laundry service. Her mother taught her this work and they used to wash a lot of laundry, but with the passing of time her health deteriorated. So, Raquel decided to buy herself a washing machine. It has allowed her business to keep afloat, and thanks to this piece of equipment she can offer a laundry service and save time and energy, and be better equipped in order to continue offering a quality service. Her laundry service is in such high demand that she is in great need of another washing machine. She considers the group loans in which she has taken part through MFP to be some of the best decisions she has made to improve her business, and for this reason she will continue working with them, taking out her tenth loan, because she considers these loans to be very necessary for the development of her business. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of a higher capacity washing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Baye Niass Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BAYE a été créé le 16/06/2009.Il est composé de 16 femmes issues du même village.Leurs activités sont: le commerce,l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Madame Amine, en position debout et à l'extreme droite sur la photo, est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 26 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 02 enfants.
Son activité est le commerce des légumes.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir exercé depuis longtemps.

Son pret lui permettra d'acheter des légumes destinés à la vente.

Son objectif est d'ouvrir une boutique afin de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Baye Niass solidarity group was created on June 16, 2009. It consists of 16 women from the same village who conduct trade, farming and cattle rearing.

Mrs Amine, standing on the far right-hand side of the photo, chairs the group. She is 26 years old, married and the mother of two children. She sells vegetables. After many years in this activity she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to buy vegetables for resale. Her objective is to open a store in order to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Olvin Daniel

texts.es:
Olvin Daniel es un microempresario que se dedica a la balconeria, tiene 31 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos varones, y reside en la colonia Poncaya en el municipio de Patuca. 

Olvin aprendió de su oficio gracias a un vecino de él, ya que éste tenía un taller y le dio la oportunidad de desempeñarse e ir aprendiendo poco a poco cada una de las actividades que se realizaban en el taller. Luego de unos año él se decidió a instalar su propio local y aunque al inicio fue un tanto dificil ya que no contaba con las herramientas necesarias, Olvin no se dejo vencer por las adversidades y siguió adelante, y actualmente cuenta con poco trabajo pero le da lo necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su horario laboral inicia desde muy temprano por la mañana y culmina por las tardes, y su hijo de 8 años luego de regresar de la escuela le ayuda. 

El prestamo que Olvin esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar metal, celosías y pintura, y tambien para pagar el flete que llevará estos materiales hasta su lugar de residencia, ya que para adquirirlos tiene que viajar al municipio de Catacamas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra sacar unos trabajos que ya tiene encargados.

Su esperanza es que la situacion economica mejore en su comunidad y asi poder tener trabajo para mantener a su esposa e hijos. Tiene tres ciclos en FAMA y ha sido un cliente puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Olvin Daniel is a micro-entrepreneur who makes balconies. He is 31 years old, married, and has three sons. Olvin lives in the subdivision of Poncaya in the town of Patuca.

He learned this trade from a neighbor. Olvin has a studio, which gave him the opportunity to gradually learn each of the components required to operate his business. A few years later, he decided to open his own shop but the start was difficult because he did not have the necessary tools. Olvin was not discouraged by adversity and pressed forward. He now has some work that gives him what he needs to support his family. His work schedule begins very early in the morning and ends in the afternoon. His eight-year-old son helps him when he comes home from school.

The loan Olvin is requesting will be used to buy metal, lattices, and paint. He will also pay the transportation costs to have these materials delivered to his home. Otherwise, he would have to travel to the town of Catacamas. With the help from this loan, he will be able to proceed with some of his outstanding jobs.

Olvin hopes that the economic situation in his community will improve so that he will have work to support his wife and children. He has participated in three loan cycles with FAMA and is a client who is prompt with his payments.

loans.use: to buy metal, lattices, and paint.

loans.name: Diego Eduardo

texts.es: El sr. Diego nacido en la localidad de Gran Chaco de Tarija, convive con la Sra. Norma, tienen un hijo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en el zona 3 de mayo de  la Guardia, El sr. Diego tiene como actividad principal la venta de comida rápida que son hamburguesas, lomito, panchitos, milanesa, etc. Sale los fines de semana por las noches. Y su mujer trabaja como farmacéutica. El destino del crédito es para aumentar el anticrético de un local para su negocio. Se siente muy agradecido por la confianza depositado en su persona.
texts.en:
Sr. Diego was born in the town of Gran Chaco de Tarija. He lives with Sra. Norma and they have a son. His home is located in the May 3rd District in La Guardia.

Sr. Diego’s main business activity is selling fast food such as hamburgers, steak sandwiches, roasted peanuts, breaded meats, and other items. He sells on the weekends and at night. His wife works as a pharmacist.

This loan will be used to extend the lease on the location for his business. He is very grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to him as a person.

loans.use: to extend the lease on his business location.

loans.name: Carlos Aurelio

texts.es:
Carlos de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Suburbio”, en una casa mixta que está hecha de cemento y de caña.

Su profesión es brindar servicios de taxi en una cooperativa llamada “Guayaquileños”. El horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo desde las 8:00am hasta las 8:00pm. Su dificultad es la delincuencia y la competencia, ya que él ya ha sido víctima de la delincuencia.

El solicita el préstamo para el mejoramiento de su vivienda comprando cmento, bloques, arena ya que quiere darle una mejor vida a su familia ya que el ingreso del dinero en su trabajo solo le ayuda a mantener a su familia y no mejorar su casa.  

El sueño de él es terminar su casa y poderse comprar otro vehículo más grande para poder desplegar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 30, lives in a periurban zone called Suburbio.  He lives in a house that is built from a mix of cement and reeds.  His profession is providing taxi services for a cooperative called Guayaquileños.  His work schedule is Mondays through Sundays from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

Delinquency and the competition are difficult for him because he has been a victim of the delinquency.

He is requesting the loan to improve his house.  He will buy cement, cement blocks, and sand.  He wants to give his family a better life, and he will provide maintenance to his vehicle.

His dream is to finish his house and to be able to buy another vehicle that is bigger.  He will do this in order to be able to extend his business.

loans.use: to buy cement, cement blocks, and sand.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Lorna is a single mother with 2 young children, both of which are currently enrolled in school. Lorna operates a grocery business and sells her goods from home and door-to-door. She's worked in this business for 4 years and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Lorna’s other source of income includes family contributions. She describes her greatest business challenge to be reaching customers during the rainy season and transportation. Her highest monthly expense is food. 

Lorna will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more onions, potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables. Lorna aspires to open a boutique in the future. She joined Yehu because they provide small loans that suit her needs.

loans.use: To buy more onions, potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Munkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbaatar, 45, is a transportation driver for a private company. He started his job this year in this company but has been working for many years as a driver. Munkhbaatar lives with his son and wife in a ger, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Last fall, he started building his own house beside his ger but could not finish it due to a lack of money, especially to purchase the necessary building materials to complete the house. He wants to finish it before this winter. Now he just needs to complete some parts of it such as windows, doors and wall insulation. Therefore, he will use his loan to purchase the building materials necessary for his new house. After the building is completed, he is planning to run a grocery store on the first floor of his house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build his house

loans.name: Eshmat

texts.ru: Эшмат проживает в районе Гиссар. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Его старший сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Эшмат занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа быка и телят.
texts.en: Eshmat lives in the Gissar region. He is 42 years old, married and has eight children. His oldest son is working in Russia. Eshmat himself has raises cattle for a living for the last 10 years. He is requesting this loan to purchase calves and a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and calves

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Wilfred is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Wilfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Wilfred takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Wilfred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Wilfred was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wilfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Wilfred will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Wilfred is pictured with his group members, and the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Mrs. Sourn is a 35-year-old married woman and has 4 children, some of whom are attending a local school. Sourn earns a living by cultivating rice crops on her own farmland, which is located in Reussey Keo commune, a suburb area of Phnom Penh city. She has been engaged in the farming business since 1993 and she typically earns a low income, approximately $1.00 per day. The main source of income depends on her husband who works as a construction foreman, earning around $5.00 each day. Mrs. Sourn has applied for a loan from HKL to buy rice seeds for growing during this season and to pay for housing repair. She hopes that she’ll be able to send her school-aged children to school next year.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for growing during this season and to pay for housing repair.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 45 year old a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school.  She has a business of selling food at a stall in Yambio South Sudan for the past eight months.
Lina is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN COPACABANA DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jugos, ella vende jugos como naranja, papaya entre otras frutas, la socia vende en el mercado desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los jugos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas como papaya, naranja, platano, leche y azúcar al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Virgen Copacabana de Ollantaytambo" community bank. The bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district, belonging to the Urubamba province and department of Cusco.

The member is Andrea. She is 50 years old and is married and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with the juice selling business. She sells juices like orange and papaya, among other fruits. The member sells in the market from 9AM until 4PM. Through these businesses, she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell juices. The member is requesting the loan to buy fruit like papaya, orange, banana, milk and sugar at wholesale.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit like papaya, orange, banana, milk and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Yator-Tumaini Youth Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Collins. He is thirty three years old, married and a father of one child. He is a member of Yator-Tumaini Youth Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
He does dairy and poultry keeping as his main economic activity. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy and poultry feeds that will consequently increase his production and income. This will enable him cater for basic family needs such as food, medical care and paying school fees for his children. 
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy and poultry feeds hence increased income to cater for basic family needs such as food, medical care and paying education fees for his children

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane K. is 49 years old married with 5 children, 3 in college and 2 in High school.

For approximately 18 years, Jane has been keeping poultry and it has been her sole source of income. She always keeps 600 broilers every crop and she constantly supplies to her customers in Kangema Town. She also has two dairy cows each producing roughly 10 litters of milk. Annually she realizes a gross income that ranges between $ 400 and $ 500 per month.

loans.use: She would like to buy a dairy cow, which would be producing approximately 20 litters of milk per day.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila has three years of experience in the business of renting washing machines, which she started with the help of her husband who bought her the first two machines. With these she started at first doing laundry at home, until the business developed and now she has reached the level of owning 7 washing machines, thanks to the effort of the entire family. She works every day of the week from 6:30 AM to 7:00 PM, with the help of her son, who is the one who delivers the washing machines to customers.

Zoila wants this loan in order to buy two more washing machines to increase her business.

Zoila is 44 years old, she is married, with 4 children, 2 of whom are still in school. Her husband has a cart which he uses to transport freight and in that way help the household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Zoila lleva ya tres años con el negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, el cual lo inicio por ayuda de su esposo que le compro dos lavadoras. Con esas empezó primero lavando en casa, hasta que el negocio le fue bien y ha logrado comprar 7 lavadoras a base del negocio y esfuerzo de toda la familia. El negocio lo atiende todos los días de la semana en horario de 6:30 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. con la ayuda de su hijo que es el que traslada las lavadoras a domicilio. Zoila desea el crédito para poder comprarse unas dos lavadoras más ya que al momento ella tiene buena acogida con su negocio. Zoila tiene 44 años, esta casada con 4 hijos de los que 2 todavía estudian. Su esposo tiene un carrito de segunda en el cual el trabaja haciendo fletes y esta manera ayuda al hogar.

loans.use: To buy two washing machines.

loans.name: Sinai

texts.en: Sinai lives in a small Samoan village, is married and has eight children.  She has a half-acre garden where she grows vegetables for sale to the local villagers.  The work is laborious, as Sinai grows many different kinds of vegetables, such as pumpkins, cabbages and carrots.  Sinai sets up a stand in front of her house to sell her vegetables.  Sinai’s family recognizes this small business as critical to their welfare and so all help out in tending the garden and selling the vegetables.  She has dreams of being able to purchase more land to expand her garden.

loans.use: Purchase seeds to grow and sell vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her secondhand clothing business

loans.name: Isel

texts.es:
Mister Isel A. is 39 years old and is married to Teodolina, who is 34 years old. They have two sons. The older one is seven and the younger one is 10 months old. They live at a house together with Isel's older brother, who is single.

Isel is a hair stylist. He opened his own hair salon 15 years ago. It is one of the busiest hair salon's in the area due to its good location and excellent work. In addition to the salon, Isel sells beauty products such as creams, shampoo, makeup, etc. Isel's wife is in charge of this business.

Isel's wife has been needing to re-stock every week due to the excellent sales. Isel wants to enlarge his beauty product business because it is very profitable. Therefore, he requests a $650 credit which he will use to purchase products such as creams, hair dyes, soaps, shampoo, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Isel A., tiene 39 años el está casado con Teodolina de 34 años. Tienen dos hijos varones, el mayor tiene siete años y el menor tiene diez meses. Viven juntos en una casa junto con el hermano mayor de Isel que es soltero. Isel es peluquero, abrió su propia peluquería hace ya 15 años, gracias a su buena ubicación y excelente trabajo es una de las peluquerías más concurridas de la zona. Además de su peluquería tienen su salón donde vende productos de belleza como cremas, shampoo, maquillajes, etc., este negocio es atendido por su esposa. Gracias a las buenas ventas que tiene, cada semana renueva su stock de mercaderías que son llevados hasta el propio local por sus proveedores. Isel desea ampliar su negocio de ventas de productos de belleza pues le deja muy buenas ganancias; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 650 que los utilizará para la compra de mercaderías como cremas, tintes para cabello, jabones, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: Purchase creams, hair dyes, soaps, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
When you walk up to Cissy’s door you can hear the sound of her sewing machine. She is hard at work most days making Busuuti’s--a traditional, hand-made garment that is never found in retail stores--or other items. Her tailoring business has enabled her to care for three children of her own and two orphan children. This delightful 43-year old woman has been sewing for 20 years. This is a very busy time, because the holidays are approaching. 
She will use her loan to stock up on cloth, embroidery, colorful threads so her clients will have a better choice of material from which to choose.  Cissy dreams that her children will go to the university. These hard-working women of the Mutundwe Village all instill in their children the importance of education. (If you would like to learn more, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: “Alinyikira: Continue Hard Work”)

loans.use: Cissy will buy more cloth, embroidery, thread for her tailoring business

loans.name: Febronia

texts.en:
Febronia is a small entrepreneur dealing with livestock keeping. She is a widow and has two children aged 31 and 33 years. She has six years experience in animal keeping and she real enjoys her job and she has a dream to become a successful entrepreneur. She is asking for a loan to buy a heater and feeding equipment for chickens and cows. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Heater and feeding equipment for chickens and cows

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace N. is a 30 year old married mother of 4 (16, 14, 13, 3) who has a retail shop as well as livestock. With the loan, she will purchase more stock for her retail store as well as purchase 2 goats. With the profits she will buy a calf and 3 more piglets.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Bora H.. She is married with three children, aged 4, 9, and 13. In 2006 Bora established a clothing and cosmetics business, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stocks of lipstick, nail polish, perfume, dresses, trousers, and shirts. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en:
M. Abdurashid is 58 years old. He and his wife have raised 2 children.

Abdurashid has been selling flowers for 15 years in the central market of the city, working from early morning till late night. Once every two weeks Abdurashid travels to the neighboring country of Uzbekistan to purchase his flowers. Over the years, he has become an expert in his business, even knowing how to save flowers during the severe winters. This business is successful, generating a stable income for the family. 

Abdurashid requests a loan of $1000.00 for the term of 8 months to purchase additional flowers for his business. Abdurashid thanks all for supporting him and promises to be punctual in loan repayment.

loans.use: To purchase flowers to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo lives at home with his parents on Inca Roca Street in the Alto Tacagua district in the city of La Paz with his wife and son. Pablo has a car with which he offers taxi services and with this income he supports his family.

The loan he is requesting is for maintenace repairs for his car so that he may continue working every day, important because it is his only source of income.

His past history indicates that he is a good client and is eligible for a new loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pablo vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Inca Roca de la zona de Alto Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y su hijo. Pablo tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como trufi y con estos ingresos mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su movilidad para poder seguir trabajando con normalidad ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance repairs of his taxi cab.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is married and has four children. She prepares food for sale. Business is doing very well and she wants to increase production.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her food production

loans.name: Urbatullo

texts.ru:
Urbatullo S. lives in Fayzabad. He is 30 years old, is married, and has no children. He works in sales. He sells petroleum products (gasoline). He has a place where he sells gas on the Dushanbe-Faizabad highway. He has been working in this business for about six years. This is the only source of income for his family. He stores his gasoline in a Gaz-53 truck. However, his truck recently broke down. He needs money to repair the truck, and therefore he decided to take out a loan. He will pay off the loan in 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Салимов Урбатулло проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст 30 лет , женат детей не имеет. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует Горючесмазочным материалом ( бензин). Имеет торговую точку на трассе Душанбе- Файзабад. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около шести лет. Эта деятельность единственный источник дохода его семьи. Бензин хранит в машине Газ-53. Но в ближайшее время произошла поломка автомобиля . На ремонт требуются деньги , поэтому он решил получить кредит и отремонтировать машину. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Repair automobile

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Ms. Luz Elena T. Q. is a member of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Fighting Women) Communal Bank, and lives in the Tarapoto District of the San Martin province in the region of San Martin. She works selling food, mainly regional dishes such as juanes and humitas (both are similar to tamales), and small tamales. She sells her food from stand No. 3 at the market located in the Huayco neighborhood of her city.

She will use the S/. 1500.00 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, for the daily purchase of the supplies she needs to prepare her dishes, such as bunches of plantains, chicken, sacks of rice, bottles of oil, eggs, bijao leaves (used to wrap the juanes), corn on the cob, dried corn and peanuts, salt, herbs and spices and other necessary ingredients.

Luz is 43 and lives with her 2 children and husband. She feels very encouraged by the support from her family and is grateful for the support she receives from the Communal Bank as well. They give her strength to forge ahead and she knows that her business is a great opportunity to grow and to be able to reach all of her goals. In the future she would like to have a business buying and selling grain because she knows that it is a very profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz Elena T. Q. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de comida, principalmente de platos de la región como juanes, humitas y tamalitos, su puesto de ventas se ubica en el mercado de abastos N° 3 del barrio Huayco de la ciudad .

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara diariamente los insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus diferentes platos de comida como: plátanos en racimos, carne de pollo, arroz en sacos, aceite en botellas, huevos en javas, hojas de bijao, (planta para envolver los juanes) maíz choclo, maíz y maní seco, sal, condimentos y otros ingredientes necesarios.

Tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos, y su esposo ella se siente alentada por el apoyo de su familia y agradecida del apoyo del Banco Comunal que le dan fuerzas para seguir adelante, está segura que su negocio es una gran oportunidad para crecer y poder cumplir con todas sus metas. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio de compra y venta de granos porque asegura que es un negocio rentable.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed A., a young man, is one of the active farmers in the Ningarhar province. He is 23, and because of civil wars in Afghanistan during the past three decades, he was not able to go to school, so he was left illiterate. He helped his father to earn income for their family.

Waheed’s father was also a farmer but now he has some serious sicknesses, and doctors don’t allow him to work. So Waheed is working alone on their agricultural lands growing tomatoes, onions, peppers, and other vegetables. Actually, they have much better lands in a good area, which is to near a marketplace where they can sell their products easily. However, Waheed still has some complaints about one thing: a lack of irrigation water. They have faced this problem for several years, and Waheed was so sad about it and didn’t know how to solve it because he didn’t have much money to purchase an electric water pump.

When one of his friends told him about the AFSG micro finance institute, Waheed became so happy and immediately requested a loan of 30,000 Afghanis.

Waheed hopes that through this credit, he will be able to purchase a water pump for his lands and stand on his own feet as soon as possible. He also dreams of a brighter future for his family, especially for his younger brothers. He thanks lenders in advance who help needy people like him.

loans.use: To purchase an electric water pump

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Собирова Дильбар 1949 года рождения. Она является вдовой и у нее 8 детей. Несмотря на свой возраст – 58 лет Дильбар занимается производством и продажей национальной одежды. Начала свой бизнес с торговли национальных платьев. Она у себя дома шьет национальные платья и продает их на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. В ее производственном ассортименте также имеются чапаны (национальное пальто). Сырье, некоторые комплектующие ее продукта, и некоторые готовые изделия в качестве ассортимента Дильбар покупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Партнерам по бизнесу является ее сын. 
Хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев для увеличения оборотного капитала.
texts.en:
Dilbar S. was born in 1949. She is a widow with 8 children. Despite her age, 58 years, Dilbar makes and sells traditional Tajik clothing. Her business began with sale of traditional dresses. She sews the dresses at home and sells them at the Khayr market in the city of Vahdat. The clothing she makes also includes the chapan (traditional coat). She buys raw materials, product accessories, and a few prepared products for her assortment of goods at the Korvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. Her son is her business partner.

She would like to take out a 10 month, 3500 somoni ($1025) loan to increase her operating capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials: cotton and fabric

loans.name: Missèbo Lucien

texts.fr: Originaire du  village lacustre de Ganvié, T. Missèbo Lucien est né le 29/05/1974 d'un pêcheur et d'une revendeuse de poissons. Il n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école. Tout petit, il fut initié à la pêche par son père et cela fait 25 ans déjà qu'il mène cette activité. Entre temps, il apprit la broderie qui constitue son activité secondaire. Ces derniers jours, il a eu l'opportunité de vente de crevettes aux armateurs. Il vient donc solliciter son premier prêt pour saisir cette opportunité. Il est marié et mère de deux enfants.
texts.en:
Originally from the lake village of Ganvié, Missèbo Lucien T. was born May 29th, 1974 to a fisherman and a fish retailer. He wasn't fortunate enough to go to school. When he was very young he started fishing with his father and has now been doing so for 25 years. In the meantime, he also learned embroidery, which constitutes his secondary business activity. Lately he has had the opportunity to sell shrimp to shipowners. He is thus seeking his first loan to take advantage of this opportunity. He is married and the father of two children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 kg of shrimp

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa R. tiene la edad de 47 años  habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla de municipio de Ticuantepe, es madre soltera, tiene una hija quien le ayuda a atender la pulpería que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerla y con la ayuda de AFODENIC que siempre la ha apoyado. Ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para comprar granos básicos y surtir la pulpería. Espera algún día llegar a crecer mucho más y convertir la pulpería en una Miscelanea.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa R. is 47 years old, lives in the town of Juan Ramon Padilla town, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother, and has a daughter who helps her with the shop that she has maintained with great effort and with the help of AFODENIC who has always supported her. She asks again for a loan to buy basic grains and to increase the inventory of the shop. She hopes that someday her business will grow and she will be able to convert it into a corner store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia es una buena cliente, vive en casa muy sencilla en El Alto, Bolivia; mantiene por su cuenta a sus cinco hijos quienes aun estan en edad escolar. Se dedica a la producciòn de chompas de lana. Además por temporadas ella elabora colchas y cubrecamas para la epoca de lluvias y para el invierno. No tiene esposo que le ayude con gastos del hogar, la señora es muy trabajadora y le colabora toda la familia en la venta de sus productos. Su sueño es poder ahorrar lo suficiente para de esa manera poder comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia is a good client, she lives in a very plain house in El Alto, Bolivia. She alone supports her five children who are still attendikng school. She makes wool sweaters for a living and eventuallly she also makes blankets and bedspreads for the rainy season and winter. She has no husband to help out with house expenses, she is a hardworking lady and the entire family helps selling her products. It is her dream to be able to save enough money to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama D., veuve avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de légumes et divers qu’elle effectue entre Bignona et Mbour. Ses revenus lui permettent de se prendre en charge médicalement et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Adama D., a widow raising 2 children, has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling vegetables, etc. between Bignona and Mbour. Her income permits her to pay her medical expenses and improve living conditions for her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling vegetables etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana A. L. is 59 years old.  She is a member of the communal bank Damas del Oriente, so named for the Villa Oriente neighborhood where the bank members meet monthly.  She was born in Huánuco, a city in the Andean mountains in Perú.  She came to the jungle city of Pucallpa in 1975 with her husband and one child.  In 1979 they purchased a plot in the José Carlos Mariatil area and there she birthed and raised four more children.

Juana’s business is to sell knitwear clothing.  She will travel to Lima 20 hours by bus once or twice a month to buy clothing in bulk.  The merchandise she purchases will stock her store until she makes her next trip.  Juana currently sells out of a stall in the “Mercado #2” market.  She must pay S./ 100 ($33) in monthly rent for a space where she will offer polo t-shirts, blouses and other men’s and women’s clothing.

Juana is currently requesting a loan of 2,100 Nuevo Soles to purchase t-shirts, underwear and men's pants for her store.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments through her communal bank.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, underwear and men's pants to stock her store

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 3 & 4 Group

texts.en: Juana R. is a member of the Nuevo Renacer Bank of Hope in Sabana Perdida, a neighborhood located in the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo. This area also happens to be very close to the Ozama River, so this is a threatened area during rainy season due to the river`s overflowing. This loan is for groups 3 and 4 of this bank. For group 3 it`s their second loan and for group 4 it's their first loan.  Juana owns a colmado, which is a small convenience store where you can buy groceries for your daily cooking, among other supplies. Most of her clients live in her neighborhood. She would like to increase her business even more and hopes that one day she will also be able to employ one person that can help her with her business. Juana dreams of owning a larger store where she can sell better, more varied products, and hopefully allow her to improve her house condition. On behalf of Esperanza and the Nuevo Renacer Bank of Hope, thank you for your support!

loans.use: purchase merchandise to restock colmado

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Lon K., 27, is a corn farmer who lives in Battambang province with her husband and two young children. She typically makes US$ 4 each day and her husband earns US$ 4 working as a construction worker. She would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport corn to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her corn to the market

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa F. is 45 years old. She is married and has six kids. Presently, two of them are pursuing education in the senior high school and the others are still in the basic school.

Theresa lives with her husband and children in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number are also involved in trading and other business activities. Theresa is in the business of palm oil production. She has been in business for eleven good years and is full of rich experiences.

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the food of the palm fruits which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (thus the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content.

Theresa desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruits in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Temple Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria S. lives steps from the Sulu Sea in the municipality of Bugasong, in the central part of Antique Province.  She has three young daughters, aged six, three, and two months old.  Her husband, Christopher, is a fisherman, as are many in their community.  Small fishing boats dot the beach near Gloria's house, and much of the local economy revolves around the sea. Gloria saw her own opportunity in all this: she realized that nobody in her neighborhood was selling basic fishing supplies, so she decided to start a business retailing materials like filament, hooks, and fabric used to make lures.  She plans to use most of the money from this loan to buy fishing supplies to start her business, and also wants to purchase one piglet to raise.Gloria hopes to be able to grow her business into an established operation, and wants to be able to earn enough money to send all her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fishing implements for resale, and to purchase one piglet.

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en: Bumi is 36 years old and she is married with five children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and cream. She hopes for a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Tsolmontuya

texts.en: Tsolmontuya D. is 33 years old and has a 5 year-old daughter. Her family, including her daughter, mother and sisters live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a professional nurse, however she has recently been running a retail business. She rents food stalls at the "Bunbugur" local food market and sells many types of desserts such as candy, biscuits, fruit syrup, and chocolate. Her working capital is 3 million tugrugs ($1 USD=1,400 MNT), and her average monthly income is 7 million tugrugs. With her profit, she has bought a plot of land and built a little house. She requests a loan to buy food products to increase her business inventory. One of her sisters helps in her business and operates the stall when Tsolmontuya goes to a wholesale market to buy food products.

loans.use: To buy food products for her desserts market stall.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline N. is a hard-working business woman of 50 years old and is married with two children who are in the university. She has a chicken restaurant business (fried chicken) of her own. She is using the loan to purchase chicken and some necessary commodities for the restaurant where she wants to increase the daily food menu. Her dream is to prosper in the business.

loans.use: To purchase chicken and some necessary commodities for the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow crops

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Las Amigas” son parte del Centro Focal “Juan Pablo”, cuenta con 11 integrantes  y se caracterizan por  ser un grupo de señoras  dinámicas y alegres. Todas las integrantes aseguran obtener el préstamo para la compra de insumos como es el arroz, papa, fideo y otros ya que la  mayoría se dedica a la venta de comida, otras de dedican a la venta de cosméticos, cotillones y calzado.

Su presidenta Bertha M., manifiesta que el objetivo del grupo es estar juntas  mucho tiempo, hasta lograr un buen ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Las Amigas” Communal Association is part of Pro Mujer’s “Juan Pablo” office. Its 11 members are a group of dynamic and lively women.
All of the members ensure that they are obtaining the loan to purchase food supplies like rice, potatoes, noodles and other items since most of them sell food for a living. The others sell cosmetics, party favours and footwear.
Their president, Bertha M., states that the group’s objective is to spend a lot of time working together in order to accumulate a good amount of savings.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food supplies

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Her sari-sari (variety) store, this is what keeps Angela B. busy all the time to just have a little earnings for her family. She is 40 years old and has five children. She thought of venturing into this kind of business to be able to provide food as well to pay the school fees and other book needs of her children.

Now, she needs additional capital of Php 14,000. She is asking for a loan from Community Economic Ventures (CEVI) to purchase assorted groceries. This, in turn, will help achieve better sales in her store.

She chose CEVI because of its credit services. CEVI also provides its clients with training and insurance coverage services to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries for her store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old. She is married to Virgilio, who is a farmer. They live peacefully in the rural village of Villa Marzo Cordon, Isabela. She is thankful for having been blessed with four children.  Their youngest is the only one still living with them and currently studying in senior high school. 

Evangeline manages a general store and is doing her best to make the business profitable. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders and hoping that they grant her request. With the loan, Evangeline will buy additional merchandise to sell and she willl expand into selling vegetables, fruits, meat, etc. in front of her store. She is also thankful that her husband helps her to manage their business and help it to grow more and become progressive.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed M. is 36 years old and a married father of five children. He lives in the Coastal Province of Kenya in a town called Miritini near Mombasa. M. runs a food kiosk in the same area and he has been in business for 15 years. His kiosk is situated in a densely populated area and hence he has been able to reach out to many customers.

This marks Mohamed's first loan from KADET and he plans to buy furniture, repair the walls of his hotel (in Kenya small cafes or restaurants are commonly called "hotels") and will buy food supplies.

Mohamed also acts as a cattle dealer and that has enabled him to supplement his food kiosk income. He hopes to open a butchery in future in the city of Mombasa.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy furniture, repair the walls of the 'hotel', and to buy food supplies

loans.name: Cedro Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cedro, esta ubicado en la comunidad campesina Cedro, en el Distrito de Anco provincia de Churcampa, Huancavelica. Comunidad ubicada al margen derecho del río Mantaro y a una hora el distrito de Anco. Entre sus principales actividades económicas, destacan la ganadería y agricultura.

Lucila, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio con el cual lleva varios años y el cual va creciendo poco a poco. Lucila, utilizará su préstamo para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio. Ella, tiene como meta, llegar a comprar una chacra, para poder cultivar café y cacao.

Claudia es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Claudia se dedica a la venta de ganado, los cuales lleva a las ferias para poder venderlos. Con el préstamo que solicita, comprará mas animales. Claudia tiene como meta inicial, hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a vender su ganado en provincia.
texts.en:
The Cedro Comunal Bank is located in the rural community of Cedro in the Anco district, Churcampa province, Huancavelica. The community is located on the right side of the Mantaro River and an hour from the Anco district. Among the primary economic activities are livestock and agriculture. Lucila is married and has four children. She sells groceries. She has been in this business for several years, and it is growing little by little. Lucila will use the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to buy a farm and be able to grow coffee and cocoa. Claudia is married and has six children. Claudia sells livestock. She takes the livestock to the fairs to be able to sell them. With the loan she is asking for she will buy more animals. Claudia’s initial goal is to make her business grow and to come to sell livestock in the province.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Malaya - Together Group

texts.en: Siah is 40 years old, illiterate and a single mother of four children. She has been involved in the sale of drinks for the past three years. Her children’s ages range between 5 – 10 years. Financial difficulty has been her major challenge; but she is successful in attracting her customers by good speech. She dreams of owning a shop of her own and hopes to educate all of her children and give them good medical attention.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Sart

texts.en: Sart S., 24, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. To earn a living, she operates a grocery store from her home, and is able to make $1.60 USD each day, while her husband makes $2.50 USD by running a moto-taxi. Sart S. would like to take a loan of $700 USD for her husband to replace his unreliable motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace an old motorcycle

loans.name: Sarda

texts.en: Sarda is 50 years old and married with four children. Currently all of her kids are in school. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits and so on in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices and washing soaps and powders to expand her business. She hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide the children with quality education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Reyna Estela

texts.es: La señora Reyna Estela O. M. de 40 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y tiene años de trabajar con Adim  donde ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, trabajadora y con visión. Ella está recibiendo este préstamo como estimulo a su labor y por ser una clienta de calidad el cual ocupara para mejorar su humilde casa que con las lluvias se le inunda.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna Estela O. M. is 40 years old and has a business selling clothing. She has been working with ADIM for years through the Violeta Group. She has demonstrated that she is a responsible, hardworking, and visionary person. She is receiving this loan as stimulus for her work and for being a good client who is concerned about improving her humble home that was impacted by flooding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja (Alfonso), de 48 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Alfonso de 25, Carlos de 23 y Luis Ángel de 9 años, en su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a la atención de su Librería bazar, la cual se encuentra en su propio domicilio, dándole la facilidad de atender a sus hijos y a la vez generarse buenos ingresos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues es tranquilo y siempre tiene mucha clientela, la cual aparte de comprar se queda conversando con ella, debido a que doña Gloria es muy amistosa con todas las personas.
Su carisma ha logrado que todos en su vecindario le tengan aprecio y por ende la visitan más frecuentemente para comprar los artículos que ofrece, además su librería está muy bien surtida.
Para el futuro, Gloria quiere mejorar e implementar mejor le área de su mini bazar, ya que ha notado que estos artículos (adornos, juguetes, accesorios personales) tienen gran demanda.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ella es muy responsable en su negocio y por ende promete serlo también en los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad mercadería en cuadernos, pues ya se le están acabando y son muy demandados, además de los artículos para su bazar.
texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, and lives with her partner (Alfonso), also 48 years old, and their 3 children, Alfonso, 25, Carlos, 23 and Luis Angel,9, in their own home.

Gloria devotes her attention to her book shop/bazaar, which she runs out of her home, allowing her to take care of her children while earning a good income. Gloria loves her work, because it is calm and she always has lots of customers, who in addition to buying stay and talk with Gloria, since she is very friendly with everyone. Her charisma has given her whole neighborhood an appreciation for her, and they visit frequently to buy the items she offers, as her shop is well stocked. For the future, Gloria would like to improve and expand the area her mini-bazaar occupies, since she has noticed that these items (decorations, toys, personal accessories) are in great demand.

This is Gloria's first loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her business and promises to make all her payments on time. With the money she is requesting, Gloria will purchase greater quantities of notebooks, since she is running out and they are very popular, as well as other articles for teh bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
N. Grace is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She prepares local brew known as “malwa” for sale, using millet that is fried on a large metallic tray, milled, mixed with water, and after a few days, it’s ready. She is 43 years old and married with 7 children, and also cares for 1 grandchild and 1 orphan.

The group has been together for a long time and all members agree that with the loans, life has improved a lot and this has enabled them to send their children to school. Grace would like a loan to expand her business by buying more millet since at the moment, she is able to make 150,000/= as profit a week. She is able to win more customers compared to her competitors because she has music in her bar and she chats with all her customers equally. She hopes to enlarge her bar and include the sale of beer as well as constructing a house and educating her children to university level. She needs a loan to help buy a bag of millet to increase her capital base.

loans.use: Buying a bag of millet for her business to be able to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin S., 41, is a humble mother of four teenage kids. One of her daughters helps cover the family’s expenses by working in the  garment industry. To makes a living, Sin S. owns and operates a small business selling groceries from home. Another income is from her husband’s climbing business. He also turns palm juice into palm wine or palm sugar for sale. The family also plants rice to supply food for themselves. Sin S. recently planted rice but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of that obstacle, Sin S. is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase condiments for resale

loans.name: Boykul

texts.ru: Оманов Бойкул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Оманов Бойкул в области животноводства более 4 лет. Он разводит животных в своем собственном доме. Оманов Бойкул одновременно занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Boykul O. lives in the Yavan region. He is 55 years old; married with 6 children. Boykul has been breeding cattle for over 4 years. He breeds the animals at home. Boykul also cultivates plants. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo A. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 1 anos de idade, não vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo quando tinha 7 anos de idade com os seus pais, mais tarde muda se para o Distrito de Boane bairro da Massaca com a sua família. Tem um negócio próprio, de criação e venda de frangos de corte é dono dos aviários a mais de 2 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Compra os pintos por 18.00mt e vende a 90.00mt o frango, neste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária mensalmente.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 18.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vacinas e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua actividade comercial. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para construir mais aviários e desenvolver cada vez mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Bernardo A. was born in the province of Inhambane, in the south of Mozambique. He is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are 1 and 5 years old. Neither is currently in school. He studied through the 10th grade but didn't continue because of his parents' lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and is not helping to support anyone else. Bernardo left Inhambane for Maputo with his parents when he was 7 years old. Later he moved to the Massaca neighborhood in the district of Boane with his family. He has his own business, raising and selling broiler chickens. He has owned two chicken coops for the past 2 years and does not employ any outside help. He buys the baby chicks for 18.00mt and sells the grown chickens for 90.00mt. This business gives him a monthly income of almost 5.000.00mt, which he uses to pay household expenses. He is also able to save some money in his bank account each month. He has never had loans with other banks. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva field partner] through friends of his who are also customers of the institution. This is his 2nd loan, in the amount of 18.000.00mt. He plans to use this money to buy products (baby chicks, feed, vaccines and other items) to continue with his business venture. His previous loan was for 15.000.00mt and was used for the same purpose. Bernardo promises to repay the loan as stated, so that he can get other loans in the future. He would like to borrow more money to build more chicken coops and continue developing his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Abiola sells motor spare parts at retail prices. With his sales, he hopes to make his business sustainable. He is happy about his business because he is the only man in this business in his community. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He is itching for progress in his business. He is 43 years old and married with 4 children. His wife sells building materials to help support their household. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare part to sell

loans.name: Kulshara's Group

texts.en: The heroes of this story are these people who always have a positive outlook and look for extra ways of using the opportunities around them. They have children and, for the sake of them and their future, these people are making great sacrifices every day. Kulshara is the leader of this group. She is forty three years old. Her husband is a member of a farm association. When he has free time he works as a taxi driver. Together they have raised five children. Two of her daughters are married while the other three children are school students. Kulshara is a housewife. Besides running a household, she has about five sheep. Whenever they need money they sell sheep to meet their needs. Sometimes they butcher the sheep and sell the meat. This activity brings them around 45 dollars a month. They started keeping sheep ten years ago. Originally they bought three sheep, fed them and sold them. This made them a pretty decent profit and became their usual way of earning money. As a result, they have been able to raise their children without obstacles. Kulshara is applying for a loan to buy one cow to produce milk for sale. Kulshara has four partners: Turganbubu, 56, raises cattle. Currently she has a horse. Her children have grown up and Turganbubu is already raising her grandchildren. Her husband is a retired man and he actively helps her look after the cattle. Turganbubu hopes to obtain this loan to buy a cow. Salkynbubu, 58, is the wife of a school teacher. She stays at home and looks after cattle. Salkynbubu is the mother of eight children. All her children have grown up and now make their own living. Salkynbubu has applied for this loan to buy some sheep. Sharapat, 58, is the mother of eight children. All her children are grown–up and live separately. Sharapat and her husband are retired. They keep some cattle and need a loan to purchase cattle. Ainura, 47, has two children. Her husband works in the local municipality. Ainura has a small shop and sells foodstuffs. She needs a loan to purchase some sheep. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of both its customers and the society), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please click here If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy 1 cow to produce milk for sale

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary Sidibé est un homme marié de 31 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire pour des raisons sociales, il commença très tôt les activités économiques, notamment manuelles à savoir la mécanique, la tôlerie, l'électricité auto, la soudure etc auprès d’un garagiste très apprécié de la place. Finalement Bakary mettra l’accent sur la tôlerie au détriment des autres. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
C’est dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires qu’il décide de rejoindre le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Il est à son premier prêt et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, une quantité de pièces détachées entrant dans les activités de tôleries (mastique, colles, gaz pour chalumeaux, baguettes, etc). 
Bakary s'approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et exerce toujours au garage où il a fait son apprentissage, avec une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Bakary espère réaliser un bénéfice de 35.000 FCFA par mois qui lui permettra d’agrandir son entreprise et subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Bakary Sidibé is a 31-year-old man, married, and father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Dougounina quarter in the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). Never having attended school for social reasons, he began working very early, notably training in mechanics, sheet-metal working, automobile electricity, and welding at a local and respected garage. Eventually, Bakary chose to work with sheet metal over the other options. With ten years of experience, he is often solicited for his business. When researching supplementary financial options, Bakary decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microcredit program. He is on his first loan and counts on using it to buy a large quantity of various materials used in sheet metal work (gum, glue, gas for torching, rods, etc.). Bakary gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and always works in the garage where he learned the business. His clients are diverse and varied. Bakary hopes to make a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA which will allow him to grow his business and contribute to his family's needs.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various materials

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
Wella R. is from the village of Initao, Iligan City. She is 57 years old. Wella is married. To make a living, Wella owns & operates a specialized retail store where she selss seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Wella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Wella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Wella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin E. P. sells electronics to make a living. Benjamin E. P. hopes to own an electronic company in the future. He is 35 years old, married with 2 children.  He is requesting for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.   He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Kasibante

texts.en: Kasibante is a single mother of five children and all her children go to school.  Kasibante doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells charcoal in Katanga, one of the Kampala city suburbs. She works in a semi-urban area  and sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for 20 years. She buys charcoal from the villages of Luwero District and uses public transport to and from Luwero to her home in Katanga.  Besides this charcoal business, she also owns bicycles for hire, which brings in 3,000/= per day.  She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season because she works from an open place.  She aspires to educate her children up to University and to invest in second hand clothes.  She decided to work with MCDT because it was giving out loans to poor women.   She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 32 años D. edad, convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Juntos residen en L. comunidad D. Manitea Alta, localizada en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, donD. tienen su propia casa a base D. adobe. Cuando tuvo su primer hijo, aun era joven y vivía en casa D. sus padres, pero le incomodaba esa situación, así que emprendió su propio negocio. Con el apoyo D. su pareja decidieron empezar a cultivar cacao, con el paso del tiempo, ambos lo llevan a vender a los mayoristas a un precio razonable. Hoy produce y comercializa cacao y café, sabe que estos dos productos son D. exportación y tienen en mente seguir ampliando su producción para un futuro cercano, siempre y cuando le tomen mucho empeño y dedicación. Por lo general sus productos los venD. en los centros D. acopio D. su comunidad, en donD. sus ventas van creciendo D. forma ascendente. Normalmente trabaja con su pareja desD. las 6:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 6:00 D. L. tarD., pero todos los domingos se da un descanso para que estén pendientes D. sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es abrir una tienda D. abarrotes con L. necesidad D. que obtenga ingresos extras. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar D. manera puntual, además respalda a su grupo comunal por L. buena organización que tienen. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para comprar abono y D. esa manera asegurar L. producción D. cacao y café.
texts.en:
