Luz is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. They live together in the community of Manitea Alta, located in the beautiful jungle of Cusco, where they have their own house maD. of adobe. When she had her first son, she was still young and was living in with her parents, but that living situation was uncomfortable so she started her own business. With the support of her partner, they decided to start cultivating cocoa. Over time, they have both come to sell to wholesalers at a reasonable price. Now she produces and sells cocoa and coffee, and knowing that these are exportable products, they have in mind that they would like to continue to expand their production in the near future. When they do, it will take a lot of effort and dedication. In general, they sell their products in their community's gathering center, where sales have been growing steadily. Normally Luz works with her partner from 6:00 in the morning to 6:00 at night, but they rest on Sundays in order to spend time with their children. Their future plan is to open a grocery store because they need extra income. This is Luz's sixth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to make repayments in a punctual manner and furthermore, she is supported by her well-organized community group. With the loan she's requesting, she will buy fertilizer and in this way will ensure better production of cocoa and coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to improve cocoa and coffee production

loans.name: Tojiddin

texts.ru: Умаров Точиддин проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. У него имеется две дойной коровы. Точиддин в основном продает молоко. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en:
Tojiddin U. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 31 years old; married with two children. He has a secondary education. For over five years he has been in livestock husbandry. He breeds livestock at home. He has two dairy cows. Tojiddin mostly sells milk. He is requesting the credit to purchase a dairy cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua K. produces locally-made soap and fries fish at Abura for sale. She has been in soap production for about ten years. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to make soap to meet her increasing number of customers. She is optimistic that she will be able to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop.

Akosua has been through junior high school. She is divorced with six dependents. She is responsible for educating, feeding and clothing her dependents.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina A.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 62 years old, married and has six grown-up children. She is from the village of Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Rosalina has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo, de 49 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. Para llegar hasta hoy, tuvo que pasar muchos desafíos en su camino, Cirilo reconoce que el factor importante radica en la calidad y al buen servicio de atención al cliente, es por ello que cuenta con clientes que recurren a su establecimiento, que es una panadería.  Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su punto de venta esta ubicado cerca de la plazuela de su comunidad. Su rutina diaria es a partir de las 5:00 de la  mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, sin embargo tiene el anhelo de tener librería, con el fin  de que pueda diversificar su cartera de clientes y del mismo modo pueda aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas pactadas, además está satisfecho con banco comunal, debido a las buenas decisiones que se toman. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima e ingredientes para abastecerse durante la producción del pan y el resto servirá para implementar su local con otros productos.
texts.en:
Cirilo, who is 49 years old, lives with his wife and their three children. They live in the community of Villa Quintiarina, located in the “ceja de la selva” area (the intersection of the Andean dry highlands and the Amazonian rainforests) in Peru. He owns a home at the edge of the forest. He has had to overcome many challenges to get where he is today. Cirilo knows that quality and a commitment to customer service are important factors for his business. Because of this, he has loyal clients that shop at his bakery frequently. He usually works with his wife, but during vacations, his children also help. His bakery is located near the main square in his community. His daily routine begins at 5 in the morning and ends at 9 at night. His dream is to own a bookstore to enable him to diversify his clientele and increase his income. This is Cirilo’s fifth loan with MFP, and he is committed to continuing to make his repayments on time. He is satisfied with his community bank because of their favorable policies. With this loan, Cirilo plans to invest in the purchase of raw materials and ingredients to make bread. He will also invest the loan to stock his business with other products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients to make break and other products for his bakery

loans.name: Dulce Amanecer Group

texts.es: Doña Lucia T. P., es una señora casada cursó el sexT. grado primaria, tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra venta y la elaboración D. canastas, desD. su niñez ella elabora cestas, para su diario vivir y hoy en día para apoyar a su esposo, para ellos, poder tener un buen ingreso, y mejorar su economía. Contando con su ayuda y D. otras vecinas y con entusiasmo formaron un grupo, para poder solicitar un crédiT.. El grupo solidario se denomina Dulce Amanecer, el grupo cuenta con 7 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades económicas, entre las cuales podemos mencionar, la artesanía, comercio, crianza D. animales, como gallinas cerdos, ganados, el crédiT. ella utilizara para capital D. trabajo (elaboración D. canastas). Para ellos poder incrementar su economía y capital, deseando que su negocio sea mas granD. y productivo.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia T. P. is married and has attended school through the sixth graD.. She has three children, all in school. She makes a living buying, producing and selling baskets. She has been making baskets since she was a child, T. cover her daily living costs and now T. help her husband increase their income and improve their economic position. Together with some of her neighbors they have enthusiastically formed a group T. be able T. request a loan. The mutual group is called Dulce Amanecer (Sweet Dawn), and it has 7 woman members, who make a living through various activities. Among these activities are craftsmanship, commerce, raising of animals such as chickens, pigs, and cattle. The loan will be used for working capital (for the making of baskets). In order T. be able T. improve their financial position they need T. grow their business and become more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: God Blessing #4 Group

texts.en:
Hawa K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of 5 borrowers known as "God Blessing #4." She is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her children are between the ages of 9 and 23 years old. She explains that she was only able to attend school through the fitth grade due to financial constraints.

For the past 20 years, to earn a living, she has been selling red oil in the "Redlight Market” outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her portion (5,000 LRD) of the requested 25,000 LRD ($275) group loan to buy more gallons of red oil. She describes herself as an easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing additional red oil

loans.name: Sofia Davila Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Sofía Dávila” es el nombre que las señoras eligieron para su grupo, es parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana. Este es su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, el nombre corresponde a una referencia de la calle en su barrio. De las ocho socias todas son mujeres. 

La presidenta es la señora Walda, ella  trabaja desde hace algún tiempo con el tejido de “mantas”, su solicitud  ha sido por Bs.1000 y apoya a su marido en la venta de arena.  Las mantas son elaboradas por ella misma y las vende en la feria de la Zona 16 de Julio y la arena es vendida a pedido.

Hace unos años ella participó de otro Banco Comunal en Pro Mujer y su experiencia fue positiva, pues comenta que logró ahorrar lo suficiente como para hacerse hacer una placa dental.   En esta oportunidad ha solicitado Bs.1000.-, este dinero será utilizado para la compra de lana.   Aprendió este negocio de una prima hace 2 años.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: artesanía de mantas, carnicería, tejido de mantas, venta de verdura, venta de carne, tenido de camas, tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
The members chose to call their community bank "Sofia Davila". It is part of the organization entro Focal de Panamericana. This is their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner). The name of the community bank reflects the name of a street in their district. There are 8 women members in this group. The leader of the group is Walda. She has worked for some time in knitting shawls for a living. Her loan request is in the amount of Bs. 1000. She also helps her husband sell sand. The shawls she mades are for herself but she also sells them in country fairs of the Zona 16 de Julio region and she takes orders for the sand she sells. Some years ago she was a member at a difference community bank, though still with Pro Mujer. Her experience was very positive. She managed to save enough money to have a set of dentures made for herself. She requests another loan in the amount of Bs. 1000 and it will be invested in the purchase of wool. She learned the craft 2 years ago from her cousin. Other businesses within the group are: shawl knitting, butcher shop, produce sales, meat sales, bed linen sales, and a corner store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a member of Upendo Group of Faulu Kenya. He operates a butcher shop to earn a living. His business is located in a very competitive environment with most of his customers being people from his area. Having been in the business for eight years, he hopes to open other outlets. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a refrigerator and an energy-saving cooker so as to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and an energy-saving cooker

loans.name: La Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Guadalupana, esta ubicado en el municipio de san marcos guerrero, decidieron ponerle este nombre por que dicen los integrantes que todos son de católicos y devotos de la virgen de Guadalupe es por eso que tomaron esta decisión, la historia es acerca de la señora luciana C. P., ya que es la presidenta del grupo ella tiene 44 años, esta casada con el señor Antonio con el cual tiene 3 hijos, Marisol de 24, Eduardo de 19 y Esteban de 16 años de los cuales la mayor ya esta casada y los otros dos están estudiando uno tercero y el otro primero de prepa, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva mas de 9 años.

Luciana decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que un familiar le comento que era una muy buena fuente de ingresos, también por que esto le ayudaría para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos al igual que para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas mercancía como son: arroz, fríjol, leche, azúcar, galletas, papel higiénico, jabón, detergente y demás artículos para tener un poco mas surtida su tienda. 

Ella esta muy contenta por que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes, y por lo mismo sus ingresos también han incrementado satisfactoriamente, tanto que hasta se compro una licuadora.

Su negocio beneficia mucho alas personas de su población ya que como casi no hay tiendas ahí cerca y así no tienen que caminar mucho, aparte de la atención y el buen trato que les ofrece además de los precios accesibles.

La meta que tiene doña luciana es la de continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mas su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas el lugar en donde tiene su tienda para así tener mas variedad de productos, y mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen de hace algún tiempo y son muy responsables con sus pagos, ya que no quieren defraudar la confianza y apoyo que le están brindando.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia al igual que continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada uno de los integrantes del grupo.
Sugey Campuzano Hernández-venta de pan
Guadalupe P. V.-venta de antojitos
Luciana C. P.-tienda de abarrotes
Ana bertha E. C.-venta de tamales
Ofelia P. V.-venta de ropa
Lourdes C. L.-venta de colchas
Yulli dayana G. C.-venta de zapatos
Jorge C. P.-venta de combustibles
Maria N. G.-venta de antojitos
Rogaciana R. G.-venta de tamales
texts.en:
The Guadalupana group is located in the municipality of San Marcos Guerrero. The members decided on this name because they are all Catholics and followers of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

Since Señora Luciana C. P. is president of the group, the following information is about her. She is 44 years old, married to Sr. Antonio, and has three children: Marisol aged 24, Eduardo 19, and Esteban 16. The eldest is already married, and the other two are in high school. 

Luciana has run a grocery store for nine years. She decided to open the store when a relative told her that is was a good source of income. Also it would help her husband pay for household expenses, the education of their children, as well as improve the standard of living of the family. With her loan she has bought more merchandise: rice, beans, milk, sugar, cookies, toilet paper, soap, detergent, and other items so that the store is a little better stocked.

Luciana says she is very happy because the store is doing well. Sales have gone up a lot and she has more customers. As a result her income has increased satisfactorily, so much so that she has bought a blender.

The store has also brought benefits to the community as there are hardly any stores nearby so now people do not have to walk as far. Also they get friendly attentive service and affordable prices.

Luciana’s goal is to continue supporting her children with their education so that they can get good jobs and have a better future. She also wants to expand her small business by making the store a little bigger so she can carry more stock and earn more money.

She tells us that the group members work hard. They have known each other for a quite a long time and are very responsible about making repayments on their loans. They do not want to betray the trust and help that have been given to them. Luciana is very grateful to the Realidad Foundation and Kiva for their support which has enabled her to improve her own and her family’s standard of living, and to continue running the store.

The names of the group members and their activities are as follows:
Sugey Campuzano Hernández-baker
 Guadalupe P. V.-sells snacks
 Luciana C. P.-grocery store
 Ana Bertha E. C.-sells tamales 
Ofelia P. V.-sells clothing
 Lourdes C. L.-sells bedding 
Yulli Dayana G. C.-sells shoes 
Jorge C. P.-sells fuel 
Maria N. G.-sells snacks 
Rogaciana R. G.-sells tamales

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Maria Exilda

texts.en:
Maria is fifty-two years old.  She is married and has two children.  The family owns their own home.  They live in the village Sector Medio in the district of Tambogrande in the region of Piura.  It is a highly agricultural region in which many residents manage small mango or lime plantations and raise animals.

Both Maria and her husband inherited small properties from their parents.  These are currently planted with mango and rice and her husband works in their fields.  Additionally, Maria cares for a small herd of cattle at the home.  The cows provide milk which she sells to the municipality for local governmental programs.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for her animals and additional fertilizer in order to maximize the crop yield on the family’s properties.  

Maria is a dedicated mother with big dreams for her family and children.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 38 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. She works with her husband they sell milk in Nyarugenge district in Rwanda.  Frida has nine years' experience in her business selling milk. She employs two people and her store is open from 7am until 9pm every day of the week. 

Frida has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business and she hopes to one day open a supermarket.

loans.use: To expand her milk sales business

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José se dedica a una pulpería desde hace 3 años, inicio este medio de vida cuando tenía ciertos ahorros que necesitaba. El ya lleva tres años trabajando en este negocio y con esta actividad solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria. El desea realizar algunas mejoras de modo que pueda brindar un mejor servicio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito con el objetivo de comprar materia prima. Pedro es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y confiable.
texts.en: Pedro Jose has had a grocery store for 3 years.  He started in this line of work once he had accumulated the savings that he needed.  He has already been working in this business for 3 years, and with this business he covers his personal expenses and helps to support his family.  He wants to make some improvements to his business so that he can provide better service.  To do this, he is requesting a loan to buy raw materials.  Pedro is a person who is quite calm and responsible.  The people who know him consider him to be a friendly and reliable person.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj T. is 60 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a small house and fence in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. Nyamdorj operates a small grocery store in his town. He sells a variety food products in his shop. After moving to his town in 2007, he started his grocery business by selling a variety of consumer goods from a stall at the local trade center. He has found success with his business in a short period and his earnings have enabled him to open his own grocery shop where he operates his business. In addition, he plants vegetables which he sells at the local market to supplement his earnings. In the future, he plans to expand his business by increasing his product line. He is a hardworking and modest and says, "My one goal is to increase my earnings so that I can provide a good education for my children." 

He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase groceries so he can increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luzmila; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de pan, ella es propietaria de una panificadora y vende  diferentes clases de panes, uno de los panes se llama pan chuta que es un nombre típico del distrito de Oropesa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, manteca y azúcar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Luzmila is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling bread.  She owns her own bakery and sells different types of bread.  One of the breads she makes is called 'pan chuta' which is a traditional name in Oropesa district.  Luzmila would like to expand and improve her bread-selling business.  She is requesting this loan to buy flour, butter and sugar.

Luzmila is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and sugar

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie, 48, is a widow and has three children between 19 and 24 years old. All her children attend school. 

Marie sells different items in her boutique such as rice, beans, potatoes and cooking oil. 

She decided to request a loan to make her business grow and add more products to her sales. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. She has a dream to invest in her children’s further studies.

loans.use: To add more products to sell

loans.name: Loh

texts.en: Loh K. is a village woman who lives with other family members in Phnom Penh City. To earn a living, Loh K. sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier or from fishermen. She is married and blessed with six children. One is married and living away from home, and the other five are single. Two of her daughters work as employees in the garment industry. Also, Loh K. relies on extra cash that is earned by her husband, who is a driver. Loh K. would like to use her loan of US$ 500 to buy small fish to make fish-paste for sale.

loans.use: To buy small fish to make fish-paste for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy P. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old. Nancy is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 6. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nancy wishes for her family to be happy and healthy always.

Nancy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school. Grace has a business operating a milling machine, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more maize to process for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and sometime pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Grace hopes to open up another milling machine in Kumi town.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to process for resale.

loans.name: Nhek

texts.en:
Nhek N. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. Nhek is a farmer, earning an income of 1 USD per day. Her husband is a security guard, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. Each month the family has to spend 20 USD on food and 35 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Nhek is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. She would like to purchase a tuk tuk, a motorcycle-based taxi, for one of her family members to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a tuk tuk

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a handicrafts (shells) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional shells for her business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional shells for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine W. is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. They live at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, school fees and clothing. 

She has had a retail shop business for the past 12 years, selling household consumable items like wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in her area of operation. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 45 years old and married with 4 children.  Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store business.  Emelia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cooking oil, milk powder and other groceries. 

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is from the village of Aplaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old, married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Margarita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, beverages, shampoo, and soap in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Margarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages. This loan will be Margarita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages

loans.name: Jose Hilario

texts.es:
José, es casado, tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él se dedica a la siembra y producción de hortalizas, cada año realiza la siembra de chile dulce, pepino, ejote y maíz, tiene 5 años de estar en esta actividad.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar semilla de chile, pepino y ejote, además de fertilizantes, con esto se le ayudara a incrementar el área de cultivo y tener mejor posibilidades de ganar más ingresos con la producción.
Para José el propósito es tener buenas cosechas, darles un cuido adecuado, tener una buena comercialización y con esto ayudar a su familia y en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, 46, is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He grows vegetables every year such as sweet chile pepper, cucumber, green beans and corn.  He has been involved in this activity for five years.

He is requesting a loan to buy chile pepper, cucumber and green bean seeds, as well as fertilizer.  This will help him increase his cropland and have a better chance of earning more income from his production.

José's goal is to produce better harvests by giving his crops the proper care, and achieving a good sale price with which to support his family, especially his children.

loans.use: To buy chile pepper, cucumber and green bean seeds, as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Mahougnon 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON 2 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Monique Berthe. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Monique Berthe est née le 11 Juillet 1979 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Athanase. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Monique Berthe a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Monique Berthe mène comme activité la vente de tissus et de chaussures par le système de distribution. Monique Berthe exerce cette activité depuis près de sept ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Monique Berthe s’approvisionne au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Monique Berthe et aux autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON 2, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Mahougnon 2 is a group of three people whose president (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is Monique Berthe.  All members live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  In order to increase working capital, the group is requesting a second loan from Alidé.  Monique Berthe was born July 11th, 1979, in a city in Benin, and is married to an accountant named Athanase.  They have four children, all attending school, two of which are still in their care.  Monique Berthe only attended school for a short time.  To meet her own needs and those of her children, she has been working selling fabric and shoes by distribution system.  For seven years, this business has enabled her to cover her family’s various expenses.  She buys her supplies in Togo, a neighboring country.  This second loan is expected to enable Monique Berthe, as well as the other members of the Mahougnon 2 group, to grow their business, expand their customer base and increase income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and fabric

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús de 31 años de edad, reside en su casa con su esposo e hija de 4 años de edad. Teresa es una mujer emprendedora que ha convertido su casa en un negocio. Hace tres años que posee una tiendita en la cual vende variedad de productos como: arroz, aceite, pan dulce, detergente, champo, azúcar, leche, café, etc. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy accesible y concurrida. Gracias a la buena ubicación del negocio y a la habilidad de buena vendedora que posee a Teresa los clientes la  prefieren. Además se caracteriza por mantener lo que el cliente necesita y sobre todo con los mejores precios. Ha pensado en aumentar su inventario para seguir dando a sus clientes el mejor servicio y poder mantenerlos satisfechos para que siempre demanden sus productos. Debido a que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder invertir en su negocio ha decidido solicitar este crédito con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera su calidad de vida y la de su familia cambiará. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de artículos de tienda como: detergentes, granos básicos (arroz, azúcar, frijoles), golosinas, pan dulce, y de más artículos que permitan a traer a más clientes demandantes de sus productos.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesus is 31 years old and she lives at home with her husband and their 4-year old daughter. Teresa is an enterprising woman that has converted her home into a business. Three years ago she has a small store from where she sells a variety of products, such as: rice, cooking oil, pastries, detergents, shampoo, sugar, milk, coffee, etc. Her business is located in a region that is very accessible and well traveled. Thanks to the good location of the business and her good knowledge of sales, clients prefer to buy from Teresa. She is also known to keep in store what the clients need and at better prices. She has thought about increasing her inventory to keep providing her clients with a better level of service and to keep them satisfied so that they will continue to demand her products. Given that she does not have the resources she needs to invest in her business she decided to request a loan. Her faith is set on God to improve the quality of her life and that of her family. She will use her loan to purchase store products, such as: detergents, basic grains (rice, sugar, and beans), sweets, pastries, and other products that will help her attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase store products such as detergents, basic grains (rice, sugar, beans) sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Surumpen

texts.en: Surumpen, 58, is married to Tonuo and they are blessed with ten children. She has been trading livestock for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 30,000. This is her third loan from Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy goats for sale. Her hopes are to export the livestock to neighboring countries in the future.

loans.use: To buy goats for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado y vive en casa propia ubicada en una comunidad rural del distrito La Matanza en Morropón. Juan es un hombre que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Juan se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de menestras , a los pobladores de su comunidad y alrededores. La experiencia de Juan ha hecho que este cuente con clientela fidelizada que prefiere sus productos ante otros. 

Juan solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de menestras, frijol, maíz y otros. Esta inversión hará que Juan aumente su clientela y por lo tanto sus ventas.

Él es conocido en su comunidad  y conoce muy bien su mercado. Gracias a su negocio ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida, y espera continuar con ello.

Juan es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Juan, 53, is married and lives in his own house located in a rural community in La Matanza District in Morropón.  Juan is a man who has good personal and work related references.

For the last ten years Juan has been selling vegetables to local and nearby residents.  Juan’s experience has led to his having a well established base of regular customers that prefer his products over others.

Juan is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, beans, corn and others.  This investment will lead to Juan’s increasing his clientele and thereby his sales.

He is well known in his community and he is very knowledgeable of his market.  Thanks to his business he’s been able to improve his quality of life and he hopes to continue doing so.  Juan is a very responsible person.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beans and corn.

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 21-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. Despite her young age, she has been working for several years as a beautician. Her business is based at her home and she also works as a freelance beauty specialist. She provides her customers with manicure, pedicure and wax services. In parallel, she has newly started to work in a local supermarket. Her income is very important because she helps her husband with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laser machine in order to satisfy her customer’s demands. In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon to expand her business level.

loans.use: to purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina es una mujer ejemplar D. 53 años, que lamentablemente se divorció D. su pareja Marino, con quien tuvo cuatro hijos D. los cuales sólo vive con José en su casa propia ubicado en la ciudad D. San Ramón (selva central peruana). Ella se siente feliz; desD. hace 18 años que ama sus plantas D. frutas cítricas, plátanos y papaya  a las cuales se ha dedicado todo este tiempo, proporcionándole el cuidado necesario que requiere por eso confiesa que le encanta caminar a lo largo y ancho D. sus tierras porque toda la actividad agrícola le hace sentir viva, “sin mis cosechas no hubiera podido tener nada, D. que hubiera comido, educado a mis hijos, juntando dinero me compré mi casita donD. además crío cuyes para comercializar y para mi consumo por eso digo con la bendición D. Dios y porque eh sabido trabajar nada me ha faltado”, afirma Segundina, al mismo tiempo que comenta que sus ingresos son seguros cada 15 días ya que cosecha plátanos con lo que cubre los gastos D. los productos D. primera necesidad que requiere, mientras las ganancias D. las naranjas, mandarinas y papaya son para ahorrar y solventar alguna eventualidad que se presente más adelante. El sueño que tiene ella, con el tiempo es tener su propio dinero (capital), para plantar nuevos frutos en los terrenos agrícolas que posee. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Gotitas D. rocío” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. está convencida D. cumplir con los pagos del su cuota pues ya conoce la metodología D. trabajo en su banco comunal, además agradece al apoyo brindado. Segundina D. recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Segundina is an exemplary 53-year-old woman who sadly was divorced from her husband, Marino, with whom she had four children.  Only one of them, José, lives with her in her own house located in the city of San Ramón (Peruvian Central Jungle).  

She feels happy.  For the last 18 years she’s loved her citrus fruit plants, bananas and papayas that she’s dedicated all this time to providing the necessary care.  She confesses that she loves walking along her entire field because all agricultural activity makes her feel alive.  Segundina affirms:  “Without my crops I wouldn’t have been able to have anything, nothing to eat nor been able to educate my children.  Saving money I was able to build my little house where I raise guinea pigs to sell and for my own consumption.  This is why I say that with God’s blessings and because I’ve known how to work I’ve lacked nothing.”

She also affirms that her income is secure because she harvests bananas every two weeks and that covers her basic needs while profits from oranges, mandarins and papaya are for savings and to cover any unexpected expense that might crop up later.

Her dream is eventually to have her own money (capital) to plant new crops in the fields she owns.  She belongs to the “Gotitas D. Rocío” (Little Dewdrops) and this is her sixth MFP loan where she’s convinced that she’ll make her installment payments since she is well aware of her communal bank’s method of operation.  In addition, she gives thanks for the support provided.  If Segundina were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers to spread among her plants.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Altansukh is 41 years old, and lives with his wife and two children in UIaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2009 and used to work as a vendor in a private food production company. Altansukh tries to work hard and he does not take days off. His daughter, Binderya, is an accounting student at the university, while his son, Khash-Erdene, is a pupil in secondary school. 

Recently he has requested a loan to renovate part of his house. He wants to convert his hallway to a dining room with a gas furnace. This would be important for his family's finances, as well as their living conditions, and harmless to the environment. Also he is planning to insulate the walls. Therefore he needs funding to purchase building materials such as brick, cement, sand and iron pipes.

loans.use: To purchasing building materials such as brick, cement, sand and iron pipe to renovate his house.

loans.name: Kossiwa Délali

texts.fr:
Kossiwa Délali est une femme de 36ans. Elle est mariée à un fonctionnaire. 
Kossiwa Délali travaille comme revendeuse de matériels scolaires depuis 3 ans. Elle fait le commerce  ambulant des fournitures scolaires. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente après les rentrées scolaires.
Kossiwa Délali a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des fournitures scolaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwa Délali désire ouvrir sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Kossiwa Délali is 36 years old and married to a civil servant. She has been selling educational materials for 3 years and sells her products on the street. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. Her main challenge is getting through the period of low sales after the beginning of the school year. 

Kossiwa Délali is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy more school supplies. Sometime in the next few years, she would like to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, natural de la ciudad de San M. de 40 años de edad esta casada con Rogelio de 45 años y fruto de esa relación tienen dos hijos, Jilmer de 22 años y Zulma de 12 años y juntos residen en su propia casa. Marcelina, es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su familia. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra café, cacao, noni y frutos de plátano; actividad que lo viene realizando durante 20 años, con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad. Gracias a ello logró comprar dos hectáreas más de terreno para ampliar su siembra. En temporada de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente tiene que contratar jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad su faena programada. Además cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, por tanto necesita de un capital para sembrar más plantas de cacao y noni. Es así que este será su crédito número 07 con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar sus planes. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará más semillas de cacao y noni.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a native of the city of San M.. She is 40 years old and married to Rogelio, age 45. They have two children, Jilmer (age 22) and Zulma (age 12), and live together in their own home. Marcelina is a hardworking woman who strives each day to provide the best for herself and the members of her family. She works in the fields growing coffee, cacao, “noni” (a type of fruit grown in the tropics), and bananas. Marcelina has been farming for 20 years with great care and effort. Thanks to what she has achieved, she was able to purchase two additional hectares of land in order to increase her plantings. During the harvesting and weeding season, it is necessary for her to hire laborers to perform their tasks quickly so that the work stays on schedule. In addition, Marcelina has tracts of land that have yet to be cultivated. For this reason, she needs capital for planting additional crops of cacao and “noni”.

This will be her seventh loan with MFP. Marcelina hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can follow through with her plans. The money she requested will be used to buy more cacao and “noni” seeds.

loans.use: to buy cacao and "noni" seeds.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Don Vicente, de 47 años de edad, labora como docente de educacion primaria en la escuela en la colonia desde hace 4 años. Está solicitando su 2do préstamo con el propósito de mejorar una habitación en su casa embaldosandola y repellandola,y de esta manera darle condiciones a su famlia y tener privacidad entre cada uno de los miembros del hogar, es muy querido por en su comunidad ya que lo consideran un docente abnegado y con mucha responsabilidad tanto con su familia y con la comunidad educativa. sus esperanzas para el futuro es que su familia viva digmente en una casa con buena infraestructa  que le permita un ambiente favorable a sus miembro.
texts.en: Vicente, 47, has worked as an elementary school teacher his neighborhood for the last four years.  He’s asking for his second loan to do some home construction; he will install tile and plaster walls to provide his family with better conditions and so that each family member can have privacy.  He is very well liked in the community for he’s considered to be a dedicated teacher who is very responsible with his family and with the educational community.  His hope for the future is that his family lives in a dignified way in a house with good infrastructure that will provide a favorable environment for each of its members.

loans.use: to do some home construction.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 and owns and manages a variety store in their village. She has four adult children and they are already married. She aims to improve her business and earns income to support her grandchildren and save for future emergencies. While managing the business, she also experiences problems and difficulties due to competitors and calamities. Through her faith and determination, she continues managing the business and she aims to make an improvement in it.

She is requesting an additional capital of P23,000 to buy soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help her to increase her product offering and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that she will make her business grow and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario is divorced with one child. He is 49 years old and resides in Tabo-o, Misamis Occidental. The loan he acquired in his first cycle of loans at GDMPC was of great help to his family. He was able to get "ani" (yield) of about 5 bags of rice. He was very happy and he was able to return the money loaned for his farm. 

Apolinario also has another line of business aside from farming as he is also a fisherman. Apolinario owns and operates a business in the food sector selling his own caught fish in his neighborhood to earn a living.

He has been in this business for more than five years. Each month, he earns 2,200 PHP doing this type of activity. He requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy new materials for fishing like nets. Apolinario has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Apolinario plans that he will buy a pump boat for fishing.

loans.use: to buy new materials for fishing like nets

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been a vegetable vendor for four years in her village. She sells her products on a door-to-door basis. She also grows vegetables in her garden and sells them whenever they are ready. Marilyn is hoping to borrow a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to have an additional capital to buy more vegetables to sell. With her patience in vending, she is generating an income of 300 PHP daily, which is sufficient for the daily needs of her family. She hopes that she can maintain her business and for it to grow. 

Marilyn is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She and her husband Edgar, who is a farmer, are blessed with three children. Their eldest, Edmarie, is 15 years old, followed by Edmar, who is 11 years old. Their youngest is Denmark, who is 7 years old. Their three children are presently studying. She hopes to give them a complete education with the help of her business. Their family lives in the village of San Manuel province of Isabela.

loans.use: To buy cabbage, squash, and beans for her business.

loans.name: Sedjro Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO est un groupement constitué de quatorze personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Mélanie Judith. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même village et exercent leurs activités dans un même marché. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Mélanie Judith est âgée de 45 ans et vit au  Bénin avec sa famille. Mélanie Judith est mariée à un maçon du nom de Casmir. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois à leur charge. Mélanie Judith et son mari subviennent ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Mélanie Judith n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Mélanie Judith mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (sel de cuisine, huile végétale, etc.) et des plastiques de façon secondaire. Mélanie Judith achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin et les revend dans sa région. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Mélanie Judith et aux autres membres du groupement SEDJRO, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: SEDJRO is a group consisting of fourteen people, whose leader (with her hand raised in the photograph) is Mélanie Judith. The group members live in the same village and conduct their trading in the same marketplace. In order to increase their working capital, this group is requesting a second loan with ALIDé. Mélanie Judith is 45 years old and lives in Benin with her family. Mélanie Judith is married to a mason called Casmir. The couple have six children, all school educated, three of whom still live at home. Mélanie Judith and her husband work together in meeting the various needs of the family. Mélanie Judith did not go to school. For about fifteen years, Mélanie Judith has been a trader of various products (table salt, vegetable oil, etc) and plastic goods on a smaller scale. Mélanie Judith buys her products in a town in Benin and resells them in her region. This second loan will certainly allow Mélanie Judith, and all the members of the SEDJRO group, to increase their business and to grow their customer base and their income.

loans.use: To buy various products (vegetable oil, plastic goods etc)

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of farming Mamerto believes that he will lift their status of living and provide for the needs of his family. He is 49-years-old and has been ten years in this business. He has been blessed with four children and he wants to educate them all to become successful men someday.

He is working hard and strives harder to yield a better income to satisfy their needs and provide his children an education. But due to the high cost of school fees and food costs every day, he is not able to save for the operation of his farming business. For this reason, he is asking for a loan amount of P20,000 to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in improving his business. He hopes to develop his business to boost his family’s status of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in improving his business.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 49 years old. She has one child who is 15 years old. She sells different items such as rice and salt. She has spent 10 years in the business. She has requested this loan to add new items like cooking oil, beans and rice to sell. She plans to use the profits for saving. In the future, she would like to like to be the wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca Esi

texts.en: Rebecca Esi is a fishmonger. She also sells eggs at Efutu. Rebecca has been selling eggs for four years now. She is a single parent and has one child. As a single parent she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay the school fees of her child. Rebecca needs this loan to purchase more eggs for sale. With the new profit Rebecca wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs for sale

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Isabel junto a sus padres viven en el distrito de Matucana. Ella  tiene 27 años de edad, es separada  y tiene 01 hijo la cual sido su motivo para seguir adelante.   Hace 02 años que Isabel  trabaja brindando sus servicios de  niñera, pues es de esta manera como a   seguido  apoyando a su niño, también nos manifiesta que  ayuda a su madre la cual cuenta con un negocio de ventas de dulces en un kiosco. El anhelo de  Isabel es de estudiar la carrera de Gastronomía pues piensa instalar un restaurante en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de dulces como galletas, caramelos, gaseosas y chocolates y así tener surtido el  kiosco de su madre. Isabel agrade a los prestamistas Kiva ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en: Isabel lives with her parents in the district of Matucana.  She is 27 years old, separated, and has 1 son who has been her reason for carrying on.  For 2 years Isabel has worked providing babysitting services, which is how she has managed to support her son.  She says that she also helps her mother, who has a business selling candy at a kiosk.  Isabel hopes to study for a career in gastronomy, since she is thinking about setting up a restaurant in her home.  She has asked for a loan at this time so she can purchase items such as cookies, candy, soft drinks, and chocolates in order to restock her mother’s kiosk.  Isabel is grateful to Kiva lenders, since they are making her progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, candy, soft drinks, and chocolates.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Bich is 30 years old, married and earns a living selling meals to people who live in her community. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City and is applying for a loan to buy more furniture, high-quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this loan will allow her to better meet the needs of her current customers and attract new ones. Her goal is to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that may face her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture, high-quality food and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Mr.Gansuh lives with her wife in a apartment of Uvurhangai province. He is 26 years old. Her wife work in the local bank. He worked by assistant driver from 2004 to 2006. He started his business in 2006 by transporting goods and people. Since then, he has been continuously transporting. He has many years of business and practical experience. He is a public and reticent man. He is a hard-working and diligent man. He is requesting a 3,000,000MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! The above picture presents Rose, a mother who has been practicing agriculture for the last five years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her family in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is known for dairy and maize plantations. Rose primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. 
Generating an income through selling her harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. She also keeps a dairy cow. 

Availability of labor is a major challenge for Rose. Before joining Juhudi, Rose could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high-risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Kerbut farmers. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva. Rose is seeking a loan build a fence around her homestead. Through the loan, her cows will not go to her neighbor’s farm destroying crops, hence saving money that she used to pay for damages. She will also benefit from controlled grazing of her animal and keeping away thieves. Rose waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for a fence.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 31 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She does farming and has been growing cash crops for sell for 3 years. She also sell clothes and it has been profitable. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant during this rain season rainy season and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her farming business, make more income and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers to plant during this rain season rainy season and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 53 Years old, married with 2 children all in college. She is a teacher by profession and also a farmer. She has 2 dairy cows; they produce 10 litres of milk thus, she earns USD 3 per day. The business has been successful due to the ready market of fresh milk which she sells to the neighboring homes. She wants to start selling shoes to supplement income from milk and her teaching salary. With all income inflows, she believes the expenses of her family will be managed and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: She is to construct a shed for her cows and improve on cattle feeds so as to increase milk production.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa lives in Mbagala, Temeke District in Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child.

Sharifa runs a tailoring business from the verandah of her home. Business has not been good recently - she doesn't have enough sewing materials and she faces competition from her neighbours.

She wants to improve her business by having a better supply of sewing materials and renting business premises. The verandah of her house does not attract customers and does not provide her with enough space.

She also needs to buy two sewing machines and employ one assistant. Her strategy requires a capital boost of $550. Sharifa dreams of being a professional dressmaker in the near future.

loans.use: Adding to stocks of sewing and tailoring materials and buying two sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reyna is a single mother with three children and the eldest helps her with her business. She used to work in a government office but her salary was not enough to cover her family’s expenses, and she therefore started to make yogurt and fruit cakes which she sold to her coworkers in her office. Little by little more orders came in, so she decided to work in this full time. She made a part of her home into a small restaurant in which her daughter serves the clients. As the demands from her clients increased she started to offer a home delivery service using 5 motorbikes.

Reyna is requesting a loan of US $ 925 to purchase merchandise and also to repair one of the motorbikes. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Her and her family thank you for your support so that her business can continue to grow and their quality of life can improve.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe esta casada y su esposo trabajaba como obrero, por ello su sueldo no le alcanzaba para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar, por ello, se decidió a hacer algo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, y empezó vendiendo pan, leche frituras por que no tenía más capital pero con el paso del tiempo sus excedentes los reinvertía en el negocio, luego con el tiempo pudo comprar el terreno en donde ya tenía una tiendita más surtida y ahora su esposo la ayuda con el negocio, ya que ha crecido y cada vez tiene más clientes y desean continuar con su crecimiento para mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia.

María Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo por US $925 para comprar mercadería y tener mayor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por apoyo que le brindes para continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Norma Velia

texts.en:
Norma is married and has three daughters. Her husband works as a truck driver transporting logs, but his salary isn't enough to cover the family's basic needs. As a result, Norma started a business preparing and selling foods from her home. With her daughters' help, she has been able to move her business forward and the quality of her products has earned her many customers.

Norma is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to buy a cooking stove, which will allow her to prepare her foods in less time and contribute to the continued growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es casada y tiene tres hijas, su esposo se dedica a la transportación de de troncos de madera pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por esta razón Velia comenzó su propio negocio con la venta de comidas en su hogar, con ayuda de sus hijas ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y gracias a la buena calidad de los productos sus clientes se han incrementado.

Para poder mejorar su servicio, Norma necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una estufa, esto le permitirá realizar sus comidas en un menor tiempo y continuar creciendo. Se parte de los logros de Norma y decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase a cooking stove

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria and her husband have a business selling car radiators. They started this business seven years ago, and currently rent a location. With the loand they will increase the purchase of radiators and therefore increase sales. She is 35 years old, has three children, and is part of the group called Santo Tomas 4.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

GLORIA junto con su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de radiadores para automóviles, este negocio lo inicio hace siete años y hasta el momento rentan un local. La fotografia en la que aparece fue tomada en su casa y ahi podemos visualizar como secan la ropa en dias de lluvia .Con el préstamo aumentaran la compra de radiadores y de esta forma aumentar las ventas. Ella tiene 35 años, tres hijos y forma parte del grupo llamado Santo Tomas 4.

loans.use: Purchase car radiators

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is a merchant of food, clothes and medium-quality jewelry in private and public offices in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a public transportation driver and with their combined incomes, they are able to support their three sons. They live in the district Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. The credit she is seeking will be used to increase her merchandise. This way she will be able to increase her income. This is the fourth loan with Impro. She is an outstanding client and is recommended for another loan. She has been our client since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes es comerciante múltiple de comida, ropa y joyas de mediana calidad, productos que comercializa al crédito con pagos diario en las oficinas publicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja de transportista público y así complementan los ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos; vive en la Zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será utilizado para incrementar su mercadería y de esa forma poder generar mayores ingresos familiares. Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo. Ella es nuestro cliente desde el año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif B. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Arif is engaged in fruits and vegetables sales in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business ten years ago. Arif needs a loan in the amount of $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Rachel A.. She is married with one child, aged 2. In 2005 Rachel established a business selling flour, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of flour in bulk.

loans.name: Adinajon

texts.en: Adinajon A. lives in the Asht region and she is married and has five children. Mrs. A. has a home business raising and selling livestock, as well as making yarn and warm socks, which she has been doing for ten years. She also works in a collective farm. Mrs. A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $350.00 to purchase special yarn dyes.

loans.use: To purchase special yarn dyes

loans.name: Aghigat

texts.en: Ms. Aghigat owns a household items store in the small town of Saatli, which is located on the central regiion of Azerbaijan. Aghigat is a widow with one child and is looking for funding so that she can expand her inventory to cover a wider range of household goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of items for her business

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Tumaini K., who is married and has one child, aged 7. She also has two other dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2002, Tumaini established her pharmacy business. Working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, assisted by her one employee, she earns about $170 every month from this business.

Tumaini has already received and repaid four loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to add to her inventory of medicines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $87. In the future, Tumaini plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicines at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Nouglozé

texts.fr:
Born on July 14, 1977 in Kpové, in Haho prefecture, Nouglozé T. did not have the chance to go to school. Very early on, he started working in the milling business. An owner of a milling machine in his town, he is married and the father of four. In addition, he has his mother to care for. A very energetic and honest man, he figured out how to manage his initial loan and to repay it without incident. Once again, he is requesting a loan for setting up another mill. Thus, he is thinking he will increase his bottom line and therefore his income. He will then be able to help more in improving his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né le 14 juillet 1977 à Kpové dans la Préfecture de Haho, Monsieur T. Nouglozé n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études. Très tôt, il s’est lancé dans les activités de moulin. Propriétaire d’un (1) moulin, dans sa localité, il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. En plus il a la charge sa mère. Très dynamique et honnête, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit obtenu et l’a remboursé sans incident. De nouveau, il sollicite un crédit qui lui servira à installer un second moulin. Par ceci, il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi, contribuer d’avantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and install a milling machine

loans.name: Erika Yuridiana

texts.es:
Erica is a member of the Las F. de Maria ("Flowers of Mary") group-lending organization. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin and earns a living making and selling food. She operates her business at home, serving her customers, many of whom are students at the nearby Universidad Nacional. Her experience making various dishes, her skill with flavors and her need for an income of her own all led her to start a restaurant business, something that will allow her to help her husband with the family's expenses.

With the S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 4 months, Erica will set up her business by buying bulk supplies of products such as rice, sugar, pasta, (bunches of) bananas, cooking oil and condiments. She knows that prices for those commodities aren't stable and she wants an inventory on hand so that she doesn't run out when she most needs them. She also wants to stock soft drinks because she's seen that they sell well, especially in this particular area.

Erica, 24, is a loving and determined women with two children. She lives with her partner and dreams of having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Erica Yuridiana F. Ríos, es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto ”Las F. de Maria” vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, y espera a sus clientes en su propia casa ubicada en jr Sucre Nro 56 Barrio San Martín, una gran cantidad de sus clientes son los alumnos de la Universidad Nacional ya que su local se ubica cerca de esta institución educativa. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio, la impulsaron a iniciarse en este negocio, para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, ella implementará su negocio, pues comprará insumos como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, plátano en racimos y aceite a granel y condimentos, en vista de que no hay estabilidad en los precios de los productos y no le falte sus insumos al momento de preparar los alimentos a vender, además esta implementando su negocio con la venta de gaseosas, por que vio que si tiene buena salida este producto, sobretodo por la ubicación de su local.

La señora Erica Yuridiana tiene 24 años es una mujer muy amorosa y decidida, tiene dos hijos vive con su actual pareja y sueña con tener un Restaurante.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pants, shoes and beauty products for a small business.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Джамшед 1976 года рождения, женат, у него 3 детей. Занимается продажей тканей на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. Предпринимательскую деятельность начал в 1998 году с продажи тканей на местном рынке «Гулистон». Потом к бизнесу присоединился его отец и теперь это семейный бизнес. В 2005 году на вырученную сумму построил небольшой магазин. Товары для продажи привозит с рынков «Корвон» и «Саховат» города Душанбе. 
Ассортимент продаваемых им товаров пополнился разновидностями халатов. В разгар сезона продажи тканей и материалов хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров: материалы и ткани.
texts.en:
Jamshed was born in 1976. He is married and has three children. He sells fabrics at the “Khair” market in Vakhdat city. He went into business in 1998 selling fabrics at the local market “Guliston.” His father joined the business and now it is a family business. In 2005, he built a small store where he sells products that he buys from the “Korvon” and “Sakhovat” markets in Dushanbe city. He wants to increase his range of products with different robes and fabrics. During the height of the season for the sale of textiles and fabrics, he wishes to participate in Kiva’s program and to take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni to purchase seasonal products: fabrics and textiles.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics

loans.name: Salla M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Salla L., who is married and has two children aged 12 and 10. In 2008, Salla established her butchery business. Assisted by her husband, she opens her business seven days a week, 9-12 hours a day. Salla is requesting a loan in order to purchase more cattle, and in the future plans to establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina tiene 44  años, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante, ya que las aspiraciones que tiene para sus hijos  es brindarles lo necesario para  sus estudios. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, que lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona. Además, es propietaria de un motocarro, que es manejado por su esposo Dacio, quien siempre la apoya en todo. Para tener en perfectas condiciones a su motocarro necesita comprar repuestos para mandar a repararlo, desde luego quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio de la venta de ropa,  ella necesita de un capital  para cumplir con su objetivo. Ayudemos a esta madre, que con esfuerzo y dedicación hace todo lo posible por seguir progresando.
texts.en:
enedina is 44 years old. She is the mother of 3 children who are attending school and they are her reason to keep going, wanting to provide her children with what they need for them to keep going to school. She sells clothing, taking it to different locales in her region. She also owns a motorcycle and it is chauffured by her husband Dacio. He supports her in everything she does. To get their motorcycle in perfect condition she needs to purchase spare parts. She also wishes to keep her clothing sales business growing, and she needs working capital to meet her objectives. Let us all help out this working mother, that with her great efforts and dedication she does everything she can to keep up her progress.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to fix their motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Isabel Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s MARIA ISABEL viven en el barrio camilo ortega es en la zona urbana de Masaya, cerca del mercado municipal, a pesar de ser humilde y de escasos recursos este grupo ha salido adelante por estar ubicado cerca del mercado municipal, lugar que el g/s ha explotado para hacer crecer sus negocios, ya que el vivir cerca les evita el pago de piso.
Doña carla elabora colchones y almohadas es un taller familiar ya que su esposo e hijos le colaboran con la producción, una vez elaborados ella los comercializa en su casa y en los departamentos del país de forma ambulantes, ella tiene garantizada la comercialización ya que tiene mucha demanda y es un producto que esta dirigido a abastecer al sector pobre.  Los créditos de adim les  han servido para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que el g/s los invierte en la compra de materia prima. Sus mayores sueños es poder preparar a sus hijos, lo cual dicen lograrlo con mucho esfuerzo y tenacidad.
Este g/s ha sido capacitado por desarrollo empresarial en los temas de autoestima y manejo del negocio, para lo cual se siente bien agradecidas con adim, y prometen no quedar mal para gozar de sus beneficios.
texts.en:
