The members of the group MARIA ISABEL live in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood, in the urban zone of Masay, near the municipal market. Despite being humble and of few resources, this group has taken advantage of being situated near the market, a place they have exploited to help their businesses grow. Being near the market lets them avoid having to spend a lot of time traveling back and forth. Carla makes bedspreads and pillows in a family workshop, given that her husband and children collaborate with production. Once made, she sells them in her house and throughout various areas of the country on foot. She has guaranteed sales since there is a great demand and it’s a product that is directed to supply the poor sector. The loans from ADIM have helped grow her business, since the group invests the funds into purchasing raw materials. Her greatest dreams include preparing her children, which she hopes to accomplish with much effort and tenacity. This group has received business development training in areas such as self-esteem and management, for which they are very grateful to ADIM, and they promise to not end up badly so they can enjoy the benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital; purchase of raw materials to increase production.

loans.name: Asombang

texts.en: P. is married and has four children. She is proud of having children with her husband. She was so disturbed when all her children were sick and some members of her family, who were very supportive in providing needs of her family, died. She made up her mind to turn to GHAPE for loan in other to help and care for herself.  With her previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with cassava, manure, groundnut, egusi (a popular protein-rich seed used for soups) , and yams. Given a loan, she plans to buy egusi, beans, fertilizer, and chemicals to expand her farming. She intend opening an account for herself with the profit. She plans to repay the entire loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings, manure, and tools

loans.name: Marinita

texts.en:
Marinita R. V. is sixty-six years old and has one daughter whom she supports. She lives in the Callería district of the city of Pucallpa, Peru. Marinita used to have a charcoal-selling business, but is now selling chickens for a living.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to be repaid in six months to fund the purchase of turkeys and turkey feed. Marinita plans to raise the birds and re-sell them to market vendors and direct users. Marinita also rents out a house for extra income and she sometimes uses the capital from her Kiva loans to make repairs to the space. She is pictured in the photograph above with two birds she is currently raising for sale.

loans.use: buying turkeys and turkey feed and making repairs to the rooms she rents out in her house

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
El Sr. Rubén vive en pareja con la Sra. María  hace 5 años con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. Él se dedica al cuidado y asesoramiento del control de suelo para la plantación de caña de azúcar, algodón, tomates y otros.

Rubén proviene de una familia de agricultores, hace 7 años que emigró de su ciudad natal Ybycuí para asentarse actualmente en la ciudad de Itá.

Comenta que le va muy en su trabajo, ya que gracias a ello ayuda a muchas personas para la siembra de productos hortícolas.

Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura y comenta que es lo que realmente le gusta hacer.

En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo que destinará a la compra de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Rubén has lived with María, with whom he has a 2 year old son, for 5 years. He dedicates himself to the care and consultancy for the planting of sugarcane, cotton, tomatoes, and others. Rubén comes from a family of farmers. It has been 7 years since he migrated from his birth city, Ybycuí, to settle down in the city of Itá. He says that he is getting along very well in his work, given that thanks to him he helps many people in the sowing of horticulture products. Since he was very young, he has dedicated himself to agriculture and comments that it is really what he likes to do. In this opportunity he is asking for a loan that he will use to buy insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticide

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun R. is 45 years old and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. He is a local mechanic, working out of his home and makes around US$ 6 per day. His wife is a good housewife who stays at home and cooks for family members. This couple has three children and two of them are students.  Mr. Bun R. is asking for a loan to purchase mechanic's tools.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Tusooka Group (B)

texts.en:
Khamis runs a restaurant that has been in operation for eight years and employs three people. Khamis’ restaurant sells local foods such as posho, matoke, rice, beans, fish and various types of meat. Posho is a starchy product made from corn flour and water. Matoke is made from unripe bananas that are steamed wrapped in banana leaves. Both are staples in the Ugandan diet.

Khamis provides for her four children, ages 15, 13, 4, and 3 months. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant. She has already bought the necessary equipment like tables, chairs, bowls and utensils, so she is now able to restock her food storage with her loans. She will now buy things like flour, beans, salt, sugar and other items that can be bought in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sugar, salt, flour, and beans

loans.name: Millicent Akinyi

texts.en: Millicent Akinyi W. is a 26-year-old mother of three children, ages 10, 6 and 4. All are in school.  Millicent is married though her husband is not employed. On the weekends, Millicent works as a caterer. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 KSH so she can start her own business selling food. She hopes that her business will turn enough profit to allow her to go back to school so that she can one day start her own catering company as a professional.

loans.use: ingredients to make food for sale and classes

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
This is Mariama M., Issa K., Safiatu T., Fudia K. and Adijatu I.K A.. They named their group Sorbeh. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leone Leones. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve on their standards of living.

Mariama (left) is the leader of this group. Mariama is forty-nine years of age. She was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is married and the two of them have three children together. One of their children is in college and the two are still in secondary schools. Mariama sells items like biscuits, lollipops, cigarettes, tins of milk, batteries, pencils etc. She has been in this business for seven years now.

loans.use: Expand on her business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro M. manages a small rice field. He tills the land that his wife owns. He is 36 years old and the father of three children. In the past, he worked as a collector. He got only a small compensation for his work. That is why, when he got married to Eden M., his wife, he decided to manage and take care of the rice field to feed and clothe his family. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides, The loan will help a lot to achieve maximum yield from his farm. Pedro is also growing other crops for their other needs.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have a business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Юсупова Гульсара-женщина 39 лет. Замужем и мать  3-х детей. Имеет высшего образование и дополнительно работает зам.директором ООО «Барфак». Гульсара занимается продажей техники  и одеялов на рынке «Панчшанбе».Магазин берёт в аренду. Гульсара закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Гульсаре помогает двоюродная сестра Малика. Кредит получила на расширения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Gulsara U. is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a higher education and also works as an assistant director at a firm. Gulsara is involved in sales of equipment and blankets at the Panshanbe market. She leases her store. Gulsara buys her goods in the city of Bishkek in Kyrgyztan. Her cousin Malika helps with this business. Gulsara wants to use this loan for expanding her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Phan Thị

texts.en:
L. Phan Thị, 22 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has a baby. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling woven materials to local businesses and community members. L. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND ,which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. The loan will be the third loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Luafalealii

texts.en: Luafalealii F., 32, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience producing pork buns, german buns and pancakes.  She sells to the village community and general public 5 days per week.  Luafalealii  has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Luafalealii’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of flour, baking powder and yeast.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor and her husband are persevering to meet the needs of their family. The couple, together with their children, live peacefully in the village of Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They have two children, Jeremy and Mariska, who are now in elementary school. She hopes to give their children the best education to give them a better life someday. 

Despite the hardship of life, they still have the strong determination to support the education of their children and to save for their future. Her husband manages their watch-repair shop in the Public Market while Flor sells different products like vegetables and some cooked snacks. Due to lack of business capital, she came to propose a loan of PHP 10,000 for the maintenance of their watch business in their place. Flor is hoping that somehow, they will be able to overcome the hardships of life that her family is experiencing.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Санавбар

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Санавбар продолжает расширять свой бизнес. Свой ассортимент продуктов питания которым она торгует  около дома в летний сезон  добавила прохладительные напитки и мороженое. В период кредитования она увеличила товарооборот и хочет на следующий займ закупить риса и муки.

loans.use: На закупку риса и муки

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Helen is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Helen is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La joven Luz Marina G. de 27 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada y con un hijo de 3 meses, su negocio es la venta de visituria en variedad, desde los 16 años esta en las ventas el cual inicio con ahorros, su esposo es comerciante y la apoya. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa. Con este préstamo  comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y estar en mejores condiciones con su familia. A futuro es poder tener su propia tienda y no andar vendiendo ambulante ya que corre mucho peligro. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del financiamiento ya que solo mediante el préstamo se puede salir adelante por que todo esta caro y los salarios no suben.
texts.en:
Luz Marina G. is 27. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married and has a three month old son. She sells a variety of jewelry. She has been selling since she was 16, which she started with savings. Her husband is a merchant, and he supports her. Her plan is to be able to finish making her house. She will buy construction materials with this loan. It is to make a room for the family to be in better conditions. The future plan is to be able to have her own store and not have to walk selling on the street because it is very dangerous. She thanks the institution for the opportunity of the loan. It is only through the loan that she is able to get ahead because everything is expensive and salaries do not rise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make a room

loans.name: Sarah Kabenge's Group

texts.en:
Sarah, age 25, is a tailor. She also works as a teacher at a tailoring and knitting school in Makerere Kikoni. She is unmarried and has no children, although she does take care of additional family members. Sarah rents a one-room house which she shares with three people. There is electricity in the home, but no piped water. Sarah ensures that they get three meals a day.

Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala, and she works six days a week. She buys threads and other materials from Kikuubo, one of the busiest marketplaces in the city of Kampala. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping at the market, which is one of the biggest markets in Uganda, so she often uses public transport. The major challenges she faces in her business are seasonality, increasing prices of thread, and high transport costs. Sarah has been in this business for three years.

She has been with MCDT for one year and she and her group mate are now requesting thier third loan together. She wants to use this loan to buy thread, needles, knitting materials, and dressmaking materials. Sarah aspires to see her tailoring business grow bigger and dreams of eventually owning her own sweater-knitting school.

loans.use: To buy thread, needles, knitting materials, and dressmaking materials

loans.name: Esminia

texts.en:
Esminia, a 41-year-old businesswoman, lives with her husband, Salvador, in the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. They are blessed with three children and all have graduated from high school. They are not pursuing their studies in college because they are not interested in doing so. However, they now have their own sources of income and Esminia is glad that they’re trying to find what’s best for them.

Esminia is in the livestock business but so far she only has one hog. So she decided to engage in another business. She is now planning to start-up a retail business in their village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as starting capital. If given the chance, she will make it productive in the best way she can in order to provide better living conditions for her family. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: To use as start-up capital for a retail business

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La señora Erika M. vive en una casa de interés social  con sus tres hijos, ella obtiene ingresos por medio de un pequeño negocio que  tiene en una escuela primaria de venta de dulces, golosinas, refrescos, hielitos, etc. Con este negocio lleva 2 años el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco, requiere este préstamo para poder surtirlo de mercancía nueva por la temporada de invierno que se acerca y así poder seguir dando su servicio a los niños de esta primaria y de cierta manera para seguir teniendo ingresos pues de esto es de lo que ella mantiene a sus pequeños hijos. Ella comenta que siempre ha buscado la manera de sacar a delante a sus hijos aun que sea un pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Erika M. lives in a publicly-subsidized house with her three children. She obtains her income by means of a small business, located in an elementary school, selling sweets, treats, drinks, frozen treats, etc. She has been working with this business for two years, and it has has grown little by little. She needs this loan to be able to supply her business with new merchandise for the winter season that is approaching. Thus, she will be able to continue giving her service to the children of this primary school and also continue having an income because this is what maintains her own young children. She comments that she has always looked for a way to put her children first, even though the business is small.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Ramona Hercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ramona B. se dedica a laborar como conserje en una empresa de la capital con el fin de llevar a su casa de habitación el sustento para el bienestar de su familia. 

La señora Ramona tiene un pequeño hijo que está estudiando y requiere invertir en el pago de la matricula para garantizar que el próximo año su pequeño siga estudiando y  es por este motivo que ella solicitó el crédito para pagar la matrícula del colegio y así garantizar que su pequeño continúe estudiando para llagar a ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Ramona B. works as a janitor for a company in the capital city of Managua. She does this to bring home support for the well being of her family. Ramona has a small child who is in school. She needs to pay the enrollment fee to guarantee that her little one will be able to keep studying next year. That is why she is asking for this loan, to pay for his school enrollment. That way she will guarantee that her little one will continue his education to be able to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school enrollment fee for her son

loans.name: Augustine B.

texts.en:
Augustine B. T. sells used clothes for men in Makeni city. He wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000.00 to enable him to improve his business. With a loan, Augustine will be able to add two bales for Three Button Shirts, three bales of Jeans for men and two bales of Men Shirts. This will eventually lead to more sales and improve profit. He will thus be able to take greater care for his six children, wife and parents.

Augustine was born in a village call Yele, in northern Sierra Leone. He is now thirty-seven years old. His wife is a businesswoman too – both of them are managing the same business. Their children are attending schools – four in primary school, one in secondary school and one is not of school going age. Augustine has twelve years of experience in selling used clothes.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of used clothes

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus is a big business man in his community in Agbor, Delta state. He sells rechargeable phones and accessories at retail prices to his customers. He says LAPO has affected his business positively. He has used LAPO loans and the support of his family members as capital for his business. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He travels to Cotonu and Togo to purchase his goods to sell in Agbor. He is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones and accessories to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita, 42 years old, farms for a living. She has been married to her husband, Roger, for fifteen years. She has five children and the oldest is fourteen. She started farming ten years ago. Rice crops are what Sherlita plants on her land. She wants to maintain her business because it is her family's only source of income. Like any mother, she also wants all her children to finish school and find a decent job someday.

Sherlita recently joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, to take advantage of its financial services. She says that her farm needs to be financed, but she lacks the money to do so. She applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP. This loan will be used for seeds, fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Fatou Bintou F. est une femme mariée de 43ans, mère de 8 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’habits et de fruits locaux de saison comme les oranges, les pastèques. Ce prêt lui servira à augmenter son capital pour mieux contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou F. is a married woman who is 43 years old and has eight children. She is active in the trading of clothes and local seasonal fruits such as oranges and watermelons. This loan will be used to increase her capital so that she can contribute more to her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading of clothes and local seasonal fruits

loans.name: Marble

texts.en:
Marble is 40 years of age and a single mother of five children aged between 10 and 20 years. All her children go to school. The family owns and resides in a two roomed house where she stays with eight people. She takes care of additional family members.

The family has access to electricity but do not have piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day.  Her greatest monthly expenses includes paying utility bills, school fees for children, medication and feeding the family.

Marble sells passion fruit juice in Kawempe market. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over twelve years.  Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.  She sells on a retail basis only.

She has been with MCDT for eight years and is servicing her seventh loan, working with the same group mates all this time. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of passion fruit. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own and start distributing to different shops.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of passion fruit

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en:
Leticia S. is from the town of Silauan Norte, Echague. She is 46 years old. Leticia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI/Kiva. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Leticia S. Group.

Leticia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leticia has been involved in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leticia is requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: In 2008, Ibrahim, a 24-year-old single man, decided to open his own men's clothing sales shop to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  With those goals met, Ibrahim is now requesting a loan of $800 to increase his inventory and buy more clothes such as jeans, tee shirts, sweaters etc. to attract more clients and continue to meet his clientele's various needs.

loans.use: To increase his inventory and buy more clothes

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal A. A. is a hard working man who is determined to excel in his business and family. To make a living in Ibadan, he sells rechargeable phone cards at retail prices to his customers. He hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He hopes to expand his business. His greatest challenge in business is funds and he hopes to overcome the challenge. He is 64 years old and married with seven children. He is not only a husband and father; he is also a happy grandfather. His wife sells pastries to support her husband. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cards to sell

loans.name: Te Agbo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  en détails d’appareils électroniques, il a une clientèle de taille composée de toutes personnes. Il n'a plus de stock de marchandises alors qu'il fait face à une demande élevée, il doit rehausser son stock pour satisfaire convenablement ses clients. Il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l’achat de divers appareils électroniques, il s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé.
 Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, le revenu de son commerce lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman’s income generating activity is the retail of electronic appliances. He has a sizable clientele made up of all sorts of people. He does not have any merchandise in his stock while he is facing a high demand. He must increase his stock to properly satisfy his customers. He is requesting a first loan from WAGES to purchase electronic appliances. He gets his goods from the independent port of Lomé. He is married and the father of two children. The income from his business allows him to provide for the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electronic  appliances

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Mr. K. Antonio L. is 33 years old, married and is blessed with two children who both attend primary school. He owns a battery shop at Bloco A in Nyendo where he sells and also charges batteries. He is using the loan to purchase more batteries for sale and more charging machines. His future hopes are to expand his business into a wholesale business and also to buy a plot of land in town so that he can construct more rental houses to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase more batteries for sale and more battery chargers.

loans.name: Ayeyi Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Florence A. is thirty-two years old. She is married and blessed with six children, most of who are currently in basic school. The last born is only two while the first is nineteen years old. Florence lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a commercial driver.  

Florence is a very hard-working woman. She is into trading. Florence trades in groceries such as tins of milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She has been running this business for five years and aspires to expand her store in the near future. She is also hopeful to give all her children the best education she can afford. She requests the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up her business.

Florence is the leader of a seven-member trust bank group called ‘Ayeyi’, meaning 'praise'. The group members are mainly into food production and trading activities. It is the dream of the members of this group to access this loan so as to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Aramanzani

texts.en:
Aramanzani is a 31-year-old man living in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with three children aged 7, 5 and 3 years. His wife is unemployed, meaning the welfare of the family is charged on Aramanzani. He dreams of seeing his children educated to university level just as many Ugandans now wish, having realized the significance of education.

Aramanzani has been obtaining credit from HOFOKAM through which he has been able to finish building his residential house and also buy a motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business. Besides the business, he also deals in produce and farming as he tries to make ends meet.

This is Aramanzani’s fourth loan from HOFOKAM. He intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito R. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Lolito is married and has five school-aged children. To earn a living, Lolito owns and operates a business venture in the transportation services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor-transport services. Lolito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lolito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolito is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicles in order to provide better service. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Lolito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicles.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Тошева Мехринисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 44 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. У нее магазин, где она продает муку оптом. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
T. Mehriniso lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She's forty-four years old, married and has four children. She has a high school education and makes a living by selling large quantities of flour in her store. She has been in business for fifteen years, and is asking for a loan to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. is a palm oil extractor in Abura. She has not received any form of education. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a palm wine tapper.

Efua has been extracting palm oil for five years now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits to process into palm oil

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.fr:
Theoneste N., née à bugesera  secteur Sake l’Est du pays, marié, il a 4 enfants, il a 40 ans, son ainé a 17  ans et son dernier enfant à 10 ans et  son niveau d’éducation est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à sake Bugesera. Tous  ses enfants vont à l’école. Avec son épouse ils travaillent pour faire vivre et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Il fait le commerce des habits pour détail et pour  la couture dans le centre commercial de Sake qui est un centre rural mais qui en voie de développement.

Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé DUFATANYE,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  tous commerçants et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Theoneste et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en amenant leurs enfants à l’école. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles de leur commerce et les revendre, une partie du profit est  réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour un bon futur.
texts.en:
Theoneste N. was born in Bugesera, in the Sake district in the Eastern part of the country. He is 40 years old, married with four children of whom the eldest is 17 and the youngest 10 years old. His level of education is primary. He lives with his family in Sake Bugesera, and all his children attend school. He earns his living together with his wife and they seek to improve their family’s living conditions. He sells clothing retail and for tailoring in the commercial area of Sake, which is a developing rural centre. He belongs to a solidarity group named Dufatanye, whose members are all merchants and provide each other mutual guarantee. Theoneste and his group work to ensure their family’s subsistence, improve their living conditions, and provide schooling for their children. In fact, the group has obtained a loan from the Amasezerano Community Banking association, to buy items for resale in their commerce. Part of the profit is reinvested to ensure the group’s financial stability, and put into savings to prepare for a prosperous future.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for retail sales and for tailoring

loans.name: Asata

texts.en:
Asata I. operates a provisions shop at Takoradi and has been in this trade for some time now. She will use the loan to purchase extra provisions to fill her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

Asata is married to a driver and has a child. She uses the earnings she generates from her sales to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has been through senior high education.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to fill her shop

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
Esta UDE lleva por nombre "Las Guerreras", este nombre lo decidieron las integrantes por que es así como se consideran, personas que luchan por lo que quieren para sacar a sus familias adelante y para tener una mejor calidad de vida, de ahí el nombre de guerreras.
 
Una de las lideres de esta UDE es la señora Claudia Francisca M. Ramírez, de quien trata esta historia ella es madre soltera que lucha día a día para sacar a sus cuatro hijos delante de entre 13 y 23 años de edad, ya que los cuatro estudian ella es costurera y con el préstamo que recibió va a comprar cierres, hilos, telas, agujas y demás material que necesita para seguir con su trabajo.
 
Doña Francisca decidió dedicarse a esta actividad por que aprendió este oficio desde hace varios años, ya que fue su madre quien le enseño y también por que tenia que buscar la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante y tuvieran un mejor futuro, puesto que no tenia a nadie quien la apoyara económicamente.
 
Me comenta que le esta yendo muy bien con las ventas de su negocio, sobre todo ahora que los estudiantes regresaron a clases, ya que tuvo mucho trabajo por que le hicieron varios pedidos de uniformes, para las escuelas primarias, secundarias y preescolares y gracias a esto sus ingresos incrementaron bastante.
 
Quiere darle las gracias a FRAC y a los donadores de kiva, ya que gracias a ellos , ha podido continuar con su negocio para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios, ya que también ha mejorado bastante su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
 
El sueño que tiene doña claudia es le de poder comprarse unas 4 maquinas, para poner su taller de costura y así darle empleo a mujeres que al igual que ella son madres solteras, y necesitan trabajar para sacar a sus hijos adelante, también quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que terminen una carrera profesional y tengan mejores oportunidades de vida.
 
Las personas que integran  la UDE de "Las Guerreras" y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
María Teresa M. R.-costurera
Claudia francisca M. R.-costurera
Eloisa Cristi A. A.-venta de sabanas
Bricia G. A.-venta de cosméticos
Vigail A. R.-venta de ropa 
Minerva S. T.-sastrería
María Isabel M. V.-venta de ropa
Isaina M. R.-venta de perfumes
Luis M. R.-mecánico
Adriana L. H..-venta de refrescos
Minerva S. R.-venta de mole
texts.en:
This communal bank goes by the name "Las Guerreras" (The Warriors); the members decided upon this name because it is how they see themselves, as people who fight to get ahead with their families to have a better quality of life. One of the leaders of this communal bank is Claudia Francisca M. Ramírez. This is her story: she is a single mother who struggles daily to support her 4 children who are between the ages of 13 and 23, since they are all in school. She is a dressmaker, and with the loan she received she is going to buy zippers, thread, fabric, needles, and other materials that she needs to continue with her work. Claudia Francisca decided to go into this line of work because she learned to sew a number of years ago since her mother taught her these skills. Also, she needed to find a way to support her children so that they would have a better future, since she did not have anyone to support her economically. She tells us that the sales in her business are going well. Now that the children have returned to school she has had a lot of work because she had a large number of orders for uniforms for the elementary, secondary and pre-schools. Thanks to this work her income increased substantially. She wants to give thanks to FRAC and to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to them she has been able to continue with her business and continue supporting her children in their studies. She has also substantially increased the quality of life for herself and her family. Claudia Francisca dreams of being able to buy 4 sewing machines to put in her sewing workshop. In this way she could employ women like her who are single mothers and need work to support their children. In addition, she wants to continue to pay for her children's education so that they can finish their professional degrees and have better opportunities in life. The members of the communal bank "Las Guerreras" and the activities they carry out are the following: María Teresa M. R.-dressmaker Claudia francisca M. R.- dressmaker Eloisa Cristi A. A.- sells bed sheets Bricia G. A.- sells cosmetics Vigail A. R.- sells clothing Minerva S. T.- tailoring María Isabel M. V.- sells clothing Isaina M. R.- sells perfumes Luis M. R.- mechanic Adriana L. H..- sells soft drinks Minerva S. R.- sells mole (chili sauce)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy zippers, thread, fabric, needles and other supplies

loans.name: Edwin Kipkorir

texts.en:
Edwin Kipkorir C. is 25 years and married to Judy Yatich. They have a child who is nine months old. They live in Chepkoilel, outside of Eldoret town. Edwin has a communication service bureau and phone repair shop where he earns his income. He has been in this business for the past three years with an income of 5,200 KES per month.

Edwin was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES with KADET LTD, with which he plans to purchase phone accessories and spares.

He hopes to open the same business in the nearby town like Iten, Kabarnet, to increase family income.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories and spares.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis Felipe es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para ofrecer servicio de transporte) el ofrece su servicio dentro de su ciudad y en las zonas aledañas. Su esposa trabaja en una pollería y con lo que ganan tratan de sacar adelante a su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil y el mal estado de muchos de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Por ello Luis Felipe ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luis Felipe es una persona tranquila y bastante honrada. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luis Felipe is 30 years of age and the father of a family who lives in the district of Chepén. Chepén is an agricultural area which is doing well economically, located in the province of the same name in the region of La Libertad, just one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Luis Felipe works transporting cargo and passengers on a mototaxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorcycle attached to a cabin which can be used for public transport). He offers his services both in the city and in the surrounding areas. His wife works in a poultry store and with their combined income they try to bring up their family.

The continual use of his mototaxi and the state of many of the roads in the area have left Luis Felipe's vehicle worse for wear and in need of urgent repairs. Because of this, he is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time.

Luis Felipe is a very honest and easygoing person. Those who know him consider him to be both responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: Cost of repairs and maintenance for a mototaxi

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet operates a cafeteria where she sells chips. She has two employees in her business. She also depends on her husband for financial support.  

She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to get capital for her business, which has been running for five years. She wants to own at least two cafeterias in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shilings to buy potatoes for cooking chips.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for cooking chips

loans.name: Las Vigueñas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "Las vigueñas", esta localizado en L. comunidad D. las vigas, municipio D. san marcos guerrero, las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre en honor al nombre D. su comunidad, ya que están muy orgullosos D. pertenecer a esta localidad, L. historia es acerca D. L. señora armida I. B., ya que elL. forma parte D. este grupo, tiene 47 años D. edad, esta casada con el señor Julián Gazga, tienen 3 hijos Ezequiel D. 19, Antonio D. 17 y José Luis D. 15 años D. los cuales los tres estudian dos L. prepa y el menor esta cursando el tercer año D. secundaria, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. calzado por catalogo, con el cual lleva mas D. 8años.

ElL. dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que quería buscar L. forma D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y L. educación D. sus hijos, también por que dice que en el pueblo donD. radica no hay quien venda este producto, además D. que a elL. le gusta preparar realizar esta actividad ya que aparte D. que le beneficia también se entretiene, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en L. compra D. mas catálogos y mercancía como son: tenis, sandalias, huaraches, zapatillas, zapatos y botas, para si D. esta forma tener mas variedad D. artículos.

Con las ganancias obtenidas D. su negocio se esta beneficiando bastante por que esta pudiendo sacar a sus hijos adelante, y mejorando mucho mas su calidad D. vida, aparte D. que ahora pueD. apoyar al cien por ciento a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa, y a sus hijos con sus estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro.

Comenta que con su negocio también esta beneficiando mucho alas personas D. su comunidad, ya que como es L. única que venD. estos artículos ahí, aparte D. que los da en pagos para aquellas personas que no les alcanza para comprarlos D. contado, ya que  también así no tienen que ir hasta L. ciudad a gastar pasaje y tiempo. 

L. meta que se ha puesto doña armida es darles una educación D. calidad a sus hijos para que asi puedan estudiar una carrera y obtener una muy buena profesión, para que tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, ya que esta pensando en construir un local para poner una zapatería y así obtener mas y mejores ingresos.

ElL. dice que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones y les gusta mucho trabajar, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad, y hasta horita nadie ha quedado mal con sus pagos, ya que ellos se conocen D. hace tiempo dice que son personas pagadoras que no les gusta defraudar a quienes que depositan su confianza en ellos.
Armida le da las gracias a nombre D. elL. y D. su familia a FRAC y a kiva  por que gracias a ellos pudo cambiar su vida y L. D. sus hijos, puesto que ahora tendrán una mejor educación y calidad D. vida.
Los integrantes D. las vigueñas y las actividades alas que se dedican cada uno D. ellos son las siguientes:
Olga G. Z.-venta D. cosméticos
Armida I. B.-venta D. zapatos por catalogo
Maria blanca G. L.-venta D. perfumes
Cristina S. L.-venta D. refrescos
América C. P.-venta D. zapatos
Baltasar
texts.en:
This group goes by the name "Las Vigueñas." It is located in the community of Las Vigas, in the San Marcos Guerrero municipality. The members decided to give their group this name in honor of the name of their community, because they are very proud to be from this place. The history is near and dear to Armida I. B., who is part of this group. She is 47 years old, married to Julián Gazga. They have three sons: Ezequiel, 19, Antonio, 17, and José Luis, 15. All three are studying, two at prep school, and the youngest is in the third year of high school. Armida sells shoes by catalog, which she has been doing for more than 8 years.

She says that she decided to start this business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with household expenses and her children's education costs. Also she says in her town there isn't anybody who sells this sort of product. Besides, as she was preparing to start this business, she found that in addition to the (economic) benefit, she enjoyed it. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more catalogs and merchandise, such as tennis shoes, sandals, women's shoes, men's shoes, and boots, so that she will have more product variety.

With the revenue from her business, she is benefiting pretty well because she is able to help her children succeed, and she is greatly improving her quality of life. Also, she is able to support her husband 100% in paying the household bills, and support her children in their studies so they can have a better future.

She commented that with her business, she is also helping many people in her community, since her business is the only one that sells that product there, and she sells her product to people through a payment system, since they are not able to buy outright with cash. Plus, they don't have to go all the way to the city, which would mean traveling and spending time.

Arminda's goal is to give a quality education to her children so they can study for a career and have a great job, so that they will have a better future. Also, she wants to make her business grow much more, and she is thinking of building a shoe store so she will have better revenue.

She says that all her fellow group members are responsible people who make their payments and like to work so that they will advance and succeed over any difficulty. Up until now, nobody has failed to make his payment because everybody has known each other for some time and they pay up because they don't want to defraud anybody who has put trust in them.

Armida gives thanks on behalf of herself and her family to FRAC and Kiva because thanks to them she was able to change her life and her children's lives, so no they can have a better education and quality of life.

The members of Las Vigueñas and the businesses that they have are as follows:
Olga G. Z. - Cosmetics sales
Armida I. B. - Sale of shoes by catalog
Maria Blanca G. L.- Perfume sales
Cristina S. L. - Beverage sales
América C. P. - Shoe sales
Baltasar

loans.use: Purchase more catalogs, sandals, tennis shoes, boots, men's and women's shoes to have a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy S. is a 45-year-old married woman, and she lives in Pouthi Reamea village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. San John, are farming laborers. They receive a small income to support their family.  In there farming labor, they face a problem because they do not have pesticide spray to kill insect. Thus, Mrs. Soy S. would like to ask for a loan to buy a pesticide spray for her farming labor. In addition, she will use the rest of the loan to buy rice for food intake. This couple has three children: two are attending the local school, and the youngest one stays at home. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a pesticide spray for hire to villager.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto, de 67 años, está casada con Marcelina, de 60 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos; en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). La vida de Sixto, se centra en el quehacer del campo, ya que tienen más de 40 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Junto a su esposa Marcelina, se levantan todas las madrugas para cuidar de sus cultivos de café, plátanos y palta. Los que en cada cosecha gracias a la experiencia que tienen, manda su producción a la capital del país, pues según menciona ya no tienen las mismas fuerzas de antes, como para poder viajar constantemente, pero seguro de su buen juicio en la venta de su producción, desea más adelante incursionar en el mercado de las ciudades de la zona centro, comenzando en la ciudad de Huancayo. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y agradece la confianza que depositan a su banco comunal, por ser una persona de avanzada edad y con mucha vitalidad para trabajar. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono, así como también en contratar personal, que le ayude en la limpieza de maleza de su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Sixto, 67, is married to Marcelina, 60.  They have 8 children but only two still live with them in their own home located in the community of Sanchirio (Peruvian central jungle).  

Sixto’s life revolves around field chores since he’s been a farmer for over 40 years.  Together with his wife, Marcelina, he gets up at dawn every day to care for his coffee, banana and avocado crops.  Thanks to the experience they have they are able to send their harvests to the national capital.  Although he doesn’t have the strength he used to have to be traveling constantly, sure of his good judgment that sales of his products will be good, he wants to start making inroads in market places located in cities in the central part of the country starting with the city of Huancayo.

This is his 4th loan with MFP.  He is grateful for the trust placed in him by his communal bank him being a person of advanced age with much vitality to still work.  He plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of manure as well as to hire hands to help him clear weeds from his field.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and to hire hands to clear weeds from his fields.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en casa de sus familiares. Desde hace 20 años vende alfalfa, arrienda terrenos cultivados de alfalfa  y extrae  para  venderlos a los comerciantes al por menor. Pero desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de suplementos vitamínicos, productos que son vendidos en las mañanas después de comercializar la alfalfa. Este negocio le ha permitido  tener un ingreso más, en beneficio para su familia, ya que tiene mucha demanda de la gente de su comunidad. En tanto las ganancias que recibe de la venta de éstos productos vitamínicos, lo invertirá para poder arrendar otro  terreno de cultivado de alfalfa. Es el crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos vitamínicos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in a house belonging to family members.  She has been selling alfalfa for 20 years.  She leases land cultivated with alfalfa and takes the product to sell to traders retail.    However, she has also been selling vitamin supplements for a year.  She sells them in the mornings after she has sold her alfalfa.  This business has allowed her to have an extra income for her family since there is a lot of demand amongst the people in her community.  When she makes a profit from selling these vitamin products she will invest it so that she can lease another plot of land cultivated with alfalfa.

This is Lourdes' 9th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to the people who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying vitamin products.

loans.use: To buy more vitamin products

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy R. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old. Juvy is married and has four children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 10. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Juvy also plants fruits like guava.

Juvy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase organic fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hermelinda; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de preparación y venta de pan, la socia tiene una panificadora donde vende pasteles y panes, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan como harina, mantecas y azúcar al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hermelinda belongs to the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Hermelinda is 32 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She owns her own bakery where she sells cakes and bread.  She works from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  She would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale.

Hermelinda is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale

loans.name: Samwel Mwangi

texts.en:
Samuel  is 48 years old, married to Lucy Wambui,  and they have three children.  He has been running his dairy farm for a period of two years with an income of KES. 4,000 per  month. 


He is taking his  third loan from KADET LTD  after successfully repaying the previous ones. He plans to buy another cow, maize jam, and bran for the cow. 


He hopes to improve the living standard of his family and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy another cow, maize jam, and bran for the cow

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 36 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old.  Alphonsine sells a variety of goods and food in her store such as bread, sugar, rice, toothpaste and lotion. 

She is in this business for four years.  The hours of her business are from 6am to 9pm every day.  She is a hard worker and she currently employs one person to help her.  Alphonsine has requested a loan in order to upgrade and expand her store.  With any profit, Alphonsine will buy some property on which to build her own house.

loans.use: To upgrade and expand her store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business.  Her husband Gaspar, who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 9 and 22 years old. Rosita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,400 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to purchase more goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and to have a tricycle for transportation. Rosita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Josephine Jerop

texts.en:
Josephine M., aged 38 years, is married to Simon who works at KPLC. They have four children. They live in Mbotela Nairobi. She sells secondhand clothes. Most of the time she walks around selling her clothes. She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client.

She has been in this business for the past four years. She has applied for her third loan of KES.60,000 to add more stock like brassieres, panties and ladies' tops for sale.

If the loan boosts the business, she wishes to look for a store from which she can sell her items. Josephine’s hopes and dreams are to see her business grow. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of items like underwear and women's tops

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha C. lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a weaver, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband sells snacks, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Each month, the family spends USD 50 on food and USD 60 on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is from the village of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 67 years old. Pacita is widowed and has 10 adult children. 

To make a living, Pacita buys and sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (coconut meat used in oil production) in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Pacita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Saidia

texts.en: Saidia C. 32 years old. She's currently in the business of selling food. She's married to working man and has two children who are in school. Her future goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to stock more food to sell.

loans.name: Kimsour

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsour Brak and his wife, Mrs. Pov Soun, live in a village along national road number four, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penn. They have three sons. One is married and lives away from home, one is a cobbler in a shoe factory and the third assists his father in the business. 

Kimsour has been selling cows and oxen for more than twenty years. In addition, he is also a rice farmer. He hopes to continue expanding his business by purchasing more cows and oxen for resale. Hence he is asking for a loan of $1,000 to provide his capital.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and oxen for resale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lolita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lolita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, noodles, bread, chips, etc. 

In the future Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Teodoro

texts.es:
Francisco de 58 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora que se encuentra a una distancia larga del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Francisco desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y así pueda ofrecerlos a los diferentes mercados de la zona obtenindo  muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios. La otra actividad que realiza es atender su tienda que a colocado en su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados e implementar su tienda para poder tener más clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.  Francisco es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  negocios crezcan
cada vez más para poder cubrir su crédito y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 58 years of age and lives with his wife in his own home where they have only electrical service, located in the rural part of the Pacora district which is a long distance away from the department of Lambayeque. The primary economic activity in this region is agriculture. 

Francisco has earned a living for some years raising and selling farm animals. His corral is located in the rear portion of his home. He feeds them with enriched feed so that his animals may achieve optimal growth and thus he may sell them in the various markets of the area making very good profits with which to cover daily expenses. His other business activity is serving customers at the store he has set up in his home. 

He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy enriched feed and to stock his store so as to get more customers and meet their needs. Francisco is a hardworking person and very responsible. The only thing he wants is for his businesses to grow day by day so that he may pay off his loan and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase enriched feed for his animals and products for stocking his store.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
El señor Benedicto A. O. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en Kuluyo un pueblito de la provincia Sacaba de la ciudad de Cochabamba y está casado con la señora Martina con quien tiene cinco hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de él y su esposa.

Benedicto es agropecuario el tiene cultivos de tarwi y también de papa, haba el lugar donde él vive esta muy alejado de la ciudad, hasta de la propia provincia, él y su esposa son una pareja muy trabajadora ya que ellos no tuvieron una educación el solo curso la primaria y su esposa no sabe escribir, esto a razón que la señora Martina tuvo desde muy niña ponerse a trabajar porque su padre las abandono a ella a sus hermanos y su madre, por ser ella la mayor tuvo que sacar a delante a los demás y trabajar junto con su madre que aun vive con ella es una persona de una edad muy avanzada pero Benedicto y Martina dan gracias que la señora siga con ellos y sus hijos porque ella ayuda con la educación de sus hijos  cuando Benedicto y  Martina trabajan ella es la que siempre está pendiente de sus nietos, porque Martina tiene que ordeñar a las vacas y elaborar quesillos para poder comercializarlos en el pueblito y de esa manera tienen un ingreso mas, mientras Benedicto está preparando la tierra para sembrar su productos.

Benedicto es un hombre trabajador y responsable el trabaja mucho para salir adelante ahora el solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono gallinazo para poder tener más ingresos y de esa manera poder ayudar a sus hijos que terminen el colegio, sus niños estudian en el colegio del pueblo ya que entre todos los comentarios pagan a la maestra para que venga y enseñe a los niños, Martina y Benedicto  quieren un futuro mejor para sus hijos por esa razón trabajan mucho.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 49 years old and lives in a village in Kuluyo, in the province of Sacaba, city of Cochabamba. He is married to Martina and they have five children, all of whom are financially dependent on him and his wife.

Benedicto is a farmer. He has lupine, potato and bean fields. He lives very far from the city, even from the province. He and his wife are a hard working couple. They weren't able to receive an education. He only went to primary school and his wife can't write. Martina had to start working from a very young age because her father abandoned her, her siblings and their mother. Since she was the eldest she had to work alongside her mother to support the family. Martina's mother still lives with her. She is very elderly but Benedicto and Martina are grateful that she is still with them, because when they are at work she helps with the children's education. Marina's mother looks after the children because Martina has to milk the cows and make cheese, which she sells in the village to obtain some extra income, and Benedicto works the land to sow his crops. 

Benedicto is a hard working and responsible man. He works hard to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and poultry manure in order to increase his income. This will help him support his children until they finish school. The children study in the local village school. All neighbours pay the teacher so she can come and teach the children. Martina and Benedicto want a better future for their children and that's the reason why they work so hard.

loans.use: to buy farming products such as seeds and manure.

loans.name: Rosa Milagro

texts.es: Rosa Milagro de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella posee una pupuseria con la que mantiene a flote su hogar; vive en un lugar muy concurrido de personas y su pupuseria es muy conocida en la zona pues las pupusas que prepara tienen un sabor inigualable y las vende a precios accesibles además les da el mejor de los servicios es muy amable y siempre tiene lo que necesita el cliente. Para Rosa Milagro la posibilidad de realizar un sueño es lo que hace la vida interesante, quiere ver crecer su negocio y está haciendo lo posible para cumplirlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos para la preparación de las pupusas como chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz y bebidas. De esta forma siempre mantendrá la necesidad de la clientela y cumplirá su meta. Rosa tiene la confianza que su trabajo y esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa Milagro is fifty four years old and she lives with her life's companion. She has a pupuseria with which she supports her family. She lives somewhere with a lot of people and her pupuseria is very well known because the pupusas she makes are unsurpassed and she sells them at accessible prices. She also gives the best service and is very friendly and she always has what her customer needs. For Rosa Milagro, the possibility of making a dream come true is what makes life interesting. She wants to see her business grow and she is doing what she can to make this possible. That is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy ingredients to prepare the pupusas such as pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and beverages. In this way, she will have what her customers need, and reach her goal. Rosa is confident that her work and dedication will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and beverages.

loans.name: Aimee Blanche

texts.fr:
Cliente de 34 ans, mariee et mere de 4 enfants.a l'arret de ses etudes en classe de troisieme par manque de soutien , elle se lance dans la vente des beignets  pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Tous les matins, elle se leve tot et commence a cuire ses beignets,elle a une forte clientele et ses ventes sont de 20.000 a 25.000 frs par jour.
Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir, elle va acheter 2 sacs de farine de 50kg, 50kg de sucre, 50l d'huile, de la levure chimique,du sucre vanille et du bois de chauffe.

Avec les benefices de ses ventes , elle pense a beaucoup epargner pour qu'a l'avenir elle  construise un local confortable  pour etre a l'abri du soleil et de la pluie.Tres connue dans le quartier on l'appelle (Mama Mikate)la maman des beignets.
texts.en: She is a 34-year-old client, married mother of 4 children. Lacking of support, she left her study after finishing middle school and started selling doughnut to support her family. Every morning, she gets up early and starts baking. She has a lot of clients and makes between 20000 and 25000 francs a day. With this loan that she hopes to get, she will buy 2 50Kg bags of flour, 50Kg of sugar, 50cl of oil, baking powder, vanilla sugar and wood. With the profit of the sales, she thinks to save a lot to build a comfortable work space to not be exposed to the sun and the rain in the future. She is very well-known in the area and people call her "Mama Mikate", the doughnut mom.

loans.use: to by two 50Kg bags of flour, 50Kg of sugar, 50cl of oil, baking powder, vanilla sugar and wood

loans.name: Gladys María Del Socorro

texts.es:
Durante 25 años Gladys ha vendido comidas rápidas en Girardota, Municipio del departamento de Antioquia, y aunque ha tenido que enfrentar dificultades gracias a la ubicación de su puesto de comidas, es una mujer luchadora que sueña cada día con mejorar su calidad de vida es por esto que trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio, y en un futuro poder tener su propio restaurante donde pueda generar mas ingreso e igualmente generar empleos. 

Es por tal motivo que Gladys María solicita un préstamo con el cual poco a poco comenzar a construir su sueño, pues sabe que para ir generando mas utilidades deberá aumentar la producción y para ello necesita insumos con el cual preparar los alimentos,  sin embargo hoy no cuenta con ese capital que le ayudará a no solo a mejorar su calidad de vida si no también a dar un paso para cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
For 25 years, Gladys has sold fast food in Giradota, a town in the department of Antioquia, but she still has faced difficulties due to the location of her stall. She is a hardworking woman who dreams every day of improving her quality of life. She works Monday to Saturday with the purpose of growing her business and in the future being able to have her own restaurant where she can generate more income as well as generating jobs.

For this reason Gladys Maria asks for a loan with which, little by little, she will begin to build her dream. She knows that to increase her profits she will have to increase her production, so she needs ingredients to make food. She doesn't have the capital that will help her not only to improve her quality of life but also take a step towards her dream.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou est une vendeuse de "thiouraye" (encens), de parfum, de beurre de karité, de savon artisanale et de vêtements.Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants.Son revenu lui assure des revenus assez modestes qui lui permettent toutefois d' épauler son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille sur le plan alimentaire, de la santé et de l'alimentation.
