Elle sollicite un prêt de 50000F pour acheter 3 seaux de "thiouraye"(encens). Son ambition est d'implanter au marché central de sa localité une cantine de vente en gros de ses produits.
texts.en: Aissatou sells "thiouraye" (incense), perfume, shea butter, artisanal soap, and clothing. She is married and has six children. Her business provides her with an income that, though modest, nevertheless allows her to help her husband take care of the family's food and health needs. She is seeking a loan of 50,000 F to buy 3 buckets of "thiouraye" (incense). Her ambition is to set up a display at the central market in her local area to sell her products in bulk.

loans.use: To buy 3 buckets of "thiouraye" (incense).

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Aliou est un père de 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l'école, une fille et un garçon,le plus petit reste à la maison avec sa maman. Aliou a 37 ans et il a travaillé tres fort dans toute sa vie pour l'avenir de ses enfants.Aliou prétendre à des crédits beaucoup plus important pour développer son commerce.

Aliou dans SA boutique il vent des produits de ménage:comme des bols,les marmites, équimoires cuilléres mortiés ,les pilons etc

Depuis 10 ans il est dans le commerce de détail ou il gagne de l'argent pour payer les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Aliou is the father of three children, of whom two are at school, a daughter and a son, and the youngest stays at home with his mother. Aliou is 37 and he has worked very hard all his life for the future of his children. He hopes to receive even much bigger loans to grow his business. 

In his shop Aliou sells household goods such as basins, pots, slotted spoons, mortars and pestles, etc. 

For 10 years he has been in the retail sales business and it allows him to earn money to pay the school fees for his children and cover other family expenses.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his little shop with household equipment such as basins, mortars and pestles, etc.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
La señora Giovanna es socia del banco comunal Nuevas amigas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad.
Lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años, tiene instalado su negocio en el patio de su casa, por las tardes vende comidas al paso así como Juanes, pollo asado, pescado asado, maduros, chorizos.
Por las mañanas prepara sus Juanes, cocina la yuca, prepara su ají y la chicha morada para que todo esté listo a tiempo, luego se dedica a sus hijos.  Esta actividad la realiza todos los días por las tardes/noches, tiene una persona que le ayuda con los asados mientras ella atiende a sus clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará:  1 saco de carbón, un ciento de platos descartables, servilletas, 25 kilos de azúcar, 2 docenas de vasos, 1 docena de platos de losa, ¼ de canela, ¼ de clavo de olor, 1 balde con pico para su chicha, ½ saco de arroz, 1 galón de aceite. 
Con Manuela  Ramos ha podido implementar  su negocio.  Cada vez que saca su préstamo tiene que comprar algo que le hace mucha falta.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of the Nuevas amigas ("New Friends") community bank in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali.  She is 37, married, and has two children under eighteen.
 
She has been working with microfinance partner Manuela Ramos for the last eight years.  She has a business on the patio of her house, where she sells take-away food, such as packets of rice and meat steamed in banana leaves (pictured), grilled chicken and fish, fried plantains, and sausages.

In the mornings, she prepares the Juanes, cooks the yucca, prepares the ají sauce, and makes the chicha morada (a Peruvian purple-corn drink) so that everything will ready on time.  She also takes care of her children.  She works every day in the afternoons/evenings; she has someone who helps her with the grill while she serves the clients.

With this new loan of  S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles ($550), she will buy: 1 bag of charcoal, 100 paper plates, napkins, 25 kilos of sugar, 2 dozen glasses, 1 dozen china plates, cinnamon, cloves, 1 bucket with a spout for the chicha, ½ bag of rice, and 1 gallon of oil.  Manuela Ramos has made it possible for her to develop her business, giving her credit whenever she needs to buy something.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, paper plates, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, es natural de la ciudad de Palma, tiene 51 años, es casada y madre de 04 hijos, que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. María es un mujer responsable y decidida, su trabajo consiste en sembrar cacao y achiote, productos que tiene mucha demanda en los centros de acopio de su ciudad. Sus compradores saben de la calidad que tiene sus productos, por ello es que genera ganancias gracias a este negocio. Tiene 20 años y aún continua sembrado y cuidando sus tierras, haciéndolas más fertiles. Ella menciona que sino no fuera por éste negocio nunca hubiera logrado cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos, ni tampoco hubiera comprado bienes para su hogar. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando, ya que desea comprar una nueva casa  en la ciudad de Ayacucho que le será de gran utilidad para sus hijos, para que terminen sus estudios superiores en esa ciudad. Este será su segundo crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contara nuevamente con su ayuda. Con el monto solicitado comprará palas, picos y machetes, herramientas que le servirán para la siembra.
texts.en:
María is a native of the city of Palma. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of four school-age children. They live together in their own home. María is a responsible and decisive woman whose work consists of planting cacao and annatto. These products are in high demand at the collection centers in her city. Her buyers know that her products are of good quality, so she is able to generate good earnings from her business. María started farming when she was 20 years old and continues to plant crops and care for her land by making it more fertile. She says that if her business did not exist, she would not able to pay for the educational expenses of her children nor would she be able to buy furnishings for her home. In the future, María hopes to continue saving because she wants to buy a new house in Ayacucho, which will be of great use to her children so that they can finish their college studies in the city.

This will be her second loan. María is very pleased to know that she has renewed support. The amount she requested will be used to buy shovels, pick axes, and machetes. These tools will be used for the planting season.

loans.use: to buy shovels, pick axes, and machetes.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Sonia Del Carmen se dedica a su actividad como es la venta de cosméticos. Tiene más de 5 años con este negocio tan decente que realiza pues le resulta mucho más favorable realizarlo de esta forma obtiene clientes nuevos y algunos le pagana sus productos en el momento. Ella tiene que encontrar las formas de pagar las cuentas de su hogar y pagar la cuota del crédito. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, sombras, base, pintura de uñas, shampoo entre otros.
texts.en: Doña Sonia Del Carmen makes her living with her business, which is selling cosmetics.  She has run this business for more than 5 years, and it's been doing well enough that she in a favorable position and gaining new customers.  Some of her customers now pay for their products up front. Doña Sonia Del Carmen needs to find ways to pay for her household bills and to repay the loan.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase lipstick, powders, eye shadows, foundation, nail polish and shampoo, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick, powders, eye shadows, foundation, nail polish and shampoo.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 47 years old, married to Joel and they are blessed with six children who are school-going.

Juliana operates a business of selling dressmaking materials to the ladies of Kathiani-Machakos, where there is potential for growth. She has been in this business for the last six months and gets an income of 6,000 KES per month.

Juliana is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to buy kitenges cloth material (a traditional batiked cloth) to sell. She will use the extra profit to educate her children.

Juliana hopes to have a business that has expanded to a greater heights. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy kitenge material (traditional fabric) to sell to ladies.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a responsible and jolly person who is engaged in a corn farm business. He has been in this business for 15 years. He earns approximately PHP 30,000 every harvest season for these activities. Rolando is willing to work hard every single day to lift his family out of poverty. He is 47 years of age, and is married to a housewife who takes care of their children. At this time, Rolando is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides to supplement his corn farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requests to further grow his farm business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is 47 years old and has three children. He had worked abroad several years ago. He had saved enough capital to buy ample land for cultivation, so he decided to come back home and involve himself in a business. He plants rice as the source of his income. Paulino's wife is also involved in the hog raising business to increase the family's income. Income generated from the business was just enough to cover their expenses, especially in financing the education of their children.

Paulino now asks for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He wants to purchase these inputs for the development of his crop production.  With his patience and hard work, Paulino hopes to see all his children hold a degree and pursue their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is  48 years old, married to Moses and blessed with four children. She is a tailor in the area of Maji Mazuri in Nairobi where she has her tailoring business. She has been in this business for the last 12 years and gets an income of KES.23,800 per month.


Jacinta has a good credit history with KADET LTD and she is applying for her third loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy tailoring materials like bolts of cloth. She will use the extra profit to pay school fees.

Jacinta hopes to establish her business and to educate her children to tertiary level.She is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy bolts of cloth for making dresses.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Aged 47, Sambath is married with five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. Rice farming has been a main income source for her family for 20 years, supplemented with a cassava plantation. With her current business, Sambath earns around 20 US dollars per day to feed her big family and can save around 5 US dollars per day after family expenses. This is Sambath’s first loan with VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan to renovate a new house for her family. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a decent, new house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate a new house to live in

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is thirty-eight-year-old Adama. Born in Magburaka town, the wife and mother of five children is a small-scale businesswoman in the township of Magburaka. Adama’s husband is a businessman, too, and her children are all attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. 

Adama wants a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to invest in her business. She sells pans, dishes, glass-plates, cups, spoons, plastic-bowls, plastic-buckets, etc. Adama has more than sixteen years of experience in business. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business. 

Salone Microfinance Trust and Kiva lenders have contributed tremendously in the growth and expansion of Adama’s business. She was a member of a solidarity group, but as a result of continuous improvements in her business, she has moved to the individual lending category and can now receive higher loans from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy pans, dishes, glass-plates, cups, spoons, plastic-bowls, plastic-buckets, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who sells animals. He purchases young goats and sheep, grows them up, and then sells for them to butchers for a profit. With the loan he will buy some animals for the expansion of his business.

Jamila is hopeful that a loan investment will be good for her husband’s business and that he will be able to gain maximum profits from his business as a result. She is a housewife, but in her spare time she provides full support to her husband in his business. She gives the animals food and keeps their living place clean.

She has given birth to a son who is 1 year old. Jamila wants to provide a good-quality education to her son, and she is hopeful that, in the near future, her husband’s business will be good enough that she will be able to send her son to school once he is old enough.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for a livestock business

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguelina está casada tiene un hijo de 7 meses, es de la ciudad de Luque. Ella cuenta que tiene un local de venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños hace 3 años en su propio domicilio.
Miguelina es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y luchadora que se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar en la casa y de esa forma aligerare a su marido la carga. Su principal deseo es que su hijo crezca en un buen ambiente, donde no tenga que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, jeans, polleras y demás tipos de prendas con las cuales podrá surtirse y tener más variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguelina is married and has a 7 month old son. She is from the city of Luque. She says that she has had a clothing stand in her own home for three years where she sells clothes for women, men and children.

Miguelina is a very hard working woman, entrepreneur and a fighter that uses her strength to the maximum in order to help at home and in this way she lightens the load on her husband. Her main dream is that her son grows up in a good environment, where he does not suffer from hardship.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy t-shirts, jeans, skirts and other types of clothing with which she can supply the store and to have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, skirts and other types of clothing

loans.name: Mugusu B Abamwe Group

texts.en: Olivia is a forty-nine-year-old married woman living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For two years she has been running a retail shop. She started it in order to supplement her farming activities. Her challenge is customers not paying on time and her dream is to own a wholesale shop. Olivia needs the loan facility to buy soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania, de 42 años de edad  es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y amable, está separada de su pareja, vive en compañía de madre y sus 03 hijos de 14, 09 y 03 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Tania es la venta de golosinas en un tablero que instala en el frontis de su casa todos los días, iniciándose con un préstamo particular hace  3 años, logrando ganarse el aprecio y la preferencia de sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos gracias a su buena atención y manera amable de tratar,  además de contar con la ayuda de su madre para atender a los clientes.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico adicional así como le permite socializar con su vecinos, además comenta que le permite tener  una ocupación y sentirse productiva ya que cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hijo quien le da una mensualidad, pero ella prefiere mantenerse ocupada para distraerse, y así sentirse tranquila, teniendo planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en su casa. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas al por mayor para surtir su negocio, y con la diferencia desea comenzar con el negocio de abarrotes comprando de a poco.
texts.en:
Forty two-year old Tania is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman, in addition to being cheerful and friendly.  She is separated from her partner.  She lives with her mother and her three children who are 14, 9 and 3 years old, comfortably set up in their own house.

The business that Lucia has is selling snacks at a counter that she sets up in front of her house every day.  She started three years ago with an individual loan, and was able to win the appreciation and loyalty of her customers, the majority of whom are her neighbors, thanks to her good service and friendly way of treating them, in addition to counting on her mother's help in attending to customers.

She likes her business because it generates additional economic income and also allows her to socialize with her neighbors.  She also comments that it allows her to have an occupation and feel productive.  Now that she receives financial assistance from her son who gives her a monthly payment, she prefers to keep herself occupied to amuse herself and thus have peace of mind, as she has plans to grow her business and open a small grocery store in her house.  

Therefore, this will be her fifth loan with MFP.  She is hoping for a small loan to realize her goals.  With the requested amount of 1200 nuevo soles, she will invest in the purchase of wholesale snacks to stock her business, and with the profits she wishes to start her grocery business, buying little by little.

loans.use: to buy wholesale snacks.

loans.name: Coua-Zotti Group

texts.fr: Le groupe COUA-ZOTTI composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la septième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Henriette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 56 ans. Henriette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Henriette est veuve, mère de trois enfants, qui sont tous à sa charge. Henriette  vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Henriette. Pour cette raison, Henriette vend de l'igname frits et des beignets à base d'haricot dans sa région depuis quarante ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Henriette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Henriette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe COUA-ZOTTI, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de l'igname et du haricot.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музафар житель города Душанбе. Ему 40 лет. Он отец четверых детей. Музаффар талантливый и ответственный человек. Он занимается производством шкаф и шифоньер. Его изделия покупает много людей. Музаффар старается вкладывать все свои навыки и силы, чтобы производить красивые шкафы и шифоньер. Ему нравится, когда его изделия радует покупателей. Музаффар уже 7  лет занимается в этой сфере деятельности. Он хочет улучшить и расширить деятельность. Музаффар собирается купить оборудование для производство мебель. Для завершения данной операции у него нет денег. С такими  планами Музаффар просит кредит.

loans.use: Для купли оборудование для производство мебель.

loans.name: Nganwa Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ronald. He is the Head Teacher of Nganwa Junior School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kabwohe in Sheema with 1200 students. Nganwa Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nganwa Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ronald ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Margarita.  I sell clothes, cosmetics, beauty accessories, school equipment and other things. I have been in business for four years and the demand is increasing.  For that reason, I need to increase the supply of merchandize for my business. I know if I do this, my income will increase and I'll be able to a better level of life to my family.
 

Translation of the following: 

Mi nombre es Margarita, me dedico a la venta de ropa, cosmeticos, accesorios de belleza para la mujer, utiles escolares y otros. Tengo cuatro años de tener este negocio y la demanda esta incrementando, por lo que necesito abastecer mi negocio con nueva mercaderia. Se que haciendo esto mis ingresos mejoraran y podre ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a mi famila.

loans.use: Compra de ropa para dama, caballero y niño, cosmeticos, bolsos, accesorios de belleza.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is the mother of four daughters, aged 12, 10, 7 and 2. On top of running her household, she manages a small store attached to the front of her house. It is a specialty items store featuring office supplies, accessories for making crafts, and personal hygiene products. The loan will be used to expand the inventory of her business.

She lives in a neighborhood called Chavón in the Los Alcarrizos barrio (neighborhood) of Santo Domingo province in the Dominican Republic. Her three eldest daughters attend school and enjoy playing baseball and other outdoor activities with their friends.

NOTE: Laura is a member of the "La Emresaria" group, along with four other entrepreneurs. They will be accountable to one another for paying back their loan of $750. This group lending method requires group members to help one another throughout the loan repayment process. Loans are paid back as a group. If one person is deficient on their loan, the group must make up the difference. Everyone in Laura's group has gone through Esperanza's training and proven to be responsible and determined to not only pay back their loan, but also to provide for their children.

loans.use: Expanding her inventory of craft-making accessories and various supplies

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en: Mimi sells meat and chickens. She started her business in 2003 with $10. Mimi is a hard-working woman who has demonstrated some abilities in business such as organisation and good management. Mimi is requesting a loan of $800 in order to meet the high demand for meat and chicken in her community. She is confident about her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks with her clients. Mimi’s long-term plan is to open a clothing shop.

loans.use: To buy meat and chickens in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Humberto Luís

texts.es:
Humberto is married and has a small child. He and his father had a carpentry shop, and to become independent Humberto opened his own business selling crafts. He sold things that his father made. Unfortunately, Humberto’s father died five years ago and he has had to work very hard to get ahead with both businesses. However, the demand for his products is good and with hard work and the help of his family, he has made his business prosper.

Now, in order to increase the variety of products he offers in his store, Humberto needs a loan of $275.00, which he is committed to repaying in 3 months. You can help contribute to the growth of this business and improve the well-being of Humberto and his family. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Humberto es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo, él y su padre tenían una carpintería y para independizarse Humberto abrió su propio negocio con la venta de artesanías, donde comercializaba algunos productos que su padre elaboraba, lamentablemente el padre de Humberto murió hace cinco años y él ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante los dos negocios, pero la demanda por sus productos es buena y con base en su esfuerzo y la ayuda de su familia ha hecho prosperar su negocio.

Ahora para incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda, Humberto necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar el bienestar de Humberto y su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 38 years old and has a mini-market in Kirkuk. He applied for the loan of $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop and develop his shop. He has four children, and all of them are in school. He wants to increase his income and enhance his standard of living. He also wants to develop his business.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is a noble and hardworking mother who devotes herself to various activities with the only wish to ensure the wellbeing of each of her children. Her time is divided between her job as a seamstress and the sale of firewood among other small activities, which she can do in the comfort of her own home. None of this would be possible if she didn't count with the moral support of her children, who are her best motivation and who have become her main partners. Her husband is a painter and works that job even though he does not proviD. a substantial income to their home; however Maria still considers him a great man. Today she wants to help her children become professionals and to achieve this goal she requires US $200 to invest in her two activities. With your collaboration, Maria will be able to make a success of her business and her home, and help her children become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Luisa es una noble y trabajadora madre que se dedica a diversas labores con el único deseo D. procurarles bienestar a cada uno D. sus hijos.El tiempo del que dispone lo diviD. entre su labor D. modista y el D. L. venta D. leña entre otras pequeñas actividades que desempeña en L. comodidad D. su hogar. Nada D. esto podría tener buen término si no tuviera el apoyo moral y efectivo D. sus hijos que son sus mejores motivadores y se han convertido en sus mayores socios. Su esposo es pintor y se dedica a esta labor aunque no encuentre un ingreso sustancial para su hogar; sin embargo Maria no deja D. considerarlo como un gran hombre. Hoy tiene que dedicarse a hacer D. sus hijos unos grandes profesionales y para hacer realidad este propósito requiere D. 200 dólares para invertirlos en sus dos actividades.Con tu colaboración Maria podrá hacer D. su negocio y su hogar un lugar próspero y D. sus hijos unos buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Buying materials for seamstress business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women). She lives in the San Martin region, the Bellavista district. Her business is located in the Hr. Huallaga Number 268, 1st floor. She has a general store where she sells basic needs products like milk, rice, sugar, fideos, etc.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her own effort, she was able to succeed, because at the beginning she only had a handful of products and she now has more variety. She has a great clientele.

With her recent loan from the Movement Manuela Ramos, for S/. 1,500.00 (US$500.00), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy basic needs products to sell to the public, like sugar in 50kg. sacks, rice in 50kg. sacks, boxes of milk, gallons of oil, boxes of cookies, to stock up her store.

Mrs. Juana is 43 years old and lives with her children. Ever since her husband passed away she has been supporting her children and working so they lack nothing. She is a hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, vive en la Región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr: huallaga Nº 268 1er piso, y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como, leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y al esfuerzo de ella misma logró salir adelante, pues en sus inicios sólo tenía unos cuantos productos, actualmente cuenta con mas variedad. Tiene gran clientela.

Con el reciente crédito recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/1,500.00 ($500.00), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad para la venta al público, como azúcar en sacos de 50 kilos, arroz en sacos de 50 kilos cajas de leche, aceite en galones, cajas de galletas, para que su negocio esté mas surtido.

La señora Juana tiene 43 años, y vive con sus hijos, desde que falleció su esposo se hizo cargo de sus ellos y trabaja para que no les falte nada, es una mujer luchadora.

loans.use:
Buying assorted wholesale products (general store) 
(Compra de productos variados (bodega))

loans.name: Deyanet

texts.en: Deyanet A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 26 years old and is single. He owns and operates a small food-market near his home. He started his business five years ago. His brother helps him at his job. Deyanet would like to borrow $400 to buy more kinds of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Martha K.. She is single with six children, ages between 17 and 35, and has one other dependent, who is her niece. In 1998 Martha established a mat- and basket-weaving business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional materials and dyes. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and dyes in bulk.

loans.name: Ni Komang Notri

texts.id:
Living in a very humble house with brick wall has not discouraged Ni Komang Notri and her family to go through life. The humble life has made her more driven to make a better living by breeding goats. She started this business as her neighbourhood has abundant food supply for breeding goats. Due to the limited capital, Ni Komang Notri only raises 4 goats. The goat cost Rp. 300,000 each and it can be sold 5 months later with price of Rp. 600,000 - Rp. 700,000 each so she can get profit of Rp. 800,000 after deducting the maintenance cost. Although the profit is not much, Ni Koming Notri is still grateful that she can support the family's economy thanks to this business. Furthermore, her wish to renovate her house has encouraged her even more to save some of the profit. After getting the loan from DINARI, Ni Komang Notri becomes more enthusiastic in the business and she wants to buy 3 more female goats so that she can breed more goat offsprings and she doesn't need to buy more goat offsprings. She hopes with this she can gain more profit so that she can make a better living for the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di rumah yang sangat sederhana yang hanya berdinding bata tidak membuat Ni Komang Notri dan keluarganya patah semangat dalam menjalani kehidupan. Segala kesederhanaan itu justru membuatnya bersemangat dalam bekerja untuk bisa hidup lebih baik lagi yaitu dengan memelihara kambing. Hal ini dilakukannya mengingat situasi lingkungan yang mendukung yaitu dengan tersedianya pakan yang cukup bagi keperluan ternaknya ini. Terbatasnya modal yang dimiliki mengharuskan Ni Komang Notri hanya memelihara 4 ekor Kambing . Kambing itu dibeli dengan harga Rp. 300.000 per ekor,- dan dalam waktu 5 bulan berhasil dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 600.000,- Rp.700.000 per ekor sehingga keuntungan bersih yang diperolehnya Rp. 800.000,- setelah dikurangi biaya pemeliharaan. Walaupun keuntungan yang diperolehnya tidak banyak tapi Ni Komang Notri tetap bersyukur karena keluarganya bisa hidup dari hasil usahanya tersebut. Keinginan untuk merenovasi rumahnya membuat Ni Komang Notri terpacu untuk mulai menyisihkan sedikit hasil usahanya ini.. Setelah menerima pinjaman modal usaha dari DINARI Ni Komang Notri menjadi lebih bersemangat lagi dalam usahanya dan ingin membeli 3 ekor induk kambing agar nantinya induk kambing ini mempunyai anak dan Ni Komang Notri tidak perlu membeli bibit untuk kambing penggemukan lagi ia hanya memelihara anak tersebut,dengan harapan keuntungan yang diperoleh akan lebih meningkat dan keluarganya bisa sejahtera.

loans.use: To purchase female goats

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo Pérez is 35 years of age. His wife is a homemaker who takes care of their 7 children. He had his first child at the age of 20, but is trying not to have anymore children because of his difficult financial situation. Nevertheless, he is happy with each and every one of his children. He started his business 6 years ago, going door-to-door in his cart buying and selling scrap metal. He subsequently bought a horse to pull his cart, but he now has a small truck. He has plans to obtain a bigger truck so that he can buy scrap metal in different departments and recycle it. He is sure that he will achieve this goal because at his young age, he has been able to strengthen his business. He is requesting a loan to use half of it for the purchase of scrap metal, and the other half to replace the deteriorated roof of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Reynaldo Pérez de 35 años de edad es casado y su esposa es ama de casa y se ocupa de la numerosa familia de 7 hijos que tienen, el primero lo tuvo a los 20 años y está tratando no tener mas hijos ya que la situación esta difícil, pero no deja de estar feliz con cada uno de ellos. Su negocio de chatarra lo inicio hace 6 años con un carretón de casa en casa comprando chatarra para luego venderla, posteriormente compro un caballo que jalaba un carretón y ahora tiene una camionetita, tiene proyectos de tener un camión para comprar chatarra en los departamentos y reciclarla y está seguro de lograrlo puesto que a su corta edad ha logrado fortalecer su negocio. Solicita un crédito para ocuparlo la mitad para compra de chatarra y la otra mitad para cambiar el techo de su casa que está muy deteriorado.

loans.use: Invest in his business and repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Magreth L.. Married, but with no children, in 2007 Magreth established her small retail business. She now requires a loan to purchase in bulk additional stock, such as candy, biscuits, and soap. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional bulk stocks of products such as candy, biscuits, and soap.

loans.name: Kodzoshi

texts.fr:
Born in 1963 in Lomé, in Golfe prefecture, Kodzoshi A. is married and the mother of three. Aside from her own children, she is responsible for another child. Her main business is selling fruit at the N'kafu marketplace. Her husband, a mechanic, no longer works because of his advanced age. All household expenses fall onto Ms. A.'s shoulders. Thanks to the rigorous management of her business, she discovered how to repay her first two loans without a problem.

Today, she is requesting financial support to bolster her business by acquiring supplies wholesale from the villages where fruit is abundant, to resell in Lomé. The profits from her sales will help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1964 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame A. Kodzoshi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a en charge un autre enfant. Son activité principale est la vente des fruits dans le marché de N’kafu. Son mari, un mécanicien, n’est plus en activité à cause de son âge avancé. Toutes les charges du ménage sont revenues à Madame A.. Grâce à la gestion rigoureuse de son activité, elle a su rembourser ses deux premiers crédits sans difficulté.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. sollicite un appui financier pour renforcer son activité en s’approvisionnant en gros dans les villages où les fruits abondent et revendre à Lomé. Les bénéfices de la vente contribueront à l’amélioration des conditions de vie dans sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire supplies wholesale for retail sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia has two liquor stores where her family members work. One store is three-years-old, while the other just turned one. She has worked in a factory on the early shift for one month. She used to work in her stores. The loans that she has received have let her purchase the liquors that she offers in her business. She would like to improve her store and to have a larger working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Virginia tiene dos licorerías en las que trabajan sus familiares. Una tienda tiene 3 años, mientras que la otra recién 1. Ella trabaja en una fábrica en turno de amanecida desde hace 1 mes. Antes se dedicaba a las tiendas. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar los licores que ofrece en su negocio. A ella le gustaría implementar más su licorería y hacerse de un capital de dinero más grande.

loans.use: To purchase the liquors that she offers in her business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abla A. was born on September 21, 1986 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is married and has one child. She is a hairdresser in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. Since 2001, when she started in this line of business, her customer base has never stopped growing. She is requesting this first loan to purchase hair relaxers and hair extensions in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Abla est née le 21 septembre 1986 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle est mariée et a un enfant. Elle est coiffeuse et exerce ce métier dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Depuis l’année 2001 qu’elle a commencé cette activité elle ne cesse jamais de recevoir plusieurs clients. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des défrisants et des mèches afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hair relaxers

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama M. is 32 years old. She is married and has given birth to three kids. She sells porridge and lingerie in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and eaten with sugar, milk, and bread.

With a large customer base, she wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her lingerie sales. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school. She is a member of a group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk and lingerie

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Dame A. Micheline  est veuve depuis 6  mois environ. Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont 2 sont  encore à sa charge car mineurs. Depuis son adolescence, elle a commencé à acheter du poisson qu'elle fait frire et revend au grand marché Dantokpa de Cotonou pour gagner sa vie. Au fil des années, son petit  commerce  a pris d'ampleur . Elle sollicite ce sixième crédit pour davantage accroître sa part de marché en touchant de nouveaux clients. D'ailleurs, elle dispose pour la distribution de deux jeunes dames, qui sont ses nièces dont elle a la charge.
texts.en:
Born around 1958 in Cotonou, Ms. Micheline A. has been a widow for about six months. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are still dependents of hers because they are minors. As an adolescent, she began selling fish, which she fries and sells at the grand marketplace Dantokpa of Cotonou in order to earn a living. Over the years, her small-scale business has become sizable. She is requesting this sixth loan to grow her market share even more by reaching new customers. In addition, she has two young women, her nieces who are in her care, for distributing goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three boxes of frozen fish, and 75 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Doña Flora tiene 65 años de edad, estudio primer año de primaria, es viuda, madre de 02 hijas y vive en la parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia  El Collao, Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio” en Alintuyo En un inicio con S/. 300 compró 02 porcinos c/u a S/. 150. Creció al lado de sus abuelos porque su padre se dedicaba a beber licor y su madre sufría de la cabeza, eran muy pobres y por eso su abuela la entregó a un señor con quien convivió desde que tenia los 14 años de edad. Ya con familia empezó a vender frutas en la ciudad de Ilave durante 05 años, ganaba muy poco, entonces cambió de negocio y se dedicó al engorde de ganado vacuno, ovino por varios años, ahora sólo se dedica al engorde de ovinos.

Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 05 ovinos c/u a S/.100 y 01 ovino mejorado con S/. 250 para su engorde y su posterior venta.

Su meta es seguir con su negocio de engorde de ovinos mejorados porque tienen buen precio.

“El préstamo que nos da el Banco Comunal para nosotras es de mucho apoyo porque no nos pide muchos papeles, yo seguiré integrando el Banco Comunal hasta donde pueda”, manifestó doña Flora.
texts.en:
Flora is 65, went to school up to first grade of elementary, she is a widow, mother of two daughters and lives in Alintuyo, district of Ilave, El Collao, Puno. She is one of the founding partners of the “June 24th” community bank in Alintuyo. At the beginning with $100 she bought two pigs, each at $50. She grew up with her grandparents because her father drank alcohol and her mother had bad headaches, they were very poor so her grandmother decided to give her to a man with whom she lived since she was 14 years old. Once with a family she sold fruit in the city of Ilave during five years, she made very little money, changed the type of business and decided to raise livestock, she raised cattle and sheep, now she only raises sheep. With the loan of $275 to be repaid in 3 months, she will buy five sheep at $35 each and a higher quality sheep for $85, she will raise and sell them. Her goal is to continue with the business of raising great quality sheep because of the good prices. “The loan that we get from the community bank is a great help for us because there is not a lot of paperwork to do, I will be part of the community bank as much as I can”, Flora said.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
Con cinco ciclos de crédito cancelados el grupo solidario FUERZA esta compuesta por 3 miembros que habitan en el barrio monimbo de masaya, estas clientas son bien emprendedoras ya que las tres trabajan a la par de sus esposos  y  entre los dos mantiene a su familia. 
Sus negocios están ubicados en el mercado de masaya su tramo no tiene techo venden a la intemperie, aun así ellas sienten que han crecido a la par de sus negocios, ya que ahora cuentan con mayor inversión.
Doña Maria es coordinadora del g/s FUERZA su negocio lo tiene ubicado por la maya sur del mercado, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor, su esposo también es comerciante y entre los dos se ayudan mutuamente. .de ADIM se siente agradecida  tanto de los créditos como de las capacitaciones que ha recibido a lo largo de cuatro años, en los que ha visto crecer y florecer su negocio. Ellas sueña con comprar mas mercadería sobre todo al acercarse navidad  y poder en el futuro llegar a tener un tramo muy grande y surtido que produzca los suficientes para que sus hijos  vivan en  buenas condiciones 
Están mas que  clara que para lograr su sueño necesita ser puntual con sus créditos tanto con ADIM como con los proveedores.
texts.en:
Having already participated in five loan cycles, the communal bank Fuerza is made up of three members that live in the Monimbo neighborhood of Masaya. These clients are very entrepreneurial, as all three work. Their husbands work as well, and between each other, they support their families. Their businesses are located in the Masaya market. They sell in the open, as their market area does not have a roof. They feel that they have grown along with their businesses, as they now depend on larger investments. Mrs. Maria is the coordinator of Fuerza. Her business is located in the southern portion of the market. She counts on the support of her eldest daughter. Her husband is also a shopkeeper; they mutually help each other out. She feels grateful for ADIM, not only because of the loans, but also because of the trainings she has received these past four years, which have allowed her store to grow and flourish. She hopes to purchase more merchandise, especially now that we are approaching Christmas. She also hopes to own a large, assorted stretch to produce enough to provide her children with good living conditions. It is very clear to her that in order to succeed she must repay her loans on time, both to ADIM and to her suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital; Investing in more products since the time for high sales is approaching

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Nueva Vida” pertenece al centro focal Panamericana, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto,  trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace más siete años.
Casadas en su mayoría tienen un promedio de cinco hijos cada una, en algunos casos sus parejas las abandonaron teniendo que hacerse cargo ellas solas de sus familias, es por ello que se vieron en la necesidad de buscar actividades propias que les permita generar recursos para el bien de sus familias.
La asociación “Nueva Vida” tiene diversas actividades, Soledad por ejemplo se dedica  a la filmación de eventos sociales, Ross tiene una tienda de lubricantes, otras de ellas realizan variedad de masitas (pastelitos y galletas) en horno industrial, y otras se dedican al tejido de mantas en macrame. Todas las socias del grupo quieren mejorar sus negocios, para esto solicitan mayor capital para comprar insumos y  materia prima, dependiendo del caso. Están seguras que sus ventas aumentaran y podrán obtener ingresos suficientes para solventar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Nueva Vida ["New Life"] association is part of the Panamericana group in the Bolivian city of El Alto. The association has worked with Pro-Mujer for seven years. Mostly married with an average of five children each, some of the members have been abandoned by their partners andhad to take sole charge of their families. That's what led them to seek out ways to make enough money to support their families.

Nueva Vida members have diverse businesses. Soledad, for example, videotapes social events; Ross has a store selling lubricants; some make different kinds of "masitas" (a local snack); and others earn livings making macrame products. All of the members want to improve their businesses so they're applying for additional funds to buy products for resale or supplies, as the case may be. They are confident that their sales will increase and they'll be able to earn large enough incomes to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale or supplies, as appropriate.

loans.name: Nilsa Roxana

texts.en:
Nilsa Roxana A. A. is 34 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. Nilsa is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 2 years to support her bodega, or corner store. These small businesses are very common throughout Peru and provide a convenient way for people to earn livings working from their own homes. Bodegas are located in the converted front room of the home and sales are made through grated windows or doors. Nilsa is married to a taxi driver and has two children; the proceeds from her store go to support her and her family.

Nilsa is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles to stock her store. She plans to purchase large sacks of rice, school supplies and would also like to expand into offering general store goods like electrical outlets and wiring. She will repay the loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: Nilsa would like to urchase large sacks of rice, school supplies and would also like to expand into offering general store goods like electrical outlets and wiring.

loans.name: Kenneth Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Kenneth Antonio E. C. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada, el Joven Kenneth tiene 3 hijos su edades son las siguientes un varón de 10 años y cursa recientemente el 4 grado de primaria su otra hija de 3 años de edad no estudia y su otro hijo de 1 año todavía no estudia, su compañera de vida labora como enfermera,   los propósitos del Joven Kenneth son de mantener su negocio ya que es el único medio de ingresos que el posee para sustentar a su familia mas sin embargo no todos los jóvenes se dedican a este tipo de negocio sus sueños son de incrementar su producción en los diseños de trajes para su amplia clientela ya que así lograría innovación en el mercado y sus productos no solo serian recomendados por personas de este país si no que también serian enviados al extranjero y este le proporcionaría mas ganancias sus deseos son de comprar maquinas para proporcionar mas trabajos a personas que realmente desean salir adelante y proporcionar cierta estabilidad para sus familias ya que la mayoría de las familias hoy en día están mantenidas por las mujeres.


La actividad a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de sastre, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que el Joven Kenneth tiene de poseer el negocio es de 10 años, el inicia este negocio cuando tenia 19 años de edad ya que no tenia trabajo y necesitabas urgentemente un ingresos que le proporcionara un respaldo y ayudar en los gastos de su familia por lo que decide ofrecer sus servicio como sastre por lo que inicio con la elaboración de trajes para niños, trajes para damas y caballero al comienzo esto lo consigue por que sus vecinos recurrían a su vivienda en busca de sus servicio al presenciar la afluencia de clientes que logro decide invertir sus ganancias para capital de trabajo y el lograr lo que ha obtenido hasta el día de hoy fue una experiencia que lo ha ayudado a cambiar en la perspectiva de la vida, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de materia prima como: ropa, agujas, hilos, tijeras pero sobre todo en la compra de tela para uniformes ya que se acerca la temporada de la entrada de clases y aprecia la ayuda brindada de parte de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas que solo quieren el progreso de nosotros mismos.
texts.en:
Mr. Kenneth Antonio E. C. is 29 years old and married. Kenneth has three children. His son is 10 years old and in the fourth grade. His daughter is three years old and not yet in school, and his second son is 1 year old and not yet in school. Kenneth's wife works as a nurse. Kenneth would like to maintain his business, as it is the only means he has of supporting his family, and not all young people work in this type of business. He dreams of increasing production of suit designs to expand his client base. That way he would be able to achieve innovation in the market and his products would not only be recommended by people in this country but also be envied by foreigners. This would provide Kenneth with more earnings. He would like to buy more machines in order to give jobs to people who would truly like to get ahead and provide a measure of stability for their families, as the majority of families today are supported by women. Kenneth is a tailor, working from his home and also traveling through town. He has been in this business for 10 years, having started when he was 19 years old. At the time he didn't have a job and needed income urgently in order to support his family. He therefore offered his services as a tailor, initially making suits for children, women, and men. He was able to support himself because his neighbors kept returning to his store.Kenneth gained fame because he as able to show off the affluence of his clients. Kenneth decided to invest his earnings as working capital and he had experiences that changed his perspective on life. His loan will be used as working capital to buy materials such as: clothing, needles, thread, and scissors. Above all, Kenneth would like to buy cloth for uniforms, as the school year is approaching. He appreciates the help of Fundación León 2000 and its partner organizations, which want to see their clients progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: At the age of 48, Marlyn L., married with 3 children, continues to struggle to earn money for her family. She is a farmer and produces vegetables and rice and sells these. She is only a tenant of the land where she grows these vegetables and rice. The most painful thing that happened to her life and her family was when the vegetables and rice planted on the farm were flashed out by flood due to a typhoon on January 11, 2009, which lasted for almost a week. Due to this incident, she wants to start a new farm and buy seedlings which requires about PHP 5,000.00. If she and her husband increase their income, she wants to buy a carabao that could help them plow the farm land.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and rice seedlings

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kyligonza  Florence Group

texts.en:
Florence K. is a 50 year old single mother of two, ages 18 and 21. She lives with her family in a one-room rental house with no running water or electricity. Her greatest expenses are rent and school fees for her children. 

Florence works six days per week selling charcoal from a spot she rents at the market. She sees about ten customers per day. Previously she sold potatoes, but she wasn’t able to make enough money doing so. She hasn’t had the same challenges with this business and she prays that it will continue this way. 

She has worked with MCDT for five years and has received ten loans. She chose MCDT because it was near her home. She will use this loan to increase her stock and looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainabu S. lives in a village called Yogomaia, Koinadugu district, northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-five years of age. Her husband passed away three years back, leaving her with the whole responsibility of taking care of the family.   She has five children. Zainabu sells market food. With a loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more profit and consequently improve her living standard.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Абдуллаев Таварали житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. имеет высшее образование , по профессии организатор. Уже 10 лет как он занимается садоводством. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы купить удобрения для обработки деревьев. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tavarali A. lives in the Gissar district. He is 50 years old, married, and has two children. He completed a college education in administration, but for the past decade he has been a gardener. He came to us for a loan to buy fertilizer for raising trees. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. makes a living raising pigs in the village of St. Tomas in Saguday, Quirino. This is her family's main source of income, and she would like to expand her small business by buying more feed. She hopes this loan will make her business grow, increase her profits and allow her to provide for the educational needs of her children.

Josephine is 40 years old and married to Silvino G.. The couple has been blessed with five children: Jocelyn who just graduated from high school; Julius, Joven, and Joel, who are currently in high school: and Jayson, presently in elementary school. Josephine hopes to support her children through college, but a lack of money may hinder her ability to do this. She believes that through patience and hard work, she has a chance to attain her goals in life, and believes in the saying, “do your best and God will do the rest”.

loans.use: To expand a small livestock business

loans.name: Memia

texts.en:
Memia S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38 years old. Memia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Memia owns and operates a business venture manufacturing and selling "sawali," or woven bamboo wall products, to local businesses and community members. Memia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Memia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She became a member to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Memia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw material like bamboo to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Memia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2007, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the second loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Danira

texts.en: Danira V., 20, has many years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the village community and general public, three days per week. Danira is married with three children. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~110 USD). She has had two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Danira’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy tools and equipment for her business  and to pay for school fees and home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase weedkiller, chemicals, knives, sharpener and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora C. is from the village of Manga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Nora is 38 years old and single. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from cultivating coconut trees & harvesting the coconuts for sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nguvu Mpya Group

texts.en:
Mather is a member of the Nguvu Mpya group . She is a 39 year-old-woman, is married, and is the mother of two children.Her children are aged 19 and 16 years. She also cares for other two other dependents.

Six years ago, Mather started her own cafe business selling bites (bread-like rolls). She works seven hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mather’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to save money and expand her business.

Christina and Anosia are two other members of the same group. They also requested a loan of 200,000 Tsh each one in order to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Félicienne est née vers 1975 à Abomey au Centre du Bénin. Félicienne est mariée à Eustache. Félicienne a fait le cours primaire. Félicienne et son mari ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Félicienne supporte ensemble avec son mari les dépenses de la famille. C’est des condiments de sauces que Félicienne vend au carrefour Dégakon. Félicienne s’approvisionne en ces produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Félicienne a déjà quatre ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Félicienne a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour ses activités ; crédits que Félicienne a bien remboursés. Félicienne sollicite un cinquième crédit pour constituer de grands stocks de ses produits.
texts.en:
Félicienne was born around 1975 in Abomey, in the centre of Benin. Félicienne is married to Eustache. Félicienne has a first grade education. Félicienne and her husband have four children, all in school. Félicienne supports her family and their expenses together with her husband. Félicienne sells condiments at the Dégakon crossroads. Félicienne supplies herself with these products at Dantokpa, the grand international market in Benin. Félicienne has already gained four years of experience in this business. Félicienne has already received four loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) for her business; she repaid all of these loans properly. Félicienne is seeking a fifth loan to generate large stockpiles of her goods.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of onions, garlic, packets of pepper, baskets of fresh tomatoes, baskets of hot peppers, etc.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ovino y especialmente porcino. Estos animales los compra directamente a los ganaderos de las comunidades campesinas aledañas a su zona y los revende a mayor precio en la feria ganadera de su ciudad. Los animales que no llega a vender, los lleva a su casa para criarlos y cuando dan cría, tiene más animales y aumentan sus ganancias. Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio Lucila está planeando implementar un establo, donde pueda albergar a una mayor cantidad de animales. 
Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal donde todos los integrantes trabajan uniendo esfuerzos para el progreso de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de más ovejas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Lucila is 43 years old and lives with her husband and her children in her own house. For five years she has bought and sold cattle, sheep, and especially pigs. She buys these animals directly from the stockbreeders of the rural communities close to her region and she resells them at a higher price in the livestock market in her city. She brings the animals that she is not able to sell to her house to raise them and when she breeds them, she has more animals and increases her earnings. Due to the profitability of her business, Lucila is planning to implement a stable where she can house a larger quantity of animals. This is the third time she’s had a loan with MFP. She is very content to be a part of a community bank where all of the members work uniting their efforts for the progress of their group. The money that she is asking for now will be invested in the purchase of more sheep and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep and pigs

loans.name: Soro Yiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  membres du groupe Soro Yiriwaso,  7 femmes  mariées  et de 2 veuves avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.  
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe, tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font de la vente de beurre de karité, d’articles de boutique, de la friperie,  de l’encens,  du lait,  du sucre, du bois de chauffe, des igname, des oranges etc. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 200 kg de beurre de karité, 2 sacs de sucre, 1 bidon d’huile de 20 litres,  3 paquets d’articles divers, 3 balles de friperie, 2 sacs de lait en poudre,  1 sac de sucre, 15kg de graine (magnon + geunin), 7 bouteilles de parfums différents, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 5 paniers d’orange et 10 sacs d’ignames. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les différents  marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager leur point de vente et ou en avoir.
texts.en:
The nine members of this Soro Yiriwaso group are 7 married women and two widows, with an average age of 34 and on average, 4 children, and live mostly in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 4th solidarity loan. The preceding 3 loans were all correctly reimbursed. They sell shea butter, dry goods, used clothing, incense, milk, sugar, firewood, yams, oranges, etc.

With their new loan they intend to buy 200 kg of shea butter, 2 sacks of sugar, one jerrycan of 20 liters of oil, 3 packets of various items, 3 bales of used clothing, 2 sacks of powdered milk, 1 sack of sugar, 15 kg of seeds (magnon and guenin) 7 bottles of various perfumes, 1 wagonload of firewood, 5 baskets of oranges, and 10 sacks of yams. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town in the various markets and in the neighborhoods on foot, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 30,500 F CFA of which part will be put into savings or used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. They count on having more working capital so as to better satisfy their clientele and to be able to set up a venue for their sales.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 23-year-old single man. He has owned a cafe called “Friends” in his town since 2004 to begin a new career and to improve his living conditions.

Today, Salam is requesting $1,000 to buy more merchandise for his shop to satisfy the needs of the market and to expand his shop after becoming known by the neighboring villages.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his café

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Our client is Juana. Juana is from Ccorao. She is 44 years old and is married with 3 children (2 boys and 1 girl). 

Juana is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. 

This is Juana’s third loan from Arariwa. She splits her time between selling grains like quinoa in the market and selling artisan clothing to tourists. 

She sells approximately 50 PEN worth of grain each Sunday and 150 PEN of clothing each week. The clothing is hand-made. She will split this loan for use, buying merchandise for both her grain and her artisan goods business.

Juana appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grain and artisan goods to sell.

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Nubia M. se dedica a atender su negocio de fabricación y venta de colchones los que son comercializados por ella misma ofreciendo diferentes estilos de colchones para los clientes que le visitan. 

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus clientes y por este motivo no cesa de trabajar y buscar la manera de atender a su clientela. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de su localidad para ampliar su espacio donde vende los colchones y con el crédito comprará los materiales de construcción para iniciar a ampliar y remodelar el local y así brindar buenas condiciones a los clientes que compran los colchones.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Sra. Nubia M. attends to her business of manufacturing and selling mattresses. She offers them in a variety of styles to the customers who visit her store.

Nubia is known as a hardworking woman who is concerned about the welfare of her customers. For this reason, she continues to work hard and look for new ways to serve her clients. She is requesting a loan so that she can make improvements to her store by expanding the space in which she sells mattresses. The funds will be used to buy construction materials so that she can begin expanding and remodeling her store and provide better conditions in which her customers can shop for mattresses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that she can begin expanding & remodeling her mattress store

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: H. Jeanne est née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne vit depuis près de 20 ans à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Mariée à AKAKOSSI Alexis, un tailleur, Jeanne a en charge trois enfants, dont deux sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jeanne vend des friperies de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Jeanne s’approvisionne. Jeanne a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé et qui ont été bien remboursés. Jeanne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’accroître son activité afin de vendre davantage ses articles et de réaliser plus d’économies.
texts.en:
Madame Jeanne H. was born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has lived in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou for nearly 20 years. She is married to Alexis Akakossi who is a tailor. Madame H. has three children in her care, two of whom are her own, and all of them attend school. She lives with her children and her spouse, and together, she and her husband manage the family expenses. Madame H. herself did not go to school. In order to support her and her family's needs, she sells second-hand clothing door-to-door. She stocks up at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Madame H. has already had two loans from Kiva Field Partner, ALIDé, and both loans have been paid back. She is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé, so that she can grow her business to sell more clothes and thus see greater savings.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Ameru

texts.en:
Ameru D. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread. She is requesting a loan to stock more powdered milk and make more tea to sell.  Ameru is 31 years old and married to a cattle keeper. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy cows and goats for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more powdered milk and make more tea to sell

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mrs. Toem U. lives in Royak village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Uk Hong, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. Mrs. Toem U. needs some money to buy a cow for breeding, and she would use the rest of the money to buy more piglets and pig food for her pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

She is 51 years old and the mother of five children. One is employed in a garment factory, one is a beautician, two are farmers and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Alcibiares

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcibíares es casado con la señora Jesusa tienen 5 hijos, son oriundos de Cochabamba la ciudad jardin denominada asi por que existen muchas flores, el cliente nació el 30 de Junio de 1976 aproximadamente 10 años que viven en la comunidad Paso del Chivo, se dedica a la agricultura están ya esta dos Años trabajando con la institución.
Los señores actualmente están sembrando maíz, papa y poroto y están agradecidos con la institución por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Alcibíares is married to Sra. Jesusa. They have five children and live in the city of Cochabamba, an area known for its gardens that produce many flowers.
