Alcibíares was born on June 30, 1976, and has been living the community of Paso del Chivo for the past ten years. He is engaged in agriculture and has been a client of Emprender for two years.

Alcibíares is currently growing corn, potatoes, and beans. He is grateful to Emprender for providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for his farm

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is the mother of eight children and has been able to sustain her family through rice farming. She is 53 years old and lives in Norala, South Cotabato. The income she receives sends her children to school and provides for the basic needs of her family.

Victoria would like a loan to help support her business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 which will enable her to purchase fertilizer and other farm needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: C. Sophie

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Gbokpa, D. C. Sophie vit depuis près de 15 ans au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sophie est mariée à ATINKPEDJO Benoît, un mécanicien, et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Sophie apporte une aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Sophie s'est très tôt mise dans le commerce de produits vivriers. Sophie vend en effet à son domicile, du maïs, du riz et de la farine de manioc. C'est au marché Houègbo et à Adja au Mono, que Sophie se ravitaille. Sophie a déjà près de 30 ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de son activité. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. Sophie sollicite un autre crédit en vue de reconstituer le stock de ses produits et de mieux faire face aux besoins des clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Gbokpa, C. Sophie D. has been living for the past 15 years in the Fidjrossè neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Sophie is married to Benoît ATINKPEDJO, a mechanic, and is the mother of two children. Sophie helps her husband with the household expenses. As she never attended school, she began retailing food products at an early age. In fact Sophie has been selling corn, rice, and cassava flour from her home for the past 30 years. She gets her supplies from the Houègbo market and from the Adja plateau in Mono Province. She is a regular client of ALIDé, and has repaid in full all previously granted loans. She is now requesting another loan to restock her supplies and face up to customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 100-kilo bags of rice and corn

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a shop where she sells drinks. She buys in bulk and sells at retail to her customers. She buys drinks from the company’s sales representative who goes around town supplying buyers at their business place. She has been in this business since 1990 and has recorded success. With part of her profit, she helps her husband who is a commercial driver to pay their bills and she reinvests the rest into her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.


Elizabeth is 56 years old, married with four children and they are doing well. She further said they intend to renovate the building where they live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says a big thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 55 años y es casada. Elba es una madre de 8 hijos de la cuales 5 son independientes y los demás todavía están a su lado.

Elba es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de venta de artesanía y así de esta manera ayudar al ingreso económico del hogar. Elba tiene su propio taller de fabricación de artesanía de tipo muñequearía y los vende en diferentes sitios por ejemplo los días lunes y martes vende  de forma ambulatoria en el centro arqueológico de “Kenko” y los sábados ende en la feria del barrio popular de “San Blas”. Elba usará el préstamo para comprar por ejemplo tela, mantas, chompas y chullos.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elba is a member of the Communal Bank "Sacsayhuaman", which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, five of whom are independent while the others still live with her.

Elba is a hardworking and enterprising mother who managed to open her own business selling handicrafts in order to help with the household income. She has a workshop where she makes “muñequearía” style handicrafts and sells them at different locations. For example, on Mondays and Tuesdays, she sells as a traveling vendor at the “Kenko” archaeological site. On Saturdays, she sells at the popular neighborhood fair called “San Blas”. Elba will use the loan to buy fabric, blankets, sweaters, and caps.

She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, blankets, sweaters, and caps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Blanca Sixta

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 52 años D. edad, es separada y vive junto a sus tres hijos en el distrito D. Mochumí, un distrito cuya principal actividad económica es la agricultura, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace 29 años a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes, cerveza y frutas en su domicilio, el negocio siempre goza D. muy buena acogida debido a que se encuentra ubicado cerca al mercado del distrito. Este negocio es su unica fuente D. sustento económico, por lo que ella trata D. mantenerlo ofreciendo productos D. buena calidad y buen trato a sus clientes.

Blanca desea captar mas clientes para poder crecer como empresaria y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida, por ello desea comprar más mercadería que le permitan ampliar su negocio, ella se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Blanca es una mujer alegre y D. trato amable, su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad D. estudiar una carrera superior que les permita asegurarse un futuro prometedor. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran alguien responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Blanca is 52 years old, she is separated and lives with her 3 children in the Mochumí district, the main economic activity is agriculture, and it is near the Lambayeque province some 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 29 years, she has sold basic household goods, groceries, beer and fruits in her home. The business always has a good customer base since it is located near the market district. The business is her only source of income and she tries to keep it by offering quality products and kind treatment to her customers.

Blanca wishes to have more customers to be able to grow as an entrepreneur and give her children a better quality of life. It is because of this that she wishes to buy more merchandize that will allow her to expand her business. This is her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that will allow her to meet her goals.

Blanca is a very happy and good-natured woman. Her biggest wish is to give her children the opportunity to study a career that will allow them to ensure a promising future. Her neighbors and people, who know her, consider Blanca to be a responsible and hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize to increase her business.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Don Luís Manuel tiene 55 años de edad, es muy activo en su trabajo, ha logrado hacer su casa, apoyar  a sus hijos, todo esto lo logro ya que es  ingeniero naval desde joven gracias a sus padre quien lo apoyaron para que estudiara, anduvo muchos años trabajando y la paga era buena, pero es un trabajo en donde no permite estar  con su familia por que se embarcan por meses Es por eso decide renunciar y con su liquidación comprar un camión que lo trabaja como transporte de viaje.
Lo que desea con este financiamiento es comprar plátanos y vender al mayor y así lograr abrirse más en el mercado con el objetivo de generar mejores utilidades rentables. A futuro desea comprar otro camión que pueda cubrir la demanda de viaje transporte y con las ganancias poder ahorrar para su vejes ya que abecés se siente cansado.
texts.en:
Luís Manuel is 55 and an active worker, having built his home and supported his family with care. At a young age he became a naval engineer, thanks to his father who supported his studies. For some years he made a good living in that field but left in order to spend more time with his family on land. His severance pay allowed him to buy a truck, which he uses to make a living in transportation. With this loan, Luís Manuel wants to buy and sell plantains on the wholesale market to increase his income. In the future he wishes to buy another truck to better serve local demand for transport, and assure a comfortable living for old age when he can no longer work full time.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell plantains for wholesale market

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación de este comité la señora Carolina  P. invitó y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Actualmente cada integrante se encuentra trabajando en forma independiente en sus emprendimiento, pero al mismo tiempo se reúnen y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos y tener un capital en común para cualquier necesidad.
La señora Blásida es una de las integrantes, quien se encuentra muy satisfecha con la actividad que comenzó cuando se integró al comité.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles dulces y salados, ella tiene en mente colocar para comodidad de sus clientes mesitas con sillas en su local para servir los comestibles.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de las mesitas y sillas que necesita para mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Sra. Carolina P. is responsible for the formation of this committee. She invited and organized her friends to join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. The members currently work independently in their individual businesses, but at the same time, they come together to conduct fundraising activities and share a common bond – which is their need for capital.

Sra. Blásida is one of the members who is very satisfied with the work that has taken place since she joined the committee. She prepares and sells both sweet and savory foods. Blásida has plans for making her customers more comfortable by providing tables and chairs in her shop where she serves food. Her loan will be used to buy the tables and chairs that she needs to improve her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs to provide better service

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina A. is from the village of Misom. She is 51 years old. Rosalina is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosalina owns & operA. a business selling her own harvested rice in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Rosalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase agricultural supplies. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Rosalina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living situation. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She is 36 years old and married with 9 children. All her children are attending school. 

She has been farming for 20 years, producing sorghum, millet, beans, coffee, bananas, maize and tea which she sells locally and to Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also operates a posho (cornmeal) mill in the same area. She is pictured above in her posho mill. Her biggest challenge in farming has been crop diseases which affects her output.

She recently completed her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 90,000 KES to expand her farming business by planting more sorghum, millet and beans and to purchase a dairy cow. She says that with this loan, her income base will increase hence enabling her to educate and feed her children.

She would like to purchase another posho mill in future. She is grateful to Juhudi for the loans which have enabled her to establish her business.

loans.use: To expand her farming business and purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia pertenece al Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Zenobia es casada tiene 7 hijos el mayor es de 25 años y el menor de 7 meses, de los cuales 5 estudian. Zenobia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Zenobia se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en su casa actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo y lo vende a clientes establecidos. Solicita un crédito de 1800 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños.
Zenobia sueña con construir su casa con material noble pues la que tiene es de material rustico y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Zenobia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. What she enjoys most is having the incentive to save.

Zenobia is married and has seven children, five of whom are in school. The oldest child is 25 years old while the youngest is 7 months. Zenobia travels to different fairs in the region where she buys grain to later sell at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Zenobia raises pigs at home with the help of her son and then sells them to her established customers. She is requesting a loan of 1800 PEN to invest in the purchase of piglets.

Zenobia dreams of building a house out of solid materials since her current home is made of basic materials. She also wants to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire piglets

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn J. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Emelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale and also helps her husband plant and harvest corn on their farm. She sells their harvest to their town's market. Emelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and farm supplies. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
El comité Cañaberal nace hace mas de un años.
Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a diferentes actividades a la venta de artículos en el barrio en el cual residen, tanto en sus respectivos domicilios como recorriendo casa por casa para ofrecer sus productos en sus Comunidades, gracias a los años de experiencia son muy estrictas a la hora de admitir nuevas integrantes ya que que es un grupo muy selecto con señoras muy responsables con sus labores.
Una de las integrantes es la señora de Romina R. quien se dedica a la venta de prodcutos varios ya sea de merceria, ropas, utensilios para el hogar y otros.
Ella dependiendo de la ocacion adquiere las mercaderia para vender, asi como en esta ocacio que solicita el prestamo para la compra de juguetes ya que en este mes en Paraguay se recuerda el dia del niño y la demanda de juguetes aumente masivamente.
Todas las integrantes de  este grupo agradecen por la oportunidad que se les brinda con el crédito ya se les facilita el trabajo.
texts.en:
The Cañaberal committee was formed over a year ago. The women that comprise this group engage in different sales activities in the neighborhood where they live. They do business as much in their respective homes as they do going from door to door offering their products in their communities. Thanks to their years of experience, they are very strict when it comes to admitting new members. Each woman in this select group is very responsible with her work. One of the members is Romina R.. She sells various products such as sewing notions, clothes, and utensils for the home. She acquires her merchandise based on the occasion. This instance is no exception. She requests the loan to purchase toys because the Day of the Child is celebrated this month in Paraguay. The demand for toys increases massively. All the members of this group are thankful for the opportunity that the loan provides since it facilitates their work.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jessica de 24 años, tiene un pequeño restaurante, hace comidas típicas como seco de chivo, pollo y carne. Es madre soltera con dos hijos, ellos vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Perimetral”.

Comenzó haciendo encebollados (plato típico que contiene pescado-cebolla) los vendía solo los fines de semana con ayuda de su mama, poco a poco invirtió dinero para comprar una cocina, por esa buena decisión ella ahora tiene un pequeño restaurante hace almuerzos, trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, legumbres para su pequeño restaurante. En el futuro quiere tener un local mas grande y que su restaurante sea conocido.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old. She has a little restaurant where she makes typical foods such as goat stew, chicken stew, and beef stew. She is a single mother with two children. They live on the outskirts of the city along the Perimetral. She began by making fish and onion stew, a typical dish, and sold it on the weekends with the help of her mother. Little by little she invested money to buy a kitchen stove. From this good decision, she now has a little restaurant where she serves meals. She works every day from 4 pm to 10 pm. With the loan, she wants to buy provisions such as rice and vegetables for her little restaurant. In the future she wants to have a bigger place and to have her restaurant be well known.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza vive en casa propia en la zona D. Pasankeri  D. la ciudad D. La Paz, vive con su esposo, con el cual elaboran chompas que venden al por mayor en puestos D. venta D. la ciudad D. LaPaz, con los ingresos que obtienen  mantienen a su familia, esta es la primera ves que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y el mismo será destinado a la construcción D. una habitación.Por su análisis socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Lorenza lives in La Paz’s Pasankeri neighborhood with her husband. Together they make sweaters that they sell at wholesale in sales stalls in La Paz. Their income makes it possible for them to support their family. This is the first time she’s requested an IMPRO loan; it will be used to build a room. She is considered to be a good client and the socio-economic evaluation done on her qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es: Esta  foto fue tomada en el negocio D. la Sra. Araceli Romana N. D. J. la cual es tesorera del grupo “Rayito D. Luna” que está ubicado en  Tehuacán, Puebla en México. En la foto podemos apreciar el lugar donD. planea poner  salón D. belleza, así como el  material que utiliza para hacer cortes D. cabello y peinados, ella tiene 10 años dedicándose a esta actividad. Sus clientes siempre quedan contentos porque les gusta como les corta el cabello, la señora Araceli   se siente contenta con su  préstamo ya que le agrada la idea D. que alguien confíe en ella  y sus compañeras. La tesorera tiene 37 años, solo tuvo la oportunidad D. cursar la secundaria, pero eso no le impidió salir adelante, es madre D. 3 hijos, 1 mujer y dos varones. Con el crédito ella piensa  remodelar y comprar más cosas para su salón D. belleza, además piensa tomar otro curso D. cultura D. belleza para actualizarse en los peinados y cortes D. cabello, para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder captar a más gente, su prioridad es apoyar a sus hijos para que ellos sigan estudiando y tengan una mejor oportunidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the business of Sra. Araceli Romana N. D. J., who is the group treasurer of “Rayito D. Luna” (Little Moon Ray) that is located in Tehuacán, Puebla in Mexico. As indicated by the photo, the place where she works is a beauty salon that has the equipment to proviD. haircuts and styling services. Araceli has been in business for ten years and her customers like the way she cuts their hair. She is pleased to have her loan and likes the idea of having someone who trusts her and her fellow group members.

Araceli is 37 years old and only had the opportunity to finish high school. However, this has not stopped her from moving forward. She is the mother of three children, one daughter and two sons. Her loan will be used to remodel her beauty salon and buy more equipment. She also plans to take another course in the culture of beauty so that she can keep up with the latest hairstyles and haircuts. This will help her proviD. the best service and attract more customers. Her priority is to support her children so that they can continue their education and have the best opportunity in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been farming for the last 36 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk, eggs, maize and beans which are sold locally. He also earns income from his pension pay. His biggest challenge in farming has been the high cost of dairy feed and sometimes diseases which are too costly to treat.

Michael has requested this loan of 41,600 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from the sale of milk will improve his economic status and also enable him pay school fees for his children. He plans to add two more dairy cows in future that will increase his productivity and help him be self sustainable.

Michael is 58 years old. He is married with 10 children who are between the ages of 12 and 32. Five of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel reside en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él vive con su familia, sus padres y su esposa, hasta el momento no tienen hijos, este negocio lo inicio por su padre que siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad de campo, ellos no tienen horario fijo y cultivan en su propio terreno.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, abono y tratamiento para plagas, ayudando así a mejorar los cultivos dándoles el cuido necesario, esperando recibir con esto una buena cosecha que alivie las necesidades familiares.
El sueño de Samuel es volverse un agricultor que cultive grandes cosechas de maíz y mejorar con este trabajo las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel lives in Santa Elena in the Department of Usulután. He is 38 years old and works as a farmer and rancher. He lives with his family, which consists of his parents and his wife. At the moment, he does not have any children. His business was started by his father who spent his time working in the fields. Samuel does not have a fixed schedule when working on his own land.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers, compost, and treatments against pests. This will help improve his crops and provide them with the necessary care. Samuel hopes to achieve a good harvest so that he can meet his family’s needs. His dream is to become a large scale producer of corn. Through his work, he hopes to improve his family’s conditions.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, compost, and treatments against pests

loans.name: Russel

texts.en: Russel L. is from the village of Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Russel owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Russel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Russel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Russel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Russel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
La señora Romelia Alegría E., vive en la colonia de Juan Sabines, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México. Fue casada donde tuvo la desdicha de quedar viuda con siete hijos a su responsabilidad quienes afortunadamente logro sacar adelante.
El préstamo que ha estado solicitando lo desea invirtir en la compra de ropas y utencilios de cocina que son productos que se venden muy bien. De la venta de éstos productos ella obtiene ingresos para su hogar, así ha sido durante 25 años que ha tenido ésta actividad y fue así como sacó adelante a sus hijos. 
Ella inició ésta actividad mas por necesidad que por inspiración, pues como quedó viuda y de sus 7 hijos 6 aun erán menores decidio iniciar una actividad en donde pudiera obtener ingresos sin descuidar a sus hijos.
Con las ganancias que va obteniendo compra más mercancía, así con esto sigue trabajando para tener dinero ahorrado para su vejez, o como ella dice: "para tener dinero para pasar los días que Dios me siga dando vida".
Nos comenta que ya no tiene más sueños solo que Dios le siga prestando vida y pueda seguir trabajando con el programa.
El grupo se llama "Guadalupana", se integra de  tres señoras y cada una tiene su actividad donde invertirá el préstamo, la razón del nombre es porque así se llama el barrio donde ellas viven.
Las integrantes del grupo son la siguiente:
    Romelia Alegría E.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ropas y trastes.
   Yuliana concepción González S.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingrediente para elaborar antojitos.
    Carmela R. Ramírez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración  de tamales de bola, mole y de chipilín.
texts.en:
Romelia Alegría E. lives in Juan Sabines district, in Copainala, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  Romelia was married but unfortunately she is now a widow.  She has seven children in her care who she has managed to get ahead in life.

Romelia would like to invest her loan in buying clothes and cooking utensils which are products that sell very well.  From the sale of these products she makes income for her household.  This is the way it has been for the 25 years she has been in this business and this is how she has managed to get her children ahead.

Romelia started this business activity more from necessity than inspiration since she was left a widow when 6 of her 7 children were still dependent.  She decided to start a business activity from which she could make income without neglecting her children.

Romelia uses the profits which she makes to buy more merchandise.  She continues to work so that she will have money saved for her old age or, as she puts it, “to have money for the days that God keeps giving me life”.

She tells us that she has no more dreams, only for God to keep giving her life and for her to be able to continue working with the program.

This group is called “Guadalupana” and has three female members.  Each one has a business activity in which she will invest her loan.  The group is  called 'Guadalupana' because that is the name of the neighborhood where they all live.  The members of the group are:
Romelia Alegría E., who will invest her loan in buying clothes and cooking utensils
Yuliana Concepción González S., who will invest her loan in buying ingredients to make 'antojitos' (traditional Mexican snacks generally sold at street stands)
Carmela R. Ramírez, who will invest her loan in buying ingredients for making 'tamales de bola' (round tamales), 'mole' (a spicy Mexican dish with red chili sauce) and 'chipilín' (tamales made from corn dough mixed with 'chipilín', a native Mexican legume)

loans.use: To buy clothes and cooking utensils which she will then sell outside her community

loans.name: Gladys Marcela

texts.es: La señora Gladys vive en la zona rural de Matucana, participa en EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD desde el año 2007,  se dedica a la venta de pasteles y empanadas hace 5 años, su esposo es el que prepara las ricas tortas y empanadas que ella vende de manera ambulatoria, gracias a los préstamos que adquirió aumentaron sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Además tiene un pequeño kiosco en el cual expende golosinas con su hermana. Sus ingresos de estos negocios los emplea para construir su casa a fin de dar comodidad a los suyos y apoya también a su esposo en los servicios básicos. El crédito que requiere será para comprar azúcar, manteca, harina así mismo espera construir más adelante el segundo piso de su casa con el fin de poner cabinas de internet y una fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Gladys lives in the rural Matucana zone.  She has been participating in EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD since 2007.  She has been selling cakes and turnovers for five years.  Her husband prepares the delicious cakes and turnovers which she then sells as a street vendor.  

Thanks to the loans she has received sales increased and as a result so did her income.  Besides, she has a small kiosk where she sells snacks with her sister.  Income from these businesses will be used to build her house in order to provide more comfort for her loved ones.  She also helps her husband pay for basic utilities.

The loan she needs is to buy sugar, lard and flour as well as to later on build a second story on her house to install Internet access booths and a photocopying machine.

loans.use: To buy turnover and cake making ingredients.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a thirty six year old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to provide a sustainable income for his family. He trades in produce for three years now and the business has been  lucrative with a slow but steadily expansion. Francis intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for resell

loans.use: Purchasing maize and beans for resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise (sneakers)

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married lady with six children.  For three years, she has been selling fish in Kawangware open-air market.  Being a business-lady, she decided to join Fadhili group in Faulu, Kenya so that she could easily access loans. Through the group, she has previously serviced a loan of 40,000 KES. She is glad to be involved with Faulu Kenya because she has managed to grow her business. She hopes to become a major supplier of fish in the market place in the future.

Eunice has requested another loan of 70,000 KES to buy sacks for storage and add stock of dried and smoked fish.

loans.use: To buy sacks for storage and add stock of dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a water project business, distributing fresh water from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also owns real estate houses which contribute to her income. Fatuma faces a major challenge of competition from other water distributors in her area of operation. She hopes to open a retail shop business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase building materials to renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu because of affordable financial services to small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Nantiwua  Ene

texts.en:
Nantiwa Sempeta, 46 years old, is married to Mpute and they have three children. They live in Bissil where she runs a curio shop at Bissil market, which is a busy market. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of KADET's customers.

Nantiwa has been in this business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000. She has applied for her third loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD to purchase textiles and raw materials for making beads.

If the loan boost her business she intends to improve her living standard. Nantiwa hopes to become a supplier of beads in tourist hotels.

loans.use: To buy textiles and raw materials for making beads

loans.name: Men Gel

texts.en:
Men Gel S. is from the village of Santo Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 35 years old. Men Gel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Men Gel makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Men Gel has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Men Gel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Men Gel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Men Gel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Men Gel's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

location.town: Liloy-Santo Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is 56 years old.  She is married and has 5 children. 

Sergia is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She  has a used clothes trading business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 34 years.  Sergia has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bundles of used clothing to sell.

In the future, Sergia  would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 38 years, she has five children who are between the ages 2-20 years.  All of her children are in school except the two young ones. Christine sells bananas, sorghum and other drinks.  She has been selling these products for six years and this business has enabled her to pay the children’s school fees and feed her family.  Christine is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and green bananas in order to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy sorghum and green bananas for sale.

loans.name: María Victorina

texts.es:
María Victorina vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una sala de belleza muy famosa en el lugar donde vive, pues el trabajo de María es de muy buena calidad siempre está a la vanguardia con los estilos de corte y peinados que les realiza a sus clientes; para ella la recompensa del trabajo bien hecho es la oportunidad de mantener los clientes y atraer a nuevos. 

La clientela ha aumentado y María quiere darles la mejor atención, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material de trabajo como shampoo, cremas para el cabello, cosméticos, tijeras, peines, entre otros; de esta manera María podrá mantener su calidad de trabajo y podrá vender al cliente lo que necesita con referente a artículos de belleza. 

Además tiene esperanza que este medio de trabajo le dará la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en el hogar.
texts.en:
María Victorina lives with her life partner and her son.  She owns a famous beauty salon in the area.  María's work is of very good quality, and she is always is on the vanguard of new haircuts and styles that she does for her customers.  For her, the reward for work well done is the opportunity to keep customers and attract new ones.  

Her customer base has grown and María wants to give them the best attention, so she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that allows her to purchase materials like shampoo, hair creams, cosmetics, scissors, combs, and other items.  In this way, María can maintain her quality of work and can sell her customers the beauty products that they need.  

She also hopes that this working environment will give her the opportunity to improve her family's quality of life at home.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair cream, cosmetics, scissors, and combs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and a mother of three grown-up children. She is now 42 years old and has had a manufacturing business for 10 years already. She makes and sells milk candies and pastries for the people in their community. According to Helen, her candy making is quite laborious but she is happy that she is able to sell all her finished products every time she makes them.   

Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that will serve as additional capital to buy milk, sugar, vanilla, and candy wrappers, which are the raw ingredients in her manufacturing business. Someday, Helen hopes to see her business grow to sustain the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, vanilla, and candy wrappers

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Oyungerel is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the  Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a lama and her two children attend kindergarten. She manages a construction material trading business at a rented stall at a trading center called Margad. Oyungerel started her business after graduating her college in 2002. Now her business has been stabilized and she has many regular customers. She attributes her business success to the  good location of her store. She is planning to expand her business in the future. Oyungerel is a patient woman who says, "I want to broaden the variety of my products in order to attract more customers." She is requesting a MNT 3,000,000  loan to purchase more construction material to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more construction material to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea D. 45 años D. edad convive con William con quien tiene un hermoso hijo llamado Anthony D. 8 años D. edad, juntos vive en su casa propia en el centro poblado D. Canayre del distrito D. LLochegua. Andrea, es una mujer muy trabajadora, recuerda que antes D. tener su botica, ofrecía sus medicamentos tocando puertas, trasladándose D. un pueblo a otro atendiendo a muchos pacientes, pues los médicos no llegaban a estos lugares. El puesto D. salud mas cercano estaba a más D. 4 horas, ella aprovechaba esto y vio que sus ventas estaban creciendo D. a poco pero con sostenibilidad, además ya tenia cartera D. clientes; es por ello que ella incursionó en la venta D. medicamentos.  La mayoría D. veces trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda  D. sus padres y su horario D. trabajo es desD. las 5:00 AM hasta las 9:00PM. En el futuro ella piensa ampliar su botica con la finalidad D. seguir previniéndoles muchas enfermedades, y calmándoles el dolor a muchos pacientes. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes, para continuar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles desea ampliar su botica.
texts.en:
Andrea is 45 years old and lives with her partner William.  The couple have a beautiful son called Anthony who is 8 years old.  They live together in their own home, in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.

Andrea is a very hard-working woman.  She recalls that, before she owned her pharmacy, she used to sell her medicines by knocking on doors, moving from one village to the next.  She served a lot of patients as the doctors didn't get out as far as these places.  The nearest health center was more than four hours away.  Andrea took advantage of this fact.  She saw that her sales were increasing gradually and sustainably, and she already had an established customer base.  Andrea therefore decided to make inroads into the medicine sales business.  She mostly works with her partner but she also sometimes receives help from her parents.  She works from 5.00am to 9.00pm.  In the future, she plans to expand her pharmacy with the goal of continuing to prevent many illnesses and relieving the pain of many patients.

This will be Andrea's second loan from MFP.  She hopes to be able to rely on the support of each and every one of you so that she can continue in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Andrea would like to spend the 2,000 Peruvian soles on expanding her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand her pharmacy

loans.name: Dina Roxana

texts.es: Dina Roxana D. veintiocho años D. edad vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda con la que mantiene a flote su hogar, es un negocio muy rentable y ya tiene mucha clientela pues el lugar donD. lo tiene establecido es muy concurrido D. personas. Dina siempre tiene los mejores productos y en variedad, los clientes la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan y por supuesto a precios accesibles. Para Dina Roxana las cosas más bellas en la vida se obtienen con el esfuerzo y la dedicación; el trabajo duro trae las mejores satisfacciones es por eso que ella se encuentra decidida y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como granos básicos, azúcar, golosinas, pan, productos instantáneos, bebidas, entre otros; así logrará que poco a poco su negocio vaya creciendo y cumplirá una D. sus grandes metas en la vida. Dina tiene la confianza que si su trabajo es viable lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica además D. una vida plena.
texts.en: Dina Roxana is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her two children.  She has a store that keeps her household afloat.  It is a very profitable business and she has many customers since her store is located in a very busy place.  Dina always has the best products and variety.  Her customers prefer her because she always has what they need and of course, at affordable prices.  For Dina Roxana, the most beautiful things in life are obtained through hard work and dedication and hard work brings with it satisfaction.  It is for this reason that she decided to request a loan from Integral.  This will allow her to buy more merchandise such as basic grains, sugar, candy, bread, instant products, beverages, and other things.  This way, little by little, she will be able to grow her business and achieve one of her greatest goals in life.  Dina has confidence that if her work is viable she will be able to give her family financial security as well as a full life.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, sugar, candy, bread, instant products and beverages.

loans.name: Mushina

texts.en:
Mushina is a 55-year-old married woman. She has 10 children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for a period of 15 years.

She learned about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid the previous loan successfully without any tricky situations. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

She hopes to expand her farming and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Julia Beatriz;  tiene 52 años D. edad  y es casda la socia tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales dos D. ellos son independientes y el ultimo D. sus hijos tiene 12 años, La soica se dedica a la administracion D. sus negocio, la socia tiene en una D. las calles centricas D. la misma ciudad D. Cusco, tiene un stand D. venta y renta D. bicicletas a turistas y nacionales, la socia alquila sus bicicletas y tambien estan a la venta, ella tambien venD. repuestos, accesorios, piezas, cascos, asientos, entre otras piezas D. bicicletas. La socia desea invertir el prestamo que se le otorgara en su negocio ella quiere hacer un pedido granD. para que le lleguen unas piezs para emsalblar bicicletas, para ello requiere el prestamo. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. accesorios y piezas para emsamblar bicicletas.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad D. vida y la D. sus familia.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank "Illary 3" in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Julia Beatriz, 52, is married and has 3 children - two are grown and the youngest is 12. She manages her business on one of the central streets of Cusco, where she sells and rents bicycles to tourists and locals. She rents her bikes and also sells them, along with replacement parts, accessories, pieces, helmets, saddles and other bike parts. She wants to order a lot of parts to assemble bicycles, but she needs the loan to be able to do so. She asks for the loan to invest in the purchase of accessories and parts for putting together bikes.

She is grateful for and values the loan that will be presented to her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy accessories and parts to assemble bicycles.

loans.name: Lordina Group

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of used clothing is widespread in Ghana because it is an easy business to start up. A good number of  Ghanaian low-income earners buy used clothing because it is relatively affordable, making the sale of used clothes a lucrative jobs for many women.  Salina is one of such entrepreneurs. She has been selling used clothes for the past five years. She is excited to be taking out the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing assorted used clothes in bulk to serve her customers. Salina anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

Apart from being a vibrant businesswoman, Salina is also married to a commercial driver and she is the mother of three children. She hopes for a bright future for her kids through quality education. Salina is currently the group leader of Lordina Trust Bank Group, which is made up of six members. As the leader of the group, she ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: to purchase assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is father of one child, he has been a farmer for the past 10 years. He was trained on how to grow rice by his cooperative.
He will usea  Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 37 years old and married with two children who go to school. She does tailoring to earn a living for her family. She has been in the business for the last year and has employed one person. She has become financially literate because she has been attending financial training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  This has helped her to manage her finances by saving.  She hopes to expand her business and employ more people.  She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José es de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, tiene 25 años, está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas en la Universidad Católica Nuestra Señora de la Asunción, se recibirá de Abogado, este año está culminando la carrera y el año 2012 recibirá su titulo, es soltero y vive con su madre, son de escasos recursos económicos. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la Cooperativa de San Ignacio. Comenta que tiene muy buen promedio educativo en la Universidad y cuenta con méritos a su dedicación y sacrificio.
José tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera, trabajar en su profesión, contar con un buen ingreso, seguir especializándose, y ayudar a su familia, para brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
El solicita el préstamo para el pago de los gastos de la facultad, y  agradece a la Fundación ya que le ayudará en su estudio y también para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
José is from the town of San Ignacio Misiones.  He is 25 years old and studying for a law degree at the Nuestra Señora de la Asunción Catholic University.  He is studying to become a lawyer and this year he will finish his degree course.  He will receive his degree in 2012.  José is single and lives with his mother.  They are a family of limited financial means.  José is currently working for the San Ignacio cooperative.  He says that he has a very good grade point average at university and has received merits for his commitment and sacrifice.

José has a great desire to finish his degree, work in his profession, make a good income, continue specializing in his profession and help his family so that he can provide his mother with a better quality of life.

José is requesting this loan to cover his faculty expenses and he is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya as this loan will help him in his studies and also help him to carry out his projects.

loans.use: to cover his university expenses and buy materials

loans.name: Jose Paciente

texts.es: José Paciente, tiene la edad 76 de años, está casada y vive con su esposa actualmente que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los materiales para hacerle mejoras a su finca de ganado. El con el crédito va hacer la mejora de las cercas y los repastos para ofrecerles a sus animales mejor calidad de pastos para su bienestar. El cuenta con los potreros pero quiere mejorarlos en condiciones. El quiere obtener de estas mejoras los mejores resultados y así generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias al poder darle a sus animales mejores pastos y el obtener los resultados esperados a un plazo más rápido. El piensa en el futuro de ambos por lo cual hará estas mejoras.   Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 76 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is now his main concern. With the loan he plans to buy materials to improve his cattle farm. He wishes to improve the enclosures and the grazing land so the animals have better quality food. He has some vacant land but he wants to improve its quality.

From these improvements José expects to get better results and generate more income in a short period of time. He is thinking of the future of both his wife and himself.

José has not had loans from state banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with good repayment conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve his cattle farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 46-year-old divorced man, taking good care of his precious three children. Nabil is a hardworking man who devotes his whole life for his children's living and needs. 

For 6 years, Nabil has worked as a tattoo specialist. His work is mobile upon appointments organized by customers. His business location is at customers' residences. In addition to this highly talented business, Nabil works as a taxi driver to make sure his children's needs are well taken care of because he hates to feel that there might be something he can't afford them. He is a man with a very good reputation, recommended by most of his customers.

Nabil is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his children's primary school costs. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing history. His previous loan reflected positively on both his social and financial situations.

He hopes to see his children in good positions in the future and to expand his business at the same time.

loans.use: to pay for his children's primary school costs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Imelda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has operated her beauty salon shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 24 years old and married to Simon; they have one school-going child. She also plans to start selling shoes.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cosmetics for sale and to use in her business, and also to buy shoes for sale.

In the future, Lilian hopes to expand her salon and shoe business and become among the best business people in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her beauty shop, which sells various kinds of cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics products for resale, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another business. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products for resale.

loans.name: Abdul Karim's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has applied for a loan of 3,300,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayments on their behalf. 

Pictured on the left is Abdul, the leader of this group of borrowers. A native of Magburaka town, Abdul is 47 years old. He is married to a petty businesswoman and the couple has five children – two in primary school, two in secondary school, and one in college. Abdul has been a professional teacher for 30 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She owns a boutique, which has been running for two years. Florence is single and has one child.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit for her business. Florence is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more second hand clothes.

Florence’s ambition is to purchase motorcycles for the transport business in the area she stays. She will use the extra income to purchase shelves for display.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes.

loans.name: Marina Dolores

texts.es:
Marina Dolores tiene 32 años de estado civil Casado, vive con su esposo y los 4 hijos, en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, mora, a la compra venta de ganado, cuyes, gallinas.

Mónica Dolores  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, mora, para la compra de comida adecuada para sus animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar los sombríos de mora para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida.

 Le gusta tejer   y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Marina Dolores is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their 4 children in the cantón of Chillanes, in the province of Bolívar. 

The communal bank “Luz y Progresso” [Light and Progress] is located in Recinto San José de Guayabal, in the cantón of Chillanes. This communal bank is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work such as the planting of corn and blackberries and the buying and selling of cattle, guinea pigs, and chickens.

Mónica Dolores works in agriculture, planting corn, beans, and blackberries. She does her buying and selling in Chillanes.

She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for planting corn, beans, and blackberries and for buying adequate feed for her animals. The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family’s use and also to invest. Her dream is to increase her plantings of blackberries so that she can have improved income and thereby a better quality of life.

She likes to knit and she likes it when the carnival comes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for planting corn, beans, and blackberries

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
An experienced farmer, and relatively new to cacao, Catarino planted his first two acres in 2000. Having expanded to another plot of four acres in 2005, he now manages among the biggest farms in Maya Mountain Cacao's network. Catarino lives in the village of San Jose with his wife Isidora and two kids, with another four already living outside the home. 

Farming has been Catarino’s bread and butter since the beginning of days. “Farming is my life. I have no education other than my farm,” he says proudly. His wife Isidora helps out with the farm, primarily with harvesting, fermentation and drying. Catarino is one of few farmers that prefers to manage the processing before passing it onto buyers, and sells as much as 500 lbs of dry cacao and probably double that in wet cacao yearly. 

A true enthusiast of working the land, Catarino says farming is not that hard. “You have no boss, you’re your own boss.” Having no help around the farm, as his older children work in a nearby shrimp farm and youngest are still infants, Catarino is used to hiring help to manage to clean and prune his cacao farm. Pruning and cleaning is a key investment when it comes to cacao, as it eases access to the trees for harvesting, prevents spread of mold infestation and increases yields in the coming harvest season. As many farmers in San Jose, Catarino speaks his native Maya Mopan as well as English.

loans.use: To hire help with cleaning, pruning and harvesting his six acre cacao farm and purchase a cleaning blade.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Meet Rachel, a resident of Kericho. She loves farming and has been farming for 24 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. Her greatest challenge in farming is getting a ready market and transporting her farm produce.

Rachel said that Juhudi Kilimo has helped her to expand her farm and it also has very good loan officers. During the Juhudi micro finance training session, Rachel said that she learnt that MFIs offer low interest rates.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Rachel replied, it will help them sell more eggs and thus give them a better lifestyle.

Rachel owns the following: cows, poultry, but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ulemu Group

texts.en:
Lindiwe is 47 years old. She has 3 children, 1 relative and 1 other person that depend on her.

Lindiwe runs a nursery school and also sells second hand clothes for a living. She would like to use this loan to buy a bale of clothes to sell. The profits from the business will enable her to buy food and feed the children in her nursery school. She started her businesses to become financially independent. She has employed 4 people and 1 relative that helps her with the activities of her businesses.

Lindiwe hopes to buy a piece of land to build a house. She also hopes to increase the number of bales she orders from 1 to 4 for her clothing business in the future .

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
My work is selling clothes and cosmetics in a store located on one of the boulevards of the city Danli. I have working in sales for seven years. Thanks to the earnings I recieve, I have been able to help my husband with the family expenses and to give my children the opportunity to continue in their studies. 

Loan Use: Buying women's cosmetics and clothing for men, women and children.

Me dedico a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos en un puesto ubicado en uno de los boulevares de la ciudad de Danli, tengo siete años de dedicarme a esta actividad. Gracias a los ingresos que tengo por las ventas he podido apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares y darle a mis hijos la oportunidad de continuar estudiando.

loans.use: Compra de cosmeticos para dama y ropa para caballeros, bebes y niños.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 5 years and it allows him to support his family.
He likes to breed sheep. 
He is married, has 3 children and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. 
The first time he borrowed a loan of $600 and bought 8-10 lambs.
Now he applies for a loan of $850 to buy equipment for  shearing sheep. He wants to improve fleece production.

loans.use: To  buy equipment for  shearing sheep

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz C. lives with her four young children in a small house, which she owns, in the Pasankeri zone, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. Her husband passed away in 2003, which is why Beatriz supports her family by working in a cereal factory. Beatriz’ house consists of one bedroom (which serves as bedroom and dining room for the whole family), a kitchen, and a bathroom. The purpose of the loan is to build another room, which would provide a minimum level of comfort for her family. This is the second time she has requested a loan with our institution, and her payment and punctuality show a good conduct with credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz C. vive con sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, en una pequeña casa de su propiedad en la zona Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposo falleció el año 2003 por lo que la señora mantiene a la familia trabajando en una fabrica de cereales. La casa de la señora Beatriz C. cuenta solo con una habitación (que funciona como dormitorio y comedor para toda la familia), una cocina y un baño. El destino del crédito es para construir una habitación que pueda dar las condiciones mínimas de comodidad a su familia. Es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución, y su rendimiento y puntualidad demuestran un buen comportamiento crediticio.

loans.use: Construction of a new room in her house.

loans.name: Martha Delia

texts.es:
Martha is married and has two children who are currently in primary school. Her husband works a fork lift truck and she started her business to help him cover their family expenses. She started offering her products to family members, friends and neighbours and concentrated on selling women’s clothing from a catalogue. It went very well and she was able to pay for her children’s education. She hopes her business will grow and her income will increase as as her children grow the family’s expenses do too.

Martha would like a loan of $250 to buy merchandise for her business and so that she can buy the things people have already asked her for. She will repay the loan over a period of 3 months. She thanks you very much for your support so that her business can grow and she can improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijas las cuales están en primaria actualmente, su esposo trabaja como montacarguista y ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su esposo en la economía familiar, ofreció inicialmente sus productos entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, centrándose con el tiempo en solo venta de calzado para dama por catálogo, le ha ido bien y así a podido brindarles estudios a sus pequeñas hijas, espera poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos por que mientras van creciendo sus niñas sus gastos también se incrementan.

Martha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así poder surtir a varios pedidos que tiene actualmente pendientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is thirty-seven years old and widowed with four children.  Her husband was killed during the civil war in Sierra Leone.  She is the sole breadwinner for her four children.  Mariatu sells plastic shoes in the town of Magburaka.  It is the easiest business to start because it needs a small amount of capital.  She started with a capital of $50 which she borrowed at 50% interest from an expensive money lender.  She increased her capital base after her previous loan and would like to diversify her business.  She said a loan from SMT will be of great help for her business and the family.

loans.use: Diversify her shoe shop to attract additional business.

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en: F. is a mother of 5.  She is 34 years of age and runs a business selling handicrafts in flea markets at Fugalei. She was previously employed at one of the companies in town but she resigned because the pay she got from the company is lower than the money she earns from her business every week.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her flea market stall

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: I am Shazia I. from the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. I am 24, married, and the mother of two daughters. They are not of school-going age yet; but when they are, I will surely send them to school. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver. I sew clothes on order. At present, my husband drives someone else's rickshaw on rent. Now he wants to buy his own, for which we require a loan. This way we will not have to pay for rent any more, and we will build an asset of our own.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria S. is a 40 year old married mother of 6, ages 25 to 16, who raises poultry and cows on her farm. She wants a loan to construct more poultry houses. With her profits she hopes to construct a new home on her plot.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To construct poultry houses

loans.name: Piedade Amélia

texts.pt:
Piedade Amélia M., ID 100055404E, lives with her husband and 3 children. She joined the credit program in May of 2006. Piedade is in the 7th cycle of the credit program and is requesting a loan of 12000mt to be repaid in 6 months. She sells chicken and also owns a hair salon. She plans on investing this loan in both businesses.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Piedade Amélia M., portadora do BI nº 100055404E vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos entrou no programa a 16/05/06 estava no grupo esta agora no 7º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 12000 a pagar em 6 meses ela vende frangos e tem um salão de cabelereiro com o valor ela pretende repartir o nos seus negocios faz criação de pintos.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Olim

texts.en:
Olim S. was born in 1971 in the B.Gafurov region and he is married and has four children. Mr. S. has been a successful client of MicroInvest since 2004. He was able to repay his previous loan because of the business and income stability gained by improving his business.

His family business is making and selling the national bread named “lepeshky” and it supports his family. Mr. S. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1,200 to pay for flour and a new trade outlet for selling “lepeshky.”

loans.use: To open a new trade outlet for selling “lepeshky”

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: Jeneba is 30 years old and is married with 4 children.  They live in the village of Kormaslia in Kabala, the Northern Region of Sierra Leone.  Jeneba and her husband are subsistence farmers.  They grow vegetables, peanuts, and rice, but on a very small scale.  With her previous loan from SMT, Jeneba increased her farm field by one hector and doubled the vegetable and rice productions.  Jeneba would like to increase her farm production for family consumption and to generate additional income.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to hire labourers and to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire much-needed labourers and to purchase inputs (seeds and fertilizer) for her family's farm.

loans.name: Adjowah

texts.en:
A. Adjowah is married and has three children. She sells clothing and shoes but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Fatouma

texts.fr:
Fatouma A. was born in 1970 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. Born into a large family, she did not have the chance to continue her schooling due to a lack of funds. Very early on, she started selling boutique items and, given her mastery of her business, she succeeded in repaying her first loan without any problem at all.

Today, she is requesting a loan to enlarge her boutique and to bolster her business by buying ribbons, lace, and snaps. Realizing this project will enable her to have different items to offer at market and to meet the demands of her customers. This will enable her to raise her standard of living, leave her family home, and be on her own.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Fatouma est née en 1970 à Lomé, elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Issue d’une famille nombreuse, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études faute de moyens financiers. Elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce de mercerie et avec la maîtrise de ses activités, elle a réussit à rembourser son premier crédit sans aucun incident.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa boutique et renforcer ses activités en achetant des rubans, dentelles, presse bouton. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir les différents produits à offrir sur le marché et de satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle. Ce qui lui permettra de relever son niveau de vie, quitter la maison familiale et se prendre en charge.

loans.use: To enlarge her boutique and to bolster her business

loans.name: Sikiratou

texts.fr:
Ms. Sikiratou G. was born in 1980 in Pobè , which is in the region of Plateau, south of Benin. She is married to Issifou ADAM, an auto mechanic. She is the mother of two children - Anifath, age 9 and in 4th grade, and Djemilath, age 5 and in 3rd grade. Sikiratou sells toothpaste and toothbrushes. She also wishes to be more involved in retail of hygiene and beauty products. She is here to request her third loan to prevent difficulties that arise from lack of supplies.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1980 à Pobè dans le département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame G. Sikiratou est mariée à ADAM Issifou réparateur des vélo-moteurs. Elle est mère de deux filles que sont Anifath âgée de 9 ans en classe de CE2 et Djemilath âgée de 5 ans est en clase de CI. Dame G.
