Sikiratou est revendeuse des pâtes dentifrices et des brosses à dents auxquelles elle désire associer des produits de beauté. Elle vient sollicitr son troisième crédit pour faire face aux difficultés d'approvisionnement.

loans.use: Buy 7 cartons of toothpaste, 3 dozen toothbrushes, and 2 dozen beauty products

loans.name: Leonor Del Rocío

texts.es:
Leonor and her husband have decided to work hard for the sake of their two children and to pay for their education. Leonor sells cosmetics and her husband works as a driver. Leonor is very happy because her sales have been going up, she goes door to door looking for new clients, and her convincing and pleasant manners have allowed her to reach all her selling goals. She is asking for a loan because she would like to increase her earnings; that is why the loan will be used to buy merchandise of good quality and different brands. With the hope of your support, Leonor promises to be responsible on the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor y su esposo se han propuesto trabajar arduamente por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos y costear su educación. Por su parte, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y su esposo al transporte de pasajeros. Leonor está muy contenta porque ve crecer sus ventas, ella sale de puerta en puerta en busca de nuevos clientes, y con trato amable y poder de convencimiento, Leonor cada día supera las metas que ella misma se pone para su negocio.El motivo de que ella solicite el presente préstamo, es justamente porque desea que los ingresos económicos para su casa aumenten, para ello, el dinero será utilizado en la compra de nuevos cosméticos, de variadas marcas y buena calidad. Con la esperanza de que respondan a su pedido Leonor promete ser responsable en sus pagos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business (cosmetics sales)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is a 38-year-old woman. She is married with six kids. Currently two of them have completed high school. To support her family, Mary bakes and sells bread to the working community and at bus stops in Obuasi, a busy mining town in Ghana. She wants to use this loan to buy more flour, margarine, sugar, vegetable oil, etc. to avoid price hikes. She believes the loan will enable her to save more for the kids' education.

Mary is a member of the trust group called "Adekyensroma Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, sugar, vegetable oil etc. to use to bake bread

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35 year old Grace P. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children, ages 7 years and 16 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant boy because his parents cannot take care of him. Grace  P. has been running an auto supply shop business since 2005. The business is doing fine. She works at the business 9 hours a day, 6 days a week. Grace  P. currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy machine lubricants, machine oil, and other auto spares. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy machine lubricants, machine oil, and other auto spares.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase underwear and slippers for her small business.

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es: El Sr. A. R., pequeño productor agropecuario, socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza localizada en Tecolostote, junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 2 hijos en edad escolar (3ero y 4to grado de primaria); por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 3 mzs de arroz, durante la cosecha se le presenta un problema con la trillada del grano, lo que le altera los costos y reduce sus ingresos que le permiten el sustento de la familia; a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar en la construccion de 1 trillo, para lo que requiere un financiamiento de C$,15,000.00 y asi alcanzar cumplir con su sueño de ser socio de este trillo.
texts.en:
Mr. A. R. owns a small farm and is a member of the “La Esperanza” (Hope) cooperative located in Tecolostote. His family consists of his spouse and 2 school age children (in 3rd and 4th year of primary school). Through his own effort he has established 3 blocks of rice, during the harvest he has a problem with threshing the grain, which impacts his costs and reduces his income that he uses to support his family. Through the cooperative he has the opportunity to participate in the construction of a rice thresher, for which he needs financing of C$, 15,000.00 and in this way make is dream of being a member of this cooperative’s thresher reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide 30% of the funding to build a rice thresher

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea L., 48, is a widowed farmer who lives with five children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She grows and sells bananas at the market and is able to make $3 each day. Two of her children are married and no longer stay at home.

Chea L. is asking for a loan of $500 to rent a banana farm from an individual grower in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To rent a banana farm.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Casilda   es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. Casilda es casada, tiene  61 años y cuatro hijos  D. 41,40,38 y 35 años,  tres  D. sus hijos están casados.
Ella tiene una bodega que se llama “Katerine”, venD. abarrotes, cerveza, gas, gaseosas, dulces, ella venD. todos los días y atienD. en su bodega sola. 
Hace trece años que recibe préstamos y se siente más tranquila, ha podido  invertir más.
Casilda  necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. productos para su bodega (gaseosas, abarrotes, cerveza, etc.)
Casilda  sueña con  seguir trabajando e incrementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Casilda is a member of the Triunfo Community Bank. Casilda is 61 years old, married, and has three children ages 41, 40, and 38, who are married. She has a grocery store called "Katerina" where she sells groceries, beer, and soft drinks. She is open every day and tends to her store alone. It has been three years since she received a loan, and she feels calmer and has been able to invest more in her business. Casilda needs a loan for 1,000 soles which she will use to buy products for her grocery store (soft drinks, groceries, beer, etc.). Casilda hopes to continue her work and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Casilda needs a loan for 1,000 soles to purchase soft drinks, groceries, beer

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen P., 47, pictured here with her husband, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has operated a grocery stall from her home since 2003 to earn a living and is able to make US$ 5 every day. Her husband stays at home doing housework and helps his wife selling stuff. This couple has one young child. Mrs. Chen P. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to expand her grocery store by adding more stuff to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To expand their gorcery store

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung N., 32, is married and lives in the Bati, Takeo province. She owns a hair salon business in her home and is able to make around US$12 per day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. He uses a trailer to transport goods and people. On average, he makes US$10. Mrs. Ung N. would like to take out a loan to purchase cosmetics and other supplies to expand her shop.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair salon supplies

loans.name: Assibi

texts.fr: Assibi N. est une jeune femme de 32 ans, mariée et mère d’une petite fille. Elle est coiffeuse depuis 3 ans à Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Elle désire avec ce crédit acheter un séchoir ; et aussi des tenir le commerce des mèches et des produits de beauté. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de son enfant.
texts.en:
Assibi N. is a young woman, 32 years old, married, and the mother of a little girl. Assibi has been a hairdresser for three years in Atakpamé, a city located in central Togo. She would like to use this loan to buy a hair dryer and also to do commerce in hair extensions and beauty products. She is counting on this chance to improve her child's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and also beauty products

loans.name: Carren

texts.en: Ms. Carren M. is 32 years old and a single mother to her daughter. They are presently residing  at  Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is a new member of Paglaum MPC and has an existing small barbecue and food-vending business at their place. She decided to request a 1st loan of PHP 7,000 for additional capital for her businesses. She religiously pays her obligations to the cooperative so she can access another loan when she has paid off her present loan, because she plans to have  a little restaurant  and be more successful in her business. She wants to have a better living and a great  future  for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy kilos of pork and chicken for barbecue and spices

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Noha has owned a small locA. chicken slaughterhouse since 1999. She requested a loan of 1800 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase a refrigerator and merchandise for her business. This is the first time that Noha has requested a loan.

Noha is speciA. in her work because she has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her work, she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her business. Noha decided to do her work because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Noha will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru:
Хамрокул Маруфов с детства любил наблюдать за работой родных и соседей в огороде. Ему нравилось помогать сажать деревья и сеять семена, а особенно собирать плоды и урожай. Поэтому, совместив приятное с полезным, Хамрокул уже в юношеском возрасте начал заниматься сельским хозяйством, который приносил и приносит неплохой доход по сей день.
 Дополнительно к сельскому хозяйству, он торгует овощами (картошкой и морковью) на рынке города Худжанда. Товар он привозит из Истаравшана. В этом бизнесе ему помогают его брат и супруга.
 Хамрокул подал заявку, для получения займа в размере 1500 сомони сроком на 8  месяцев.     Использовать займ он хочет для того, чтобы посеять и вырастить лук, а так же реализовать его вместе с другими видами овощей, на рынке города Худжанда.
texts.en:
Since he was a child, Hamrokul M. liked observing his family and neighbors doing the gardening. He liked helping planting seeds and trees, and he especially enjoyed harvesting. Therefore, when he was young, he got involved in agriculture, an occupation which is still quite profitable these days. In addition to agriculture, he sells potatoes and carrots at Hujand's market. He brings the vegetables from Istaravshan. His brother and wife help him with the business. Hamrokul submitted an application for an eight-month loan of 1500 somoni. He would like to use the loan for planting onions, which he could later sell at Hujand market.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plant onions

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris sells drinks and provisions. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

She is 38 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth J. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Maribeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribeth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Maribeth is just starting this business. Before, Maribeth was engaged in a food-making business and peddled it in her village.

In 2008, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: Dona Maria es originaria y con residencia en la comunidad de Coxom su especialidad es el bordado manual  como lo demuestra la fotografia en dicha comunidad la actividad principal de todas la mujeres es el bordado doña maria aprendio el oficio de su querida madre cuando ella tenia doce años ella manifiesta por el tipo de trabajo necesita de mucho capital y tiempo por el esmero que se realiza para la elaboracion de dicho producto hoy necesita de un credtio para tener una su operaria para poder aumentar sus ingreso y mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a native and resident of the community of Coxom. Her specialty is hand embroidery as shown in the photo. This is the main activity of all women in her community. Maria learned these skills from her beloved mother when she was twelve years old. She expresses that this kind of work requires a lot of time and capital because all what it takes to produce the finish product. She is asking for a loan to hire an employee to increase her income and improve her and her family living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. owns a small, 2-hectare (~5-acre) rice field in her village. For her, rice is gold because it has sustained her family through the years. She is 45 years old and the income that she gets from the farm has gone a long way towards educating and meeting the needs of her three children.

She would like to ask a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use her loan to buy foliar fertilizer (liquid fertilizer that is applied directly to plant leaves) and insecticides. Knowing about its importance in growing crops, Teresita believes this will give her farm an abundant harvest.

CEVI is reaching out farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase foliar fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Кузибоев Умед проживает в районе Абдурахмон Чоми. Возраст 27 лет. Не женат, детей не имеет. Умед по специальности "строитель". Он более 2 лет занимается торговлей строительных материалов. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота, т.к. в данный момент в его районе начался большой объем строительства.
texts.en:
Umed K. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 27 years old, single and has no children. Umed is a construction work by profession. He has been involved in selling building materials for over 2 years. He is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover because his district is currently experiencing a construction boom.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40 year married with four children aged between 4 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with six people. Margaret doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area selling second hand clothes in one of Kampala suburbs.  She uses public transport to and from shopping. Margaret sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and She has been in this business for the last eight years Margaret has been with MCDT for nine years and servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes  Margaret is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a house in the available plot she bought from previous profits 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Mariana Angelica

texts.es:
La señora MARIANA ANGELICA P. V., tiene 63 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios técnicos de cosmetología, trabajó en la peluquería de su hija durante 2 años aproximadamente, pero posteriormente decidió abrir el negocio de locutorio.
MARIANA está casada , tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores y ninguno dependen económicamente de ella, al contrario ella cuenta con el apoyo de ellos.
MARIANA se dedica a atención de su locutorio que tiene en su casa
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra  de pollos, patos y gallinas que criaba y vendía en el mercado que esta cerca de su casa.
Este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar 2 tarifadores y un monitor de computadora.
MARIANA sueña con ampliar su negocio de locutorio y poder también tener cabinas de Internet.

loans.use: lo utilizara para comprar 2 tarifadores, un monitor de computadora

loans.name: Abibatou

texts.fr: M. Abibatou est née le 31/07/1975 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Abibatou est mariée à BANKOLE Abdel. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis trois ans à Avrotrou, un quartier de Cotonou. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Abibatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Abibatou vend des sacs de maïs qu’elle va acheter à Malanville, deuxième marché international de produits vivriers du Bénin. Mais Abibatou vend aussi des chaussures et des bijoux sur commande et à crédit. Abibatou achète les chaussures et bijoux à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Abibatou a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Abibatou a eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Abibatou demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de chaussures et bijoux.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is an industrious father to his three children who are in the secondary and primary levels. He is also a loving husband to his wife Marjorie who is 35 years of age. Their family harmoniously resides at Barangay San Francisco, Alicia, Isabela. He describes his village as a peaceful place. Their sources of income are motorcycle transport and farming.

He has operated a retail store for almost a year. His weekly net income is PHP 250.00. While in his motorcycle transport business, he has a daily net income of PHP 200.00, and in farming he earns PHP 10,000.00 net income for three months. He wants to increase his income to support his children's education, for a better future. He requested a loan amount of PHP 7,000.00 for his additional working capital in his general store business.

loans.use: Additional capital for his general store

loans.name: Ana María

texts.en:
Ana Maria B. lives in the Tacambu neighborhood with her husband and three of their children. The oldest is already married and has a house of his own.

She gets up early every day for housework and then goes to her beauty salon that is located a few blocks from her home.

Since childhood Ana wanted to learn how to run a beauty salon and was always attracted to selling clothes and shoes. When her husband was younger, he was a champion on the football and soccer field, and he wanted to be a soccer player and coach. However, being a soccer coach couldn’t support his family entirely, so Ana decided to get a career in hairdressing and selling shoes.

She started with a small living room in their house, and then, in order to provide greater comfort to her clients, she began to buy more furniture, hairdryers, irons, mirrors, etc. Then her husband sold shoes and they were very successful.

When they wanted to make the business larger he went to Buenos Aires to bring seasonal clothing back to sell. Their sales continued with great success, and so the couple moved forward with good fortune, and all 3 of their children finished their studies. The first is a Customs Agent who has been married for 3 years. The second son is a student of business administration, and the third is a professional makeup artist who also helps at home and works at the Beauty Salon to meet clients.

Ana washes hair and gives haircuts, massages, facials, and waxing, and gives advice on trendy shoes. With the loan they want to buy more shampoo, creams, and other materials for the salon, and clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more shampoo, creams, etc. for the salon, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell basic goods

loans.name: Armin

texts.es:
el sr. Armin F. E. se dedica al negocio de transportar personas, tiene un taxi de punto, el cual hace el recorrido de la Colonia La Vega hacia la Universidad Autonoma de Honduras. tiene 5 años de estar operando en este punto de taxis el cual es muy bueno ya que muchas personas se transportan para la maxima casa de estudios de Honduras.
esta casado y en su casa de habitacion tienen una pulperia y su esposa es la que lleva el control de la misma. juntos salen adelante con los gastos de su familia y los gastos del hogar.
Armin necesita el credito para hacerle mejoras a su vehiculo, cambio de llantas, pintado, reparacion de motor y amortiguadores, esto lo tiene que hacer porque la empresa de revision de taxis exige que las unidades esten en buenas condiciones para dar buen servicio a los clientes que las usan, de lo contrario los dejan sin permiso de operacion.
texts.en:
Armin F. E. is involved in the business of transporting people. He has a fixed route taxi, which covers the route from Colonia La Vega to the Universidad Autónoma de Honduras. He has been operating this route for 5 years, and it is good one because many people travel to the leading academic institution of Honduras.

Armin is married and in their house they have a small grocery store, which his wife manages. Together, they get ahead with the family and household expenses.

Armin needs a loan to make improvements to his taxi – tire change, painting, motor and shock absorber repair. He needs to do this because the taxi inspection company requires that the car be in good condition to provide good service to the customers and if he doesn’t do it, the company will not give him permission to operate.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires, paint, and spare motor and shock absorber parts

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is from the village of San Jose in Concepcion, Tarlac. She is 26 years old. Maricel is married. To make a living, Maricel works in a family member's business selling general farm supplies and equipment to local farmers. Maricel is just starting to work in this business.

In 2009, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to expand the business. This will be Maricel's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey O. is 48 years old and she lives in PO. Roung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Now she needs some money to buy fertilizers to support her rice farming. Mrs. Srey O. is a widow with three children, one of whom sells rice soup and rice with pork; the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her rice farming

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, es una mujer muy puntual en sus reuniones, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 33 años, es madre de una hija menor de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de su Shindaiwa (maquina utilizada en la agricultura), esta actividad la realiza desde su casa, es soltera. Patricia forma parte del Banco comunal “Las Doncellas”, desde hace cinco años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en el mantenimiento de su máquina, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será invertido en la renovación y construcción de su casa. La meta de Patricia, es comprar dos maquinarias más.
texts.en:
Patricia is a woman who is always on time to her meetings. She lives in the District of Callería in the Ucayali Region. Patricia is 33 years old and a single mother with a young daughter. She rents out her Shindaiwa machine (used for pruning trees and trimming hedges) and manages her business from home.

Patricia joined the Communal Bank “Las Doncellas” (The Maidens) five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to pay for equipment maintenance. She is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles in order to pay for renovations to her house. Patricia’s goal is to buy two more machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for home renovations

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence manages a 1.5-hectare rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato.  He also has business in piggery. He strives hard for work to provide the basic needs of his family.

He would like to have an additional capital for his business.  He joins Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it has a low interest in financing.  He’s now requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy supplies needed at his farm and piglets.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 40 years old and has a rice-farming business which he started in 1992. He manages a one-hectare (2.5-acre) rice field in Banga, South Cotabato.

Jonathan is the father of two children, his eldest being 8 years old. He wants to help his children to finish their studies by providing them with their needs.

Jonathan lacks capital in his business and that's why he sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., requesting a loan of 8,000 Php. This will enable him to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Holmirzo

texts.ru: Мадаминов Холмирзо проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 64 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Холмирзо имеет среднее образование. Более 7 лет занимается живоноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этот бизнес приносит ему хороший доход. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Holmirzo M. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 64 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Holmirzo has a secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He breeds cattle at home and primarily raises and sells livestock. This business yields him a good income. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi T. is a fisherman. He goes out to sea to fish. He gives some of the fish to his wife to smoke (process) and sell and he sells the rest to the market women at Elmina. Kofi has received a junior high education. He is married and has four children. His wife is a fishmonger. Kofi has been doing this fish business for some time now. With the support of his wife, he is able to take good care of his family. The loan he will receive will be used to buy a personal boat for fishing. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a house on already purchased land. Kofi is leaning with one of the boats he rents for fishing. At the time of visit, he had already sold the fish he caught for the day.

loans.use: To buy a personal boat for fishing.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita M. lives the village of Capinona, Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, married and has three grown children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (or variety) store where her most popular items are shampoo, dairy products, biscuits, soap and toothpaste. Pacita has owned her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She used this loan to buy additional products to sell, and has applied for a new loan of 8,000 PHP to restock her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to support her family. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda T. runs a successful food vending business. With the proceeds from her business, she has been able to meet the needs of her six children, ages eight to 23, and has improved their standard of living considerably. As a result, Luzviminda is encouraged to work harder and aim further for her business and family through building her business. She is grateful to have the ability to obtain loans that help to boost her business endeavors. 

She wants to take this opportunity to grow her business by requesting another loan of 34,000 PHP to ASHI to utilize as additional business capital. With this loan, she wants to buy a larger volume of supplies for her food vending business in order to attract more clients and secure the loyalty of her regular customers. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Luzviminda is determined to achieve business success in order to continue to build more long-term financial security for herself and her family.

With the love and support of ASHI and Kiva, Luzviminda is hopeful that her dreams of sending her children to a university to complete college degrees will be achieved. Luzviminda’s desire to give her children a brighter future fuels her dedication to her business.

loans.use: To buy a larger volume of supplies for her food vending business

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  El Crédito esta ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, considerada una de las ciudades  más bellas del Ecuador por su arquitectura, sus paisajes naturales,   sus ríos y  su gente  son atractivos que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Rosa  es casada y tiene  seis  hijos quienes se encuentran de 42, 38, 34, 32, 25, 15 años, de ellos cuatro son casados y viven independientes, arrienda una casa en la urbe de la ciudad Cuenca donde vive con su esposo que  es jubilado y pasa en casa, su hijo de 25 años estudia en la universidad y el ultimo hijo  aun esta en secundaria gastos que solventan  con lo  que recibe su esposo de pensión, su hijo de 34 años ayuda económicamente  a sus padres y ella que se dedica  a la venta de ropa (hace 20 años) y  para incrementar los ingresos de su casa hace poco tiempo monto un pequeño negocio  de comida rápida en el que atiende de 11 am a 8pm de lunes a viernes 

Es socia del banco comunal El Crédito hace 10 años y todos los créditos le  han beneficiado para ir incrementando su negocio de venta de ropa, con su nuevo crédito comprará  una estufa y menaje de cocina que le hacen falta para su negocio de comida rápida. Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Crédito is located in the city of Cuenca, which is considered one of the most beautiful cities in Ecuador. Its architecture, its natural countryside, its rivers, and its people are attractions that draw both national and international tourists. Rosa is married and has six children ages 42, 38, 34, 32, 25, and 15, four of whom are married and living independently. She is renting a house in the city of Cuenca where she lives with her retired husband who is at home, her 25-year-old son who is studying at the university, and her last son who is still in secondary school. They cover expenses with the pension received by her husband, the economic help of their 34-year-old son, and she has sold clothing for 20 years. To increase the household income she recently started a small business selling quick meals, which occupies her from 11am to 8pm Monday through Friday. She has been a member of the communal bank El Crédito for 10 years, and all the loans have been beneficial to grow her clothing-sales business. With her new loan she will buy a stove and kitchenware needed for her quick-meal business. Her goal is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a stove and kitchenware

loans.name: Maria Luz Del Alva

texts.es:
La señora María es casada tiene 3 hijos ella se dedica al comercio ambulante, vende ropa como blusa, pantalones,etc; sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo su forma de vender es a crédito,  invierte 200 dólares,  según lo que cobre por semana,  su esposo es albañil trabaja en la ciudad de Manta.

María es nacida en la provincia de Esmeraldas pero desde muy pequeña se crio en Montecristi, tiene  su vida en la provincia de Manabí, provincia a la que ama,  sus padres fallecieron hace mucho tiempo, ella solo estudio la primaria; decidió quedarse en Montecristi por que se enamoro y así realizo su vida, al lado de un hombre que es su felicidad, el padre de sus hijos.

El sueño de María es poder tener su propio almacén y seguir con su familia, el trabajo y su familia son el complemento perfecto  en la vida y no los cambiaría por nada, agradece a la Fundación Espoir ser parte importante de ese equilibrio en su vida. Porque sin su trabajo no podría salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. María is married and has three children. She works as a street vendor selling clothes such as blouses, trousers, and other items. María buys her inventory in the city of Portoviejo. Her sales are made on credit, amounting to $200 each week. María’s husband is a bricklayer and works in the city of Manta.

María was born in Esmeraldas Province, but grew up in Montecristi. She now lives in Manabí, the province she loves. Her parents died a long time ago, so she was only able to complete elementary school. She decided to stay in Montecristi and eventually fell in love with the man who makes her happy and is the father of her children.

María’s dream is to have her own store and continue to raise her family. Her work and her family are the perfect complement in life and she does not want to change anything. She thanks Fundación ESPOIR for being an important part in helping her find balance in her life because without her work, she would not be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and pajamas

loans.name: Kicwamba Tukole Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
Hardworking M. John, aged 46, started up his hardware shop business over ten years ago. His business has, for the most part, been dealing in general building merchandise. Being strategically located in Rwenshaka, Rukungiri town, he gets many customers, earning him profits of 173,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

John’s main drawback is having a small amount of stock that cannot match the demand from his customers. With his pub and banana-sales side-businesses, however, he has managed to cut both ways in situations like the aforementioned. John started off as a farmer and he has never looked back. He has built up enough experience that things are currently playing into his hands.

With this loan, John hopes to buy more hardware stock for his business. He is looking at buying more iron sheets, nails and cement. This, he figures, will help him expand his business market and also earn more sales revenue to cater for the family requirements of his four children who are still attending school, and also enable him to progress economically.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware stock for his business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A., 43 years old, is married to Maurice Otieno and they have three children: Winnie Anyango, 21 years old and in college; Dennis Otieno, 19 years old and a high school graduate, and Sheila Scovia, 13 years old and in primary school. They live in the Manyatta area of Kisumu city.

Pamela has operated a hair salon for the last three years and is now applying for her third loan, having repaid the previous ones. With a good credit history, she intends to use the money to add replacement stock to her salon including hair chemicals and human hair for braids. Her clients are mainly ladies from both the market centre where she operates and the neighboring estates.

Pamela hopes to open up a hairdressing school in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and stock her salon

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y un hijo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 14 años se dedica en la  fabricación D. galletas, cuya experiencia su esposo lo acogió cuando trabajaba en una panadería. Ahora este negocio familiar, donD. ella y su esposo trabajan activamente en la preparación y venta D. galletas a sus más exigentes clientes que son comerciantes. Generalmente cuenta con la ayuda D. 2 personas que ha contratado, quienes se encargan D. preparar la masa. Lo que mas le agrada D. su trabajo es que  las ganancias son rentables a pesar  D. que el trabajo suele ser D. mucho esfuerzo y esta es la razón por la que se proyecta hacia el futuro tener maquinas mas sofisticadas para ser más eficiente y rápido la preparación. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. una maquina amasadora D. segunda mano.
texts.en:
Luz is 62 years old. She lives with her husband and her son in their own home. For over fourteen years, she has worked making cookies with her husband, who gained experience when he worked in a bakery. Now both husband and wife work actively in the family business, preparing and selling cookies for their most demanding clients--merchants and shopkeepers. Normally the couple employs two workers who are responsible for preparing the dough. What they enjoy most about their business is that it is profitable in spite of the hard work involved. Because the baking requires a lot of effort, they are planning to buy sophisticated machines in the future, which will make the preparation faster and more efficient. This is the Luz's first loan with MFP. Luz is very happy knowing that she has financial support for her business. She enjoys being part of a community microfinance group, because all its members are very responsible and supportive. She appreciates her group members supporting her with the loan, as the money will be very useful in the development of her business. With the loan she is requesting, Luz will invest in the purchase of a second-hand kneading machine.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kneading machine

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Blessing”. She is 51 years old, is widowed, and has five children who range from 10 to 34 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to poverty.

For ten years, Elizabeth has been selling rice, cooking oil, sugar, flour and pepper in Chicken Soup Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

Elizabeth plans to use her 25,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 65,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, sugar and flour. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Elizabeth’s dream is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, sugar and flour to sell

loans.name: Digna Del Carmen

texts.es:
DIGNA DEL CARMEN V. J., Trabaja como Conserje  en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
Toda la plata que ha trabajado  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, .

ES MADRE SOLTERA DE DOS HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, MADERA Y CEMENTO Y ARENA PARA CAMBIAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA Y REFORZAR LAS PAREDES.
texts.en:
Digna Del Carmen V. J. is the single mother of two school-aged children and works as a counselor in the Manuel Olivares Ramirez institution. She has used all of the money that she has gotten through Ceprodel to make improvements to her home. She will use the money from this loan to buy building materials, such as zinc metal sheeting, lumber, cement and sand so that she can replace her roof and reinforce the walls.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 34 years old, married, and has three children between 5 and 13 years old.  All of her children go to school.  Her husband is a salesman for Inyange, a company that makes its own products and distributes them across the country.  

Jacqueline sells a variety of things, including clothes, fabrics, sunflower oil, and tea leaves.  She believes the success of her business comes from her good customer care and low prices. Her clients also appreciate the products she sells.  With the loan, Jacqueline plans to increase her inventory.  Eventually, she hopes to start a business selling only food crops, such as beans and sorghum.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Glicer de 33 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Enma esta ubicado en el centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, ella esta convencida que la variedad de sus productos incrementaran sus ventas, es por eso que se esmera mucho en no repetir modelos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus tejido hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas tejidas. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Enma, 45, is an unassuming, hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Glicer, 33, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Enma’s business is located in San Pedro de Cajas’ Artisan Center. She is convinced that the variety of her products are the reason for her increased sales. This is why she tries hard not to repeat any of her designs. What she most enjoys about her work is weaving and the more she does it the better she feels. Besides, this makes it possible for her to pay for her children’s education. She’s been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to take her weavings all the way to her sales booth because she lives quite far from there. For the future she’d like to gather enough money to set up a store where she can sell her items more comfortably. This is her 3rd loan with MFP; she is very punctual with her repayments because she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she is very happy and knows that it will help her progress. She wil use the requested 500 new soles to buy wool to increase the amount of items she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool to increase her production of weavings.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 35 years old and married. She cooks and sells banana cues and other local delicacies. She also sells RTW clothes to her community. Marlyn struggled to sustain her business but was able to increase her cooking and selling again. She hopes for her business to grow and give her family a stable income.

Marlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients and additional RTW clothes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and additional RTW (Ready to Wear) clothes to sell

loans.name: Chopotrer Group

texts.es: Doña Gabriela Z. O.,es madre soltera, ha cursado el Cuarto grado primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales   siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica al agropecuario crianza de animales, tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Chipotrer, el grupo cuenta con Seis  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, Artesanía elaboración de playeras Camisas  y blusas,  y crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de animales para la crianza de  estos animales  y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en Asdir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela Z. O. is a single mother.  She finished fourth grade.  She has two children still in her care.  She raises cattle.  She’s been in this line of work for 15 years.

With enthusiasm and the support of a few neighbors they formed a group to request a loan.  The communal bank is called “Chipotrer” and it has six women members who are engaged in a variety of activities among which we can mention: raising animals, crafts, shirt and blouse making, raising domestic animals.

The loan will be used to buy animals to raise thus increasing sales.  One of the difficulties of being the business owner has been the lack of capital but, with help from her children and from the Asdir loan she is asking for, she hopes her business will be bigger and more productive.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Don Juan Francisco D. de 51 años de edad, habita junto a su esposa Maria Dolores Romero Meneses y sus hijos en la Comarca San Patricio, Comalapa, su esposa le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y sus hijos trabajan con él en el Campo, ejerce labores agricolas y comercializa ganado de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales y de esta manera brindar la alimentacion a la familia, es una persona muy responsable y con capacidad de pago.  

esta solicitando su segundo credito a afodenic esta vez con el apoyo de Kiva para invertirlo en siembra de 10 manzanas de trigo el que sera cosechado y comercializado en su tiempo de saca.  

su mayor sueño es producir mas para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Juan Francisco D. is 51 years old and lives with his wife, Maria Dolores Romero Meneses, and their children in Comarca San Patricio, Comalapa. His wife helps in domestic duties and their children work with him in the fields. He farms and sells the products, which is how they obtain their monthly income. In this way he provides food for his family. He is a very responsible person who is capable of repaying. 

He is asking for his second loan from Afodenic with the help of Kiva to invest in the sowing of ten 7,000 square meter units of wheat that will be harvested and sold in the harvesting period. 

His greatest dream is to produce more products in order to better his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: For the sowing of ten 7,000 square meter units of grains.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia F. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Virginia is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snaks in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Princesitas Del Mar Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Princesitas del Mar, está ubicado en Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por su tradicional carnaval de Semana Santa con el típico baile del Chínelo acompañado de varias bandas de viento, así como por su gran balneario Las Estacas con su manantial de aguas cristalinas. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. La Sra. Amalia Castañeda O. es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos negocio que inicio hace 9 años. Solicita su préstamo para comprar más producto, tiene 52 años, estudio hasta el 6º año de primaria es divorciada, tiene  3 hijas, sólo una de 16 años vive con ella, con su negocio espera pagar los gastos de la escuela de su hija,  Sus clientes están a gusto porque siempre encuentran los productos que  necesitan. Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque con el crédito podrá comprar más producto y obtendrá mayores ganancias con las que podrá comprar las piezas de su baño  para remodelarlo, ya que esta deteriorado.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Princesitas del Mar - "Little Princesses of the Sea". It is located in Morelos, in Mexico, a community which is noted for its traditional Holy Week carnival, celebrated with a local dance called the Chínelo which is accompanied by brass bands. It is also famous for the spa resort of Las Estacas, with its crystal clear springs.

The group has 12 members. Señora Amalia Castañeda O. is one of the members, and she has been selling cosmetics since she started the business 9 years ago. She is seeking the loan to buy more products. She is 52 years old, divorced, with 3 daughters. Only one of her daughters, the 16 year old, still lives with her. Señora Amalia completed 6th grade of primary school, and hopes that the earnings from her business will allow her to pay for her daughter's education. Her customers like coming to her because they always find the products they need. She is happy just now because with the loan she will be able to buy more products and earn more. With her earnings she will be able to buy bathroom fittings and renovate, because it is in a poor state.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo A. is from the town of Trinidad. He is married and has children. To make a living, Nilo owns & operates a fishing business gathering and selling seaweeds at the market. Nilo works hard to provide for his family and sustain his children's education.

Nilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nilo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including nets

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek R., 48, sells chickens and rice, earning an income of $8 USD per day. R. is married and lives with her husband and four children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. The family has to spend $50 USD on food, $15 USD on electricity supply and $50 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport chickens and rice for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport chickens and rice for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Flor de Coral, tiene 33 años y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 15 y 17 años de edad. Victoria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres. Ella también es propietaria de dos mototaxis, que utilizan para prestar servicios de transporte privado. Ha sido miembro de FINCA Perú durante 5 años, y en este tiempo muchas cosas en su vida han cambiado. Ella aprendió a ahorrar y con sus ahorros y crédito ha podido comprar sus mototaxis, un refrigerador para su tienda y un pedazo de tierra en Ayacucho. Victoria y su familia viven en la casa de sus padres, pero desea construir una casa para ella y su familia. Victoria hará uso de su próximo préstamo para invertir en la construcción de una casa y comprar los productos para su tienda porque la demanda es mayor durante las vacaciones. A ella le gusta trabajar con FINCA Perú porque le ayuda mucho. De las sesiones de formación previstas, Victoria ha aprendido sobre el empoderamiento de la mujer y la familia. Victoria sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Flor de Coral" community bank.  She is 33 years old and has three children aged 3, 15 and 17.

Victoria has a grocery store in her parents' home.  She is also the owner of two 'mototaxis' (auto rickshaws) which are used to provide private transport services.  Victoria has been a member of FINCA Perú for 5 years and, during this time, many things have changed in her life.  She has learned to save and, with her savings and her loans, she has been able to buy her 'mototaxis', a refrigerator for her store and a piece of land in Ayacucho.

Victoria and her family live in her parents' home but she would like to build a house for herself and her family.  Victoria will use her loan to invest in building her house and in buying products for her store because demand is higher during the holidays.  She likes working with FINCA Perú because it helps her a lot.  Victoria has learned about empowering women and the family from our training sessions.  She dreams of her children becoming professionals.

loans.use: To buy products for her store

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 31 years old. She has two children aged 6 and 8. She owns a shop in which she sells soft drinks, Vaseline, soap, sugar and salt. Françoise is requesting a loan in order to buy more Vaseline, soap, and salt to increase her profits. Françoise’s business is doing well and she has been in this business for 10 years. With the profits she hopes to buy food for her family and put aside some savings.

loans.use: Buying more items for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal
